loans.name: Alvin Alis

texts.es: El señor Alvin Alis L.,  tiene la edad de 50 años,  habita en la Concepción, junto a su esposa y  hijos, la señora le ayuda con el negocio en la casa de habitación, este señor desde hace doce años tiene una pulpería la cual atiende su esposa, el trabaja como albañil para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar, con sus propios esfuerzos han logrado mantener un poco el negocio y la mano amiga de Afodenic. Los sueños de de don Ali es llegar a  tener una micelania, con esta solicitud del préstamo va para incrementar su negocio y poder realizar sus sueños. Don Ali argumenta que esta muy contento con nuestra institución ya que le han apoyado durante seis préstamo y le han dado la oportunidad de salir hacia delante con su familia
texts.en:
Alvin Alis L. is 50 years old, and lives in Concepción with his wife and children. His spouse helps him with the business, which is in their house. This man has had a grocery store for twelve years which is tended to by his wife. He works in construction in order to cover the household expenses. Thourgh their own efforts, they have managed to maintain the business with the helping hand of Afodenic. Mr. Ali dreams of having a small general store and, with this loan, he hopes to grow his business and realize his dreams. Mr. Ali comments that he is very happy with our institution as it has supported him with six loans, and has given him the opportunity to get ahead along with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various products for his general store.

loans.name: Mayra Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Mayra tiene 54 años de edad, vive en un barrio de la capital de Managua llamado Villa Venezuela, casada, tiene tres hijos de 20, 28 y 29 años de edad, los cuáles dos ya se independizaron y otra estudia. Los planes para su familia es ofrecerle un patrimonio y mejor .Doña Luz tiene su tienda donde vende ropas, zapatos, cosméticos y otros. Desde hace cuatro años con la experiencia necesaria en la atención al cliente, iniciándolo con fondos propios y pocas cantidades de productos. Ahora sus objetivos a corto plazos es aumentar de volúmenes de ventas lo cual incrementara las ganancias. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar nuevos productos como: perfumes, ropas para dama, caballero y niño, artículos del hogar y escolares para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos
texts.en:
Mayra is 54 years old, married, and lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood of Managua. She has three children, ages 20, 28, and 29. Two of her children are no longer financially dependent on her, while one is a student. Her dream is to create a better life for her family.

Mayra has a shop where she sells clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other items. Having experience in customer service, she began her business four years ago with her own money and few products. Her short term goal is to increase sales volume and thereby increase her earnings.

Thanks to loans from Kiva's partner AFODENIC, she will be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products, including perfume, school supplies, household items, and clothing for men, women, and children.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing, perfume, and school supplies

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun S. A., 40, is married and lives in the province of Kampong Cham. She grows and sells yams to earn a living , something she has done since 2007, and is able to make $1.50 a day. She lives with her husband, four children and her parents. Her husband is a blacksmith and makes about $4 each day. Sun is asking for a loan to purchase more steel for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase steel for her husband's blacksmith business.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Mrs. Chann L., 50, and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Pha, 55, live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have seven children: six sons and one daughter. Three of their children have full-time employment and one son is married and lives outside the family home.
 
Chann has been selling grocery items for two years. She buys them from Koky market a bit far from her village and sells them at her house. Her husband has been farming for 30 years; it’s a skill he learned from his parents. Chann is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Lam Thi

texts.vi: Chị Soa  năm nay 48  tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con huyện Hưng Nguyên Tỉnh Nghệ An. Hai con của chị đều đang tuổi đến trường còn chồng chị là thương binh, anh làm nghề sửa xe. Chị Soa hiện làm công việc thu  gom rác tại địa phương . Bên cạnh đó gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi lợn gà để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.  Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình chị là 4.000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư mua nguyên vật liệu sửa chữa nhà và chuồng trại phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Soa, 48 years old, is living with her husband and two children in Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An province. The two children are at school age, and her husband - a disabled veteran - works as a bike repairer. Mrs. Soa currently works as garbage collector in the area. In addition, her family also raises pigs and chickens to increase the family's income. The family's income currently is VND4,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND12,000,000 to buy materials to renovate the house and the barn for livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate house and barn for livestock

loans.name: Pheng's Group

texts.en: S. B. is 36 years old and is the leader of a group of three borrowers. He is the father of two children, both of whom are married and live separately from him. He is married to Chanseng, who is 29 years old and is a garment worker. S. B. is a blacksmith for the whole commune, which allows him to earn up to $5 per day. Whenever a house is built, the family who owns it always calls him to fix the doors, windows, and fence. He is taking a loan to buy hundreds of kilos of metal for his business.  The other group members are Y., a local farmer who is 60 years old and taking a loan to buy a door, and S., another local farmer who is 49 years old and applying for a loan to redecorate her house. They all live in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy metal for his business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth tiene 25 años, vive en casa de su suegra con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de anticuchos (brochetas de corazón de vaca con papas) y otras comidas en una esquina cerca de su casa. Cada día trabaja todas las tardes, sin ayuda de nadie, sin embargo ver crecer su negocio la llena de satisfacción, ya que antes vendía al aire libre, y ahora dispone de una carpa donde puede atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Con esta innovación que ella misma ha implementado ha notado que la clientela ha aumentado y eso le da más ánimos para continuar. El gran anhelo de Janeth es tener un local estable para su negocio. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, por ello que se siente bien porque paga del producto de su arduo trabajo. Janeth esta solicitando este dinero para la compra de carbón al por mayor, ya que es básico en su negocio. También adquirirá sacos de arroz, azúcar y menestras.
texts.en:
Janeth is 25 years old and lives in her mother-in-law’s home with her husband and their 2 children. She sells kebabs (skewers of cow’s heart with potatoes”) and other foods on a corner near her house. Each day, she works every afternoon without anyone’s help. However, seeing her business grow fills her with satisfaction. Before, she sold in the open air, and now she has a tent where she can tend to her clients with more comfort. With this innovation, which Janeth herself implemented, she has noticed that her clientele has expanded, and this gives her more energy to continue. Janeth’s great desire is to have an established locale for her business. This is the second time that she has had a loan with MFP. She is very punctual in [paying] her installments. For this reason, she feels good because she pays with the product of her hard work. Janeth is asking for this money to buy charcoal, which is necessary for her business. She will also purchase sacks of rice, sugar and vegetable stew.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal for her grill

loans.name: Abieyuwa

texts.en: Abieyuwa U. is 40 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is a tailor and she also sells tailoring materials like zippers, thread, lining, etc. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 (US $350) so that she can purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: la Señora Marta Nicolasa Sapón de cuarenta y un años de edad es originaria de la comunidad de Tototonicapán ella es de una familia de escasos recursos economicos, con el esfuerzo de sus hijos y de su esposo hace seis años decidieron hacer su propio negocios. en la compra y ventas de blusa y cortes tipicos para damas, hoy necesita del apoyo de ASDIR en un credito  para incrementar su negocio, y buscar nuevos mercados para el bienestar y desarrollo de la familia.
texts.en:
Marta Nicolasa Sapón is 41 years old and is originally from the Totonicapán community. She comes from a low-income family. Six years ago, with the help of her hardworking husband and children, Marta and her family decided to start their own business buying and selling traditional women's blouses and skirts. Today, they need a loan from ASDIR to restock their business and look for new markets for their products in order to promote the well-being and development of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blouses and skirts

loans.name: Maksud

texts.en: Maksud is a hard-working entrepreneur from Shahrituz, Tajikistan. He has operated his own business of producing wooden doors and window frames for the past nine years. He has extensive experience in this field and his skills are very much in demand. He works hard to earn a good income to support his family. He and his wife have four children. Maksud has requested a loan of 6,500 Somoni to buy some tools and wood that he needs for his business. Maksud appeals to your generosity so that he can improve his family’s living conditions. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy tools and wood for manufacturing doors and window frames

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria C. is 58 years old, married with two children, and resides at Adorable, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Asteria’s loan is intended to buy vitamins and feeds for her piglets. She admitted that with the help of PMPC micofinance, her business has grown in such a way that she has a better income now than before. The family hopes to have a comfortable life someday and be able to send their children to school and have their own decent life in the future, too.

loans.use: To purcahse feeds and vitamins for her piglets

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Марифат,женщина 49 лет.Замужем,имеет двоих детей.Муж подрабатывает на стройке.Она занимается продажей нижнего белья. Товар она закупает из оптового рынка Атуш. Она хотела бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов.Для этого она предпочла взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента.
texts.en:
Marifat is a 49-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband works part-time at a construction site. Marifat sells undergarments. She buys her merchandise at the Atush wholesale market. She wants to expand her merchandise selection because good selection attracts more customers. For this, she preferred to obtain a loan and expand her merchandise selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding merchandise selection

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 19 años, es una joven soltera muy alegre, vive en casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Aunque todavía es muy joven, está decidida a trabajar muy duro para ya no depender de sus padres, puesto que siente que es hora de sobresalir por sí misma. Ella realiza tejidos artesanales, los cuales luego lleva a vender a su puesto de venta que está ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca). Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y más aun si son artesanías, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los tejidos hasta su puesto de venta, puesto que le resulta muy cansado. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda muy grande de ropa tejida a mano, en la cual pueda vender con más tranquilidad y atender mejor a sus clientes. Ya son 2 los préstamos que Maritza ha solicitado en MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su banco comunal, donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará mejores materiales para elaborar más tejidos artesanales y así incrementar la cantidad que tiene en stock.
texts.en:
Maritza is 19 years old and is a very cheerful, single young woman who lives in her parents' home and hopes to help them with household expenses. Though she is still very young, she is determined to work very hard so that she doesn't have to depend on her parents, since she thinks the moment has come for her to excel on her own. She is a weaver, and sells her work from her stand on the Laguna Temporal esplanade (a place in the city of Juliaca where markets are held). Her favorite part of the work is weaving. She has had this business for the past two years, and says that the most difficult part is moving the weavings to her stand, since it is very tiring. In the future, she hopes to have a very large store to sell hand-woven clothing, so that she can sell in a calmer environment and better serve her customers. Maritza has already taken out two previous loans from Microfinanzas Prisma. She has been very punctual with her payments, and has never had any problems with her village bank, where she is in charge of being cheerful and putting all her fellow group members in a good mood. With the requested loan of 2,000 soles, she will buy better materials to do more weavings and increase the number of weavings she has in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy weaving materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To condition the taco stand for food sales

loans.name: Widad

texts.en:
Widad is a 46-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa Valley with her husband and their four children. Widad has owned a bakery for a year. She bakes saj bread and mankoucheh. A “saj” is the traditionA. Lebanese dome-shaped metA. oven on which she makes saj bread (like pita), markouk (“thinned”) bread, and doughy confections called mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza and is most often topped with are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat these delicacies at any time of the day, but somehow, they taste better in the morning. 

Widad has requested a loan of $1500 USD from A. Majmoua to purchase raw materiA. for her bakery. This is the first time that Widad has requested a loan.

Widad is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and bakes good mankoucheh. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided to start her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for her bakery.

loans.name: Lilian Kizza's Group

texts.en:
Lilian is the leader of a 2-member group. She is 29 and married with 3 children aged between 4 and 10 years old. All her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with six people. They have electricity but no piped water at home The family gets three meals a day.

Lilian works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She works in Ntinda market near Kampala city selling matooke (green bananas). Lilian works seven days a week and doesn’t incur any additional transport because she buys from her place of work. Lillian sells to an average of 25 customers a day and sells to all categories of people on retail.

Lillian has been in this business for five years and has been a member of MCDT for six years, servicing her twelfth loan. Lillian's monthly expenses include rent and also daily market dues. She wants to buy more bananas and aspires to sell only wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario C. manages a 1 hectare rice field in Banga, South Cotabato.  She is 39 years old with 5 children.  The eldest of her children is still 17 years old.  She also raised 3 pigs as another source of income for her family.

January 2007, she joins Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in order to have a loan with a lower interest rate.  She's now requesting a loan of Php 15,000 to help finance her existing business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Remigia

texts.en:
Remigia is engaged in a direct-selling business and, at the same time, manages their rice fields. She is happily married to Delfin and they are blessed with three children: Lexington - 27 years old, a college graduate; Loraine - 18 years old, at college level; and Lexter - 13 years old, a high school student.

Remigia and Delfin are striving hard to sustain all the needs of their family. Her direct selling business is improving and she wants to buy more products due to the demands of her customers. For this reason, she would like to request financial support from Kiva lenders of PHP 15,000. The loan will be used to purchase more products and for the maintenance of their farm. She is hoping that she will be able to obtain the loan amount she is requesting.

Remigia is looking forward for her family needs. She is praying that she will be able to continue to support her children until they finish their college education.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her rice-farming and direct-selling businesses

loans.name: Lê Thị's Group

texts.en:
"H. Lê Thị (10107070060) is a 43 year-old woman living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. H. is the group leader of a 3-member group L. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Xuân Trạch 07 (5).

H. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, H. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising ducks for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 5.300.000 VND from SEDA. This previous L. was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She is now requesting a new L. of 6.322.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 5th L. taken out by the borrower from SEDA. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Đào Thị L. (10107070014) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND L. to support her fishing business.

2. Nguyễn Thị T. (10107070011) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND L. to support her manufacturing business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

H. Lê Thị (10107070060) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Xuân Trạch 07 (5).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi vịt để bán. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND. Vào 2006, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.300.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.322.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Đào Thị L. (10107070014) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.

2. Nguyễn Thị T. (10107070011) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva."

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo tiene 31 años, está casado con el amor de su vida, Manuela de 28 años; con quien tiene tres hijos: Nancy de 10, Edwin de 8 y Cynthia de 5 años. Todos ellos viven juntos en una pequeña casa bajo el tranquilo cielo de la ciudad de Tarma.

Desde muy niño él veía a sus padres cultivar la tierra fértil que pisaba de casualidad jugando, así entre sus travesuras aprendió todas las técnicas de la agricultura y luego de varios años, cuando formó su propia familia, pudo empezar a ponerlas en práctica. Hoy cultiva papa de distintas clases y la comercializa a los mayoristas que lo buscan por la calidad de este tubérculo. 
Marcelo vive cómodamente de esta actividad que le permite mantener a su esposa y a sus pequeños hijos, no tiene un horario fijo, trabaja desde que amanece hasta que cae la tarde y siempre piensa en innovar las técnicas de la agricultura, es por eso que busca combinar semillas para luego sembrar un tipo de papa más grande, ese es un proyecto a corto plazo que tiene por cumplir; además piensa seguir dedicándose a esta actividad porque tiene mucha experiencia y también porque le es rentable para poder vivir.

Es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual como siempre, además ya tiene planeado comprar con el crédito abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras. Asimismo, adquirirá una mejor calidad de semilla de papa que le asegurará una buena producción y un alto rendimiento en el futuro.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 31 years old. He is married to the love of his life, Manuela, who is 28. They have three children: Nancy, 10, Edwin, 8, and Cynthia, 5. They live together in a small house under the peaceful skies of the city of Tarma.

From a young age, Marcelo saw his parents cultivating the fertile soil that he walked on while playing. In this way, he learned the techniques of agriculture that many years later, when he started his own family, he put into practice. Today, he grows many varieties of potatoes and sells them to wholesalers who seek him out for the quality of these tubers.

Marcelo lives comfortably from this work, which allows him to support his wife and children. He doesn’t have a fixed schedule; he works from dawn until nightfall, and is always thinking about innovations in agricultural techniques. For example, he is working on a hybrid potato that will be larger. This is a short-term project that is nearly complete. Marcelo plans to continue with agriculture because he has so much experience and because it is profitable.

This is Marcelo’s third loan with MFP, and he promises to be punctual as always. It will be used to buy manure and fertilizer for his fields and also a better quality of seed, which will assure good production and a high yield in the future.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 27 years old and is married without children. He and his wife live in Musanze, a region of Ruhengeri, in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

Samuel is proud to have been a self-employed businessman for five successful years. He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Sunday. His wife works in the business of animal husbandry and earns a small income as well.

Samuel is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. He plans to use the loan to buy more bags and luggage for sale. Any additional profits will be reinvested in his business in order to improve his financial stability. He also hopes to improve the well being of his extended family and build a secure future for them in the process.

loans.use: To buy more bags and luggage for sale

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael buys building materials in bulk and supplies these to retail shops in her community. She has been in this business for close to 12 years. She started borrowing from LAPO three years ago. Her previous loan allowed her to set up a permanent shop, and she sells and receives her supplies there now; she has finished repaying this loan.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of N140,000, which will to enable her buy building materials in bulk at a discount.

Rachael is 43 years old. Her husband is a civil servant, and they have three lovely children who are in a private primary school. She sends a warm thank you to all Kiva lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly, as she is proud to say that she has always done in the past.

loans.use: To purchase building materials in bulk

loans.name: Brenda Geraldin

texts.es: Brenda tiene 21 años de edad es soltera, ella vive con su madre en casa de sus abuelos, ella se dedica como azafata, actualmente esta laborando en un restaurant como azafata, ella esta laborando hace 2 años en el mismo lugar, es una persona muy joven con muchas y metas y objetivos, una de ellas es poder realizar estudios superiores,  con el dinero que solicita invertira para poner un pequeño negocio de la venta de ropa, para que se pueda ayudar.
texts.en:
Brenda is 21 years old and single. She lives with her mother in her grandparents’ house. Currently, she works as a hostess in a restaurant. Brenda has been working in the same place for two years. She is a very young person with many goals and objectives. One of these is to be able to obtain higher education. With the money that she is applying for she will invest in starting a small business selling clothing so that she can help herself.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a small business selling clothing

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en:
Yudaya is 50 years old and a single mother of two children aged 18 and 24. Both her children go to school. She lives in her own two-roomed house with three other people. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. At home Yudaya has access to electricity but no piped water. Her family eats three meals a day. Her three greatest expenses in the month are paying utility bills, her children's school fees, and rent for her business premises.
Yudaya fries food such as samosas and chapatti in Kasubi and sells them to all sorts of people. She works seven days a week and serves about 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for six years now. Her main challenges are seasonal fluctuations, the rainy season (which disturbs her a lot because she works from a muddy place which prevents customers from reaching her), and the ever-increasing prices of baking flour and cooking oil.
Yudaya has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for three years and is now servicing her sixth loan. She has always worked with the same group of mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more cartons of baking flour and jerrycans of cooking oil. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and be able to start a fully stocked bakery.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of baking flour and jerrycans of cooking oil

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina loves her business and that is why she hopes to excel in her business. She sells dried fish at retail prices to her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell. She is married with 5 children, and her youngest child is 12 years old. Her children are excelling in school and this gives her joy. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria P. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 44 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Gleceria owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Gleceria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gleceria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gleceria is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan Gleceria has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Like most of the people in Agusan Del Sur, Mary Grace is involved in rice farming. She is 33 years old, married and has four children. Her oldest is aged 14. She and her husband agreed to make their children’s education a top priority, so both of them work hard to achieve their goal. 

Mary Grace is in need of farm inputs. She is seeking a loan amounting to 14,000 Philippine pesos. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other inputs.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe started with a small amount of capital for her sari-sari (variety) store in 2001. Now, with all her efforts to make it bigger, she is able to provide the financial needs of her three children in sending them to school. She is 36 years old and lives in Talibon, Bohol.

Ma. Fe needs additional capital of Php 15,000 as a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy groceries for her store and make it more productive.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza P. is from the village of Rogongon, Iligan City. She is 38 years old. Liza is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Liza runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Liza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Liza from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke sells foodstuffs and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a shopping mall in the future. She is 50 years old, married with 5 children. She is requesting for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Yolanda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Yolanda  lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Rosa Lisbeth B. M.  de 29 años quien tiene desde hace tres años  un salón de belleza el cual ha ido creciendo y le permitió instalar  una pequeña venta en su casa la cual mira su madre. Ella invertirá el crédito en artículos de belleza ya que se acerca el día de la madre que es cuando mas clientes llegan.  
Sus compañeras de grupo Julia del Socorro L. E. se dedica al comercio de cosméticos desde hace años y Jamileth del Carmen A. L. realiza bolsos de macrabe actividad la cual lleva nueve años realizando.
texts.en:
The Yolanda group is comprised of three hard-working women. Rosa Lisbeth B. M., age 29, is one of them. She has had a beauty salon for three years. It has been growing, which has permitted her to set up a small sales business in her house. Her mother looks after the business. She will use the loan to buy beauty products because Mother’s Day is coming, and that is when she has the most customers. Julia del Socorro L. E., a colleague in the group, has been selling cosmetics for years. Her other colleague, Carmen A. L., makes macramé purses. She has been doing this for nine years.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty products

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Ines;   ella tiene 55 años de edad, la socia es casada, tiene 1 hijo, su conyugue es agricultor y ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, La socia se encarga de la administración de sus tienda de abarrotes en la provincia de Urubamba. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para implementar la tienda. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ines belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank and lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, Peru. Ines is 55 years old and married with one child. Her husband is a farmer and she has a small grocery store. She is the one responsible for the management of this store, located in Urubamba. She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise for her store. Ines values and is grateful for the support offered through microlending and promises to repay the loan as agreed.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie L. is from the village of Bliss, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years of age and married to Junicor L.. This couple has been blessed with 2 children: 1 is now at school age and the other one is still an infant.  Elvie is presently engage in operating a Sari-sari store where she also is dealing in cellphones and cell accessories. Aside from that, she is earning support from her husband who is a cellphone technician. Elvie has been engaged in this kind of business for 10 years already and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from her Sari-sari store and cellphone, cell accessories dealing businesses.

In April 2007, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital for her Sari-sari store, cellphone and cell accessories dealing business. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Elvie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, savings for future use especially for future business expansion and her children’s education.
 
 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing Sari-sari store, cellphone and cell accessories dealing businesses.

loans.name: Arlindo Domingos

texts.pt:
Arlindo Domingos D., nasceu na Província de Gaza, vive maritalmente é pai de 7 filhos de 2, 7, 15, 18, 25, 27 e 31 anos os quatro mas novos é que vão a escola. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta sua mãe que vive em Gaza enviando lhe algum valor monetário para despesas caseiras. 

Arlindo quando freqüentava a 9ª classe é recrutado para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório, após a independência é desmobilizado e passa a trabalhar como Policia de Guarda Fronteira. Hoje é chefe de repartição da informação e plano (guarda fronteira) ha mais de 30 anos, auferindo um salario de 13.978.31 que aplica nas despesas de casa e da obra. Esta a gerir um estabelecimento comercial no quartel, de nome (sondela) pagando 1.000.00mt mensal de aluguer, conta com ajuda de 3 empregados que auferem 1,200.00mt por individuo, tem como melhor produto de venda guisados, assados e petiscos tendo de lucro cerca de 10.000.00mt mensalmente onde também consegue poupar cerca de 2.000.00mt mensalmente porque também conta com ajuda da sua esposa que é docente.

 Já teve empréstimo noutra instituição e pagou cem problemas. Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Arlindo na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos(óleo, arroz, refeições e outros). Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo para construção do seu próprio estabelecimento.
texts.en:
Arlindo Domingos was born in the province of Gaza. He is in a common law marriage and is the father of 7 children who are 2, 7, 15, 18, 25, 27 and 31 years old. The youngest four are in school. He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his mother who lives in Gaza sending her some money for her household expenses. Arlindo was drafted for mandatory military service when he was in 9th grade. After the country's independence he left the service and started to work as a Border Patrol officer. He has been the Head of the Information and Planning Department of the Border Patrol for over 30 years. He earns a salary of 13,978.31 meticais, which goes towards household and construction expenses. He currently manages a business in the barracks named Sondela. He pays a rent of 1,000 meticais and is helped by 3 employees who make 1,200 meticais each. His bestselling products are stews, roasts and appetizers. He has a profit of 10,000 meticais and saves around 2,000 meticais per month since he is also helped by his wife who is a teacher. He has had loans with other institutions and paid them back without any problems. This is Arlindo's loan with Hluvuku and Kiva, in the amount of 25,000 meticais. He intends to purchase inventory (cooking oil, rice, meals and others). He is confident he will pay the loan back ahead of schedule and request another loan to build his own shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (cooking oil, rice, meals and others)

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 24-year-old man from Tulkarem. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a $290 salary. Muhammad also works in a plant nursery. 

Muhammad has a degree in nursing, but because he couldn't find a job in a hospital or medical center, he works for the Palestinian National Authority.

Muhammad is engaged and planning to get married this summer. Because his sources of income are limited, he took a $3,000 loan from FATEN to pay for his wedding expenses.

loans.use: Pay for his wedding expenses

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena K. is married and has four children. Her husband is a security man. She has attained senior high level of education.

Mena cooks rice at Takoradi to sell. She has been in this business for some time and uses her income to support her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for her home.

Mena will use the loan to purchase more rice and other ingredients to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and other ingredients to cook for sale

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edgar;  El socio tiene24 años de edad, el socio es soltero y es administrador de tortas Tota; el socio trabaja en las tiendas de el barrio magisterial,  av. La cultura y San Jeronimo.  El socio también tiene su negocio propio él tiene una tienda de distribución de gas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio y adquirir balones de gas para consumo domestico.      

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Little Treasure” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Edgar, he is 24 years old, single and manages Tota cakes in the stores in the Magisterial neighborhood, avenues of La Cultura and San Jeronimo. Edgar also has his own business where he distributes gas. The member needs the loan to invest in his business and to have tanks of gas for domestic consumption.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to invest in his business and to have tanks of gas for domestic consumption.

loans.name: Dashdavaa

texts.en:
Dashdavaa H. is 54 years old and lives with his wife in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All his children are married and live separately from their parents.

Dashdavaa operates a grocery business in his town. He started his business in 2000 with the help of his wife and has steadily grown his business over the years. He purchases all his vegetables from wholesale stores at a cheap price. He owns a cellar that can hold up to 10 tons of vegetables. His wife, Tsendsuren, usually sells a variety of vegetables in a local market as well. In addition, Dashdavaa runs a taxi service in the morning and evening to supplement his earnings.

Dashdavaa is a very optimistic and hardworking person who has more than ten years of business experience. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory such as soup, washing powder, toilet paper and other products at wholesale prices for his grocery business. He hopes to have his own workplace in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Naseem Manzoor Ahmad's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a resident of the city called Borewala famous in Pakistan for its shrines. She is a vigorous lady. Through being a housewife, she handles her clothes selling business well. She gives the necessary time to her family and to her business. She started her clothes selling business four years ago to supplement her family's income. 

She buys clothes from the city of Faisalabad which is famous for its textile industry and sells the clothes to different clothes shops and in the community as well. She also gets orders from clothes shops due to her good collection of clothes and earns a good profit by completing them on time.

Her husband's name is M. A. and he is a carrier by trade. He uses a donkey cart for loading items such as construction supplies and fruits and vegetables delivering them to designated places. He has been doing this work for over five years.

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy a new donkey cart because his current cart is not in good condition making it difficult for him to put loads into it and he faces problems in doing his job properly.

She is hopeful that with the new cart her husband will be able to work better and earn more income.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for a carrier business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional cigarettes and other provisions

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria S. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 39 years old. Gloria is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Nora's Group

texts.en:
Nora D. is from the village of Cataggaman Nuevo, Tuguegarao City. She is 38 years old. Nora is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nora is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Nora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Nora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and feed. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Nora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and feed

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos L. Sr. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 56 years old. Carlos is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Carlos owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. He also buys and sells a variety of fish, like sardines and mackerel. Carlos has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP, a month.

In 2010, Carlos joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carlos has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional and new fishing nets. Carlos is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Carlos from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kum

texts.en:
Kum P. is a 41-year-old woman, married to Pao Chan, age 45.  They both appear in the picture here.  Her husband helps her in her business, and often chops firewood in and around his community in order to make additional income. 

This old couple lives with two school-aged children and earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland.  Kum P. currently plants a potato crop, which she will harvest and sell when they mature. Recently, her crop is growing well and she can get a great success from her business. 

Kum P. is pregnant now. The number in her family is small so she cannot harvest her crop on time.  Kum Phean will use her loan to hire a domestic laborer to harvest her potato crop.

loans.use: To hire a domestic laborer to harvest potato crop

loans.name: Rubidia Abigail Mejía Bonilla

texts.es: Rubidia Abigail M. B. de 41 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, en el departamento de Cuscatlán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, sus suegros y un hijo. Ella posee una tienda en la cual vende productos alimenticios como cereales, comida enlatada y otros productos más los cuales son de primera necesidad el negocio se encuentra en su casa de habitación. Rubidia es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se dedica por completo a atender su negocio y a cuidar a su hijo  quien se dedica a estudiar.  Rubidia solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos perecederos y de esta manera surtir la tienda lo más posible, ya que de esta forma ella podrá atender a más clientela. Todo eso lo hace ya que espera mejorar su economía familiar y así brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Rubidia Abigail M. B. is 41 years old and lives in Cojutepeque in the department of Cuscatlán, with her husband, her in-laws and her son. In the house she has a store from which she sells food products such as cereals, canned goods and other basic food items. 

Rubidia is a very hardworking woman, who is totally dedicated to her business and to taking care of her son who is a student. She is requesting a loan as she really wants to be able to buy larger quantities of perishable goods and thus stock up her store as much as possible, allowing her to satisfy more customers. 

Rubidia is doing all this in the hope that she can improve her household economy and thus provide a better future for her son.

loans.use: To buy perishable goods.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe LAFIA sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à LAFIABOUGOU  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso,(3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers tels les condiments alimentaires avec KOROTOUMOU D.. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 12 paniers de condiments de différentes sortes (20 kg d’oignon, des poivres, piments poudre de gombo, feuilles de baobab, cubes maggies, concentrées de tomates, etc.)  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso auprès ds grossistes. Elle vend à Sikasso au marché de Médine et à  domicile, en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement des  femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille; l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group named Lafia are mostly married women who are on average 33 years old and have 2 children each. They live in monogamous families in Lafiabougou, a quarter in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They have sought out their first loan with the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) in order to meet client demand. This group of women sells a variety of merchandise, such as condiments with Korotoumou D.. 

With their loan, they will purchase 12 baskets of a variety of condiments (20 kg each of onions, green peppers, gombo chili powder, baobab leaves, bullion cubes, tomato paste, etc). They make their purchases from the wholesalers in the large market in Sikasso. They sell their products in Sikasso, in the market of Medine and from their home. They complete the sales in cash and often on credit. Their clientele is mostly made up of women. 

Their forecasted earnings are a monthly sum of 45 FCFA, a part of which will be put away in savings and part will be used for the family's expenses.  The rest will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase condiments.

loans.name: Chrek

texts.en: Chrek K., age 30, makes a living by selling fish. She and her husband buy fish from the rural areas at a reasonable price and sell it to gain a profit. Chrek K. currently earns an average of US $6.80 a day, and she has been running her business for three years. Chrek K. is the mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. Chrek K. and her husband always used their existing motorcycle for picking up their fish to sell in the mobile place. Unfortunately, their old motorcycle broke down while driving, which may affect their transportation. To deal with this problem, Chrek K. is applying for a loan to buy a used motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle to replace her broken one.

loans.name: Mburukuja Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se llama Mburukuja y se encuentra en su décimo-primer ciclo.
La Sra. Fernanda F. de 59 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y vende ropas o las distribuye en las tiendas de la ciudad de Asunción y en otras localidades cercanas; lo realiza en horas de la tarde  y regresa a su casa ya cuando oscurece.
Es una señora muy trabajadora y valiente porque lucha día a día para poder salir adelante con sus hijos.
Lo que anhela es tener su propio local. De esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de sus dos hijos, que estudian.
texts.en:
This existing committee is called “Mburukuja” and in its eleventh loan cycle.

Sra. Fernanda F. is 59 years old and has two children. She sells clothing and distributes them to stores in the city of Asunción and other locations nearby. Fernanda performs her work in the afternoons and returns home after dark. She is a hardworking and courageous woman who struggles day after day so that she and her children can move forward. Her greatest wish is to have her own store. This will allow her to provide for her household expenses and support her two children who are in school.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, buttons, ribbons, elastic, and other materials for making clothes to sell

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clorinda; la socia tiene 42 años es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende otro tipo de productos como gaseosas, golosinas, fideos, aceite entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio del cual se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca  su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank ” RICHARY ANTEÑA.” The bank is located in the Anta district belonging to the Anta province and the Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Clorinda, she is 42 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. She alternates her activities with her grocery store business where she sells basic products like rice, sugar, and milk. She also sells other types of products such as soft drinks, candy, noodles, and oil, amongst others. She has had this business for years and is happy because through this business she is helping her family to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more merchandise for her business. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with her repayments.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Luvizminda

texts.en: Luvizminda is a 61-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing/fish vending business. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing/fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. Luvizminda is borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Luvizminda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Miguel se denomina "Las Mercedes", surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el 9º ciclo ahora, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2008.
La presidenta del comité es la Sra. Tomasa B., es soltera y tiene 7 hijos, todos independientes, ella trabaja en su domicilio desde hace varios años, tiene una despensa muy bien surtida.
La Sra. Tomasa desea invertir el crédito de la fundación en la compra de mercaderías en cantidad (al por mayor), para volver a surtir su despensa lo que la ayudaría a ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes y mayor variedad de productos.
Ella se encuentra muy agradecida ya que gracias a Kiva y Fundación Paraguaya puede mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
This group from San Miguel neighborhood is called 'Las Mercedes'.  The group was formed as a result of promotional activities that Fundación Paraguaya carried out in the local area.  The group is now in its ninth loan cycle and has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2008.

The president of this committee is Tomasa B. who is single and has 7 children who all live independently.  She has a very well-stocked grocery store in her home and has been working there for several years.  Tomasa would like to invest her loan in buying merchandise in bulk (wholesale) so that she can re-stock her store.  This will help her to offer her customers better prices and a better variety of products.

Tomasa is very grateful since, thanks to Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya, she is able to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy food products, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Jocelyn Sinarao's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. Jocelyn is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Jocelyn is 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
Cruz de 57 años, es una mujer trabajadora que un día con la ayuda de su esposo puso su negocio de papelería en su domicilio ya que por su sector no había y así reunió dinero y compro materiales escolares  para complementar en su papelería.

Ella atiende su negocio desde las 7H00 am a 8H00 pm vendiendo útiles escolares y de oficina a estudiante y a clientes de su sector en compañía de su esposo. Un de su dificultades en el trabajo fue que un día por quedarse hasta tarde le quisieron robar por tal motivo el bazar esta abierto hasta las 8h00pm. con el préstamo desea comprar útiles escolares, papelería en general para así mejorar sus ingresos. En un futuro ella quiere expandir su negocio de papelería y ayudar a su esposo con la tercena que tiene para construí de arriba de su casa hacerla de 2 piso.
texts.en:
Cruz, 57 years old, is a hardworking woman. One day, with the help of her husband, she opened a stationary store in her home since there wasn't one in her area. She got some money together and bought some school supplies to supplement the stationary. 

She works from 7:00am until 8:00pm selling school and office supplies to students and customers from her area, with help from her husband. One of the most difficult parts of the job was that one day when she was open late, she was robbed; for that reason, the store is open until 8pm. With the loan she wants to buy school supplies and general paper products to improve her income. In the future she wants to expand her paper goods business and help her husband with his butcher shop, so that they can build a second story onto their home.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and stationary

loans.name: María Moncerrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

Aquí conocimos a la señora María, tiene 51 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos que es soltero vive con ella. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos que recibió del banco ella empezó su negocio que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones.

Es una gran mujer que se dedica a lavar ropa ajena y en sus ratos libres se dedica  al comercio,  vende productos de Avon, Lebel, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días tanto en sus lavados de ropa como en sus ventas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, ella aprovecha para visitar a sus clientes en las noches después de que ellos salen de sus trabajos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que lleva dos años que se dedica a esta actividad comercial.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.

Sus sueños son tener buena salud y fuerzas para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Union y Solidaridad" meets twice a month in the San Pablo parish of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we meet Maria, 51, who is a single mother with 3 grown children.  The youngest of these is single and lives with her.  She has been in her communal bank for 4 years, and she likes it because with one of the loans she received from the bank she started her own business, which has brought her a lot of satisfaction.

She is a great woman who works outside the house washing clothes, and in her free time she has a business selling products from the Avon, Lebel, and Yanbal line (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories.)  Every day she works washing clothing and also goes door-to-door to take orders for her beauty products. She takes the opportunity to visit with her customers in the evenings after they have returned home from work. She sells her products on credit and collects every week. She tells us that she has been selling beauty products for 2 years.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewelry.

Her dream is to have good health, and the strength to carry on.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewelry

loans.name: Solidario Kairos Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO KAIROS.

ESTE GRUPO ESTA INTEGRADO POR LAS SIGUIENTES SEÑORAS VILMA ,ETELVINA Y MARTA, VILMA ES MADRE DE DOS HIJOS PEQUEÑOS ,ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE TEJIDOS A MANO FAJAS Y GUIPILES, Y TAMBIEN VENDE JUGOS DE NARANJA POR LAS MAÑANAS,SOLICICTA SU CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA CONFECCION DE TEJIDOS. ETELVINA, ELLA SE DEDICA ALA ELABORACION DE GUIPILES A MANO ELLA TIENE A UNA PERSONA QUE LA AYUDA A ELABORAR SU PRODUCTO, MARTA OTILIA ELLA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE GUIPILES A MANO A ELLA LA AYUDA UNA SU HIJA, LAS TRES NECESITAN SU CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA ELAVORACION DE TEJIDOS PORQUE ELLAS EXPRESAN QUE SU PRODUCTO SE VENDE TIENE DEMANDA PERO LO QUE LES HACE FALTA ES MATERIA PRIMA PARA ELABORAR MAS PRODUCTO.
texts.en:
SOLIDARIO KAIROS.

This group is made up of the following ladies: Vilma, Etelvina and Marta.

Vilma is a mother of two young children.  She weaves belts and traditional blouses by hand.  She also sells orange juice in the mornings.  She is requesting her loan to buy raw materials for making her woven products.

Etelvina weaves traditional blouses by hand.  She has one person who helps her to make her products.

Marta Otilia also weaves traditional blouses by hand.  One of her daughters helps her in her work.

The three ladies need this loan so that they can buy raw materials for making their woven products.  They say that they have demand for their products but lack raw materials which they need to make more of them.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving products

loans.name: Anzor

texts.en:
Anzor is a farmer from the village of Bolojauri, South Georgia. He is 53 years old and lives with his family: his wife Nana, his 27- and 23-year old sons, 14-year-old daughter and daughter-in-law. 

All adult members of the family are involved in family agricultural activities. They have one milk cow, the dairy products of which are sold locally. In addition, the family owns 1.25 ha agricultural land where the following vegetables are grown: potato, cabbage, onion, garlic, and beet. Part of the harvested vegetables is sold locally to the retailers and the other part is sold on the open market in Akhaltsikhe (a nearby town). 

With the requested loan, Anzor will purchase seeds for potatoes. This year he will plant more potatoes in comparison with the last years. It is caused by the increased price of the potatoes on the local market. Anzor hopes that their vegetables will be sold for a good price and he'll get his planned income. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the family’s farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for potatoes

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Lydia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her sari-sari (variety) store business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr:
L'emprunteur   est un plombier qui exerce dans ce métier depuis 07 ans. Il est spécialiste dans l’installation, l’entretien et la réparation de réseaux d’alimentation en eau potable, de lavabos, de toilettes.Il démarre son travail à 8 heures et descend à 19H.  Il est marié sans enfants.Il vie avec ses 6 freres et ses deux parents.Toute cette famille est a sa charge.Il paie ainsi les frais mensuels de scolarité de ses frères.Il dépenses 80000 FCFA par mois pour l’alimentation et achète fréquemment des médicaments pour sa maman qui est très maladive.
Malgré toutes ces charges, il se bat et arrive à gagner des chantiers.Il est sociétaire de l'IMCEC depuis 2006 et a bénéficié de trois prêts qu’il a remboursés intégralement sans retards. Actuellement, il sollicite un quatrième prêt de 400 000FCFA pour renforcer son matériel de plomberie en achetant 09 clefs, 02 piques, 03 pelles, 06 marteaux, 07 brins et 01 moteur neuf pour sa moto. Ce matériel lui permettra d’équiper ses apprentis, de les répartir dans ses différents chantiers et de faciliter ses déplacements.
Avec les bénéfices tirés de ces investissements,l'emprunteur pourra mieux prendre en charge l’alimentation de sa famille, l’éducation de ses frères et la santé de sa maman. Il pourra aussi augmenter son épargne et  son  personnel. Son ambition est d’acheter une voiture pour élargir ses activités dans d’autres villes.
texts.en:
This borrower is a plumber who has been in this business for 7 years. He specializes in installing, maintaining and repairing potable water delivery systems, sinks and toilets. He begins work at 8am and finishes at 7pm. He is married without children, and lives with his 6 brothers and both his parents. He supports his whole family, and pays the monthly school fees for his brothers. He spends 80,000 FCFA each month for food, and frequently buys medicine for his mother, who is quite ill.
In spite of all his responsibilities, he fights in order to gain work opportunities. He is a member of UIMCEC since 2006 and has already taken out three loans which he has repaid on time. Now, he is asking for a fourth loan of 400,000 FCFA in order to buy new plumbing tools, including 9 keys, 2 spades, 3 shovels, 6 hammers, 7 blades and a new engine for his motorbike. These materials will help him equip his apprentices to send them to his different worksites, and help with their transport.
With the profits gained from his investments, the borrower will be better able to take care of the responsibilities of purchasing food for his family, educating his brothers and caring for his mother. He will also be able to increase his savings and add more employees. His ambition is to buy a car so that he can start working in other cities.

loans.use: to buy plumbing supplies and a new engine for his scooter

loans.name: Bokk Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Diom est créé le 14 mai 2010, il est composé de quatorze femmes issues de différents quartier de la ville mais qui sont unies par des liens d'amitié.


Ndéye Penda la responsable est âgée de 51 ans, mariée elle est mère de deux enfants, elle a en charge sept petits fils et neveux; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits cosmétiques et habits et également couturière et coiffeuse. Elle est debout sur la photo à droite habillée en robe wax jaune et couverte d'un châle marron.



Elle achète ses marchandises crème et lait pour le corps, pommade , parfum et habits dans la capitale et revend dans sa ville au niveau de son quartier.
