Son prêt lui permettra de diversifier les produits à vendre ainsi elle pourra se faire de bons revenus.

Elle compte renforcer son épargne avec les bénéfices attendus mais aussi participer aux charges familiales surtout pour la nourriture.
texts.en:
The "Bokk Diom" solidarity group was established on May 14, 2010. It is composed of 14 women, coming from different parts of the city, but bonded by links of friendship.

Ndéye Penda, age 51, is responsible for the group. She's married and the mother of two children. She also has her seven grandsons and nephews to support. She runs a small business selling cosmetics and clothing, and she's also a seamstress and hairdresser. In the photograph, she's on the right, dressed in a yellow "wax" dress and wearing a brown shawl.

She gets her supplies (body milks, creams, ointments, perfumes, and clothes) in the capital, and resells in her neighborhood. Her loan will enable her to diversify the products she sells, so that she can get a good income.

She intends to bolster her savings with the expected profits, but also take part in the expenses of the family, especially with respect to food.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing to resell

loans.name: Muhsin

texts.en: Muhsin is a 33-year-old hardworking man who started at a young age by opening a small buffet selling different kind of drinks such as coffee, tea, and juice. It has been 10 years now since he started, and through those years, he was able to add a new line to the buffet selling some snacks such as biscuits and noodles. Now Muhsin want to expand his business and add more food products to his buffet. That's why he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To expand his business and add more food products to his buffet

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María, de 47 años es una mujer alegre y con muchas ganas de vivir, vive con su pareja en su casa que pudo comprar junto a el, además vive con sus tres hijos a quienes brinda buena educación y son su razón de vivir.
El trabajo de María inicia muy temprano cuando sale en busca de las frutas mas frescas y agradables de la región, ella se dirige al mercado de frutas ubicado por el centro de la ciudad en donde va en busca de sus proveedores quienes le dan la mejor calidad, después vuelve a su casa pues los clientes están en espera para los desayunos de los niños que van al colegio, esta actividad realiza en su casa y cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos además que su esposo trabaja como transportista y juntos generan buenos ingresos a su hogar.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposo además de poder realizar esta actividad por las mañana y tener libre por las tardes, espera poder agrandar su negocio pues tiene todas las ganas y el deseo de poder superar sus mismas expectativas.Este es el primer préstamo que le otorga MFP a María y espera poder cumplir con todos las expectativas formadas ya que no le gusta deber y siempre fue muy responsable con todo.Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, ella comprará mas frutas, además de bebidas ya que piensa iniciar en este rubro también.
texts.en:
María, 47, is a happy woman who loves life.  She lives with her partner in their home that they bought together.  They also live with their three children who they are providing a good education and who are her reason for living.

María's work starts very early when she goes out to find the freshest and best fruits in the region.  She goes to the fruit market located in the center of the city where she looks for suppliers who have the best quality.  Then she returns home because her customers are waiting and she makes breakfast for her children who go to high school.  She does this work at home and her children help her.  Her husband works in transportation and together they earn a good income for their family.

The thing she likes best about her work is that her children and her husband help her, and she is able to do her work in the morning and have the afternoons free.  She hopes to expand her business since she has the drive and the desire to exceed her own expectations.  This is her first loan with MFP and she hopes to meet all of the expectations since she does not like to be in debt and she has always been very responsible.  With the 1000 soles she has requested, she will purchase more fruit and drinks, since she wants to expand into that area as well.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and expand into selling drinks.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Sokhim (in the photo) is a garment worker, while her husband, Song, is a construction worker. They have three daughters: two are in school and another one is still young. The family is living in a suburb, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sokhim asked for a loan from Kiva to renovate the house where she lives because the house was small and difficult for family members to stay. Sokhim is in the processing of renovating, so she is asking for another loan of $1,200 to make the finishes.

loans.use: to finish her house building.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 41 year old farmer, she is married to Stephen. They are blessed with two children aged 20 and 4 years respectively. She has been a mixed crop farmer for the past three years, with a monthly income of KES 16,000 which she uses to support the family.

She is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Nancy will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will expand the farm. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into dairy farming, which will educate her children and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 48 and has one school-age child. She is a single parent because she was separated from her husband. Despite this, she has strong faith and determination to improve their status of living and give her child a better future. 

She owns and manages a variety store in their village selling grocery items, soft drinks and rice. She has been in this business for almost seven years earning a net profits of P10,000 a month that she uses to acquire their necessities and support the education of her child. 

She aims to acquire additional stocks of grocery items to sell in her store but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 32,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, breads, snack foods, candies, soaps, shampoos, soft drinks and rice to sell in her store. 

She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business as she continues to work hard despite the hardships and difficulties she encounters in life. She dreams that someday, her business will grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, breads, snack foods, candies, soaps, shampoos, soft drinks and rice to sell in her store

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es: La Ivania Del Socorro tiene 30 años, cuenta con un negocio que es la venta de calzado. Con las ganancias que le genera dicha actividad percibe ingresos para cubrir las necesidades y obligaciones que tiene en su hogar, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad los cuales estudian en escuelas públicas La Señora Ivania utilizara el crédito para comprar sandalias, botas, chinelas de baño, zapatillas, zapatos deportivos entre otros. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y darles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Ivania Del Socorro is 30 years old.  Her business is selling footwear.  Profits from this activity make it possible for her to cover her household needs and obligations.  She’s a single mother of two minor children who go to local public schools.  Ivania will use the loan to buy sandals, boots, bath slippers, slippers and sports shoes, among others.  Her goal is to make her business grow and to provide her children with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sandals, boots, bath slippers, slippers and sports shoes, among others.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 23 years old and married to Esther. They have two children who are in school.

Ezekiel has a tailoring business with himself as the tailor and has applied for a loan to enable him to buy textile materials, sewing thread and a sewing machine to add to his shop.

He hopes to expand his business and employ one person to help him run his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy textile materials to add to his stock.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 38-year-old married woman, living with her husband and three school aged children. Her income is essential; she’s supportive of her husband. She has been working as a nurse at a local hospital since 1995. 

Today, she’s requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay her children's educational school fees. She will also use the loan to purchase books and stationary. In the future, she plans to find another job and earn higher income in order to help her children continue their education properly, until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational school fees

loans.name: Reynaldo Antonio

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Reynaldo Antonio  se ha  caracterizado por ser una persona  muy trabajadora y se desempeña como operador equipo de bomba de agua en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace cinco años. Es casado y con tres personas a su cargo y para brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. 

El  señor Reynaldo Antonio  ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para cancelar deuda  que posee con  Banpro de una tarjeta de crédito y así solo tener una sola deuda.
texts.en: In the municipality of Managua, Mr. Reynaldo Antonio is known for being a hard worker and serves as an operator of water pump equipment in a state institution, doing this work for the past five years. He is married with three dependents, providing a better life for his family.  Mr. Reynaldo Antonio has come to CEPRODEL to apply for a loan to pay off credit card debt that he has with Banpro and thus having only a single debt.

loans.use: with personal expenses.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Wilma has a shop that sells fish like mackerel and sardines. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.

Wilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Wilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Domitila se dedica a la Elaboración y Venta de tortillas, tiene mas de 15 años de experiencia, sus ventas las realiza de Lunes a sábado,  sus clientes le realizan sus pedidios por encargos, su actividad comienza a partir de las 5:00am hasta las 7:00pm,  Domitila recibe otros ingresos por el alquiler de dos cuartos, los cuales ha ido construyendo gracias a los prestamos que ha recibido.
Domitila utilizara el credito porque necesita levantar columnas para la construcción de una plancha en la parte trasera de su casa, va a comprar arena, grava, cemento, varillas y bloques.
este trabajo lo realizara su esposo, el es albañil, no tendran que pagar mano de obra para realizar dicho trabajo.
Gracias a los ingresos que recibe de su negocio ha logrado sostener a sus dos hijos los cuales están estudiando en el colegio.
texts.en:
Domitila makes and sells tortillas.  She has more than 15 years’ experience and sells Monday through Saturday; her customers place orders with her.  She begins working at 5:00 am and works until 7:00 pm.  Domitila receives other income by renting out two rooms, which she has been building with the help of the loans she’s received.

She will use the money from this loan to set columns for building a porch behind her house.  She will buy sand, cement, gravel, metal bars, and cinder blocks.  They won’t have money to pay for labor, so her husband, who works as a mason, will do the work.

She has managed to support her two children, both of whom attend school, thanks to the income she brings in from her business.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Sophon's Group

texts.en:
A 67-year-old married father with seven children, Sophon is a farmer who has been farming for 30 years as his main income source and supplementing his income as a village chief in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district. Two of his children are dependents; one is still in school and the last one works in a company. With his current income source, Sophon earns 2 US dollars per day. 

This is Sophon's first group loan with VisionFund. He leads a group of two members. Now requesting a loan, he will use it to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to make more rice so as to raise more income to build on some savings for renovating a house to live in and also keep his child in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Judith Clementina

texts.es:
Judith  Clementina, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos de edades entre 18 y 30 años, vive en la colonia, Miramonte, Cofradia, Cortes.
Doña Judith, tiene un negocio donde vende comidas y golosinas  como churros, confites, refrescos  y  naranjas.  Hace 8 meses inicio este negocio con capital propio, anteriormente vendía solo  tortillas.
Este préstamo es el segundo  que solicita a ODEF, y es  para invertir en su negocio en compra de carnes, vegetales, verduras,  condimentos etc. para elaborar comida y golosinas como  churros, refrescos y  dulces para la venta.
Ella esta motivada en terminar de construir su local específicamente para el negocio de comida y golosinas.
texts.en:
Judith Clementina, 46, is a single mother.  She has four children whose ages range from 18 to 30.  She lives in the Miramonte neighborhood in Cofradía, Cortes.

Judith has a business where she sells food and snacks like churros, sweets, soft-drinks and oranges.  She started the business 8 months ago with her own capital; she used to just sell tortillas.

This is the second loan request to ODEF and it’s to be used to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, etc. to prepare meals and to buy snacks like churros, soft-drinks and candy to sell.  She’s motivated to finish building her locale specifically to sell food and snacks.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food and also to buy snacks, candy and soft-drinks to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, está integrado por 16 mujeres, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras y ven en el programa de la fundación una gran forma de ayuda para cada una de ellas.
Una de esas mujeres es la señora Higinia, quien se dedica a la venta de comida. Comenta que tiene buena venta, ya que ella es muy buena en la preparación de comidas. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede mantener a su familia y de esa forma darles lo que ellos necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, hortalizas, condimentos y demás insumos necesarios para los alimentos que prepara. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora, of the city of Villa Elisa, is a group comprised of 16 women, all of whom are friends and neighbors from this city.  They are very hard-working and enterprising women and they see in the foundation's program a great form of aid for each one of them.

One of these women is the lady Higinia, who works selling food.  She comments that she has good sales, since she is very good at preparing meals.  Thanks to this job, she can take care of her family and in this way, give them what they need for a life of dignity and worth. 

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase meat, chicken, seasonings, condiments and other supplies necessary for the food that she prepares.  She thanks the foundation for the opportunity that this gives her.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, seasonings, condiments and other supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Katupyry es un grupo más del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Son de la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi. El grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre ellas. En este grupo 6 de las integrantes son indígenas que nunca tuvieron acceso a créditos en otras entidades.
Una de las miembros es la señora Serafina, quien se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser cerdos y gallinas. Ella es una mujer de escasos recursos, pero muy trabajadora. Su sueño es poder tener una granja donde criar mas animales y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollitos y cerdos para la cría, ya que quiere poder crecer y tener más animales, que dentro de un tiempo le generaran una buena ganancia.
texts.en:
The 'Kuña Katupyry' committee is another group from Fundación Paraguaya's 'Entrepreneurial Women' program.  They are from the town of Villa Ygatimi.  Since the group started out, they have demonstrated unity and solidarity.  Six of the group's members are indigenous people who never had access to loans from other companies.

One of the members of this group is Serafina who raises animals such as pigs and hens.  She is a woman of limited financial resources but she is very hard-working.  Her dream is to own a farm where she can raise more animals and thereby continue helping her family.

Serafina is requesting a loan to buy chicks and pigs to raise as she would like to be able to grow her business and have more animals which will make her good profits.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 40-year-old, married man. He has three children. He describes himself as a focused person. He operates a farming business, where he produces potatoes, tomatoes, and maize. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a rural area. He says his biggest business challenge is inadequate capital for expansion.

He will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase seeds for planting. This is his first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.fr:
Ketty a 40ans et elle est divorcée. Mais malgré cela, son ex-mari effectue toujours ses devoirs envers ses enfants. Ils ont 2 enfants, un de 14ans et un autre de 12 ans. Ces enfants sont tous scolarisés. 
Elle est dans la vente des marchandises générales et enseigne aussi le français. Elle y est depuis 4 ans. Cette activité est très intéressante car cette dernière est bien placée, mais aussi car il n’y a aucun concurrent dans les environs. Le prêt servira à acheter divers fournitures scolaires : Cahier, protège cahier, ardoise, stylo, craie ; ainsi que des pâtes : Spaghetti, macaroni, nouille  des légumes secs: haricot , poids de cap ; et ainsi que des poissons séchés d’eau douce et de mer. 
La mère de famille a pour objectif d’avoir une maison individuelle pour elle et ses enfants et d’aussi pouvoir créer son grossiste en marchandise générale.

loans.use: acheter des fournitures scolaires, des pâtes alimentaires, des légumes secs, des poissons séchés..

loans.name: Ma. Vilma

texts.en:
Ma. Vilma is 59 years old and single.

Ma. Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products.

Ma. Vilma has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Ma. Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Maria Orfilia Salgad

texts.en: I have had my business for 12 years, maintaining good clientele and management. My best clients are students, lawyers and some offices. The money I have made through my business has helped me to improve the business and cover family expenses.

loans.use: To buy toner, paper, staples, folders, clips, pencils, etc.

loans.name: Rissikatou

texts.en:
Rissikatou S. is a very dedicated young woman. She is married to a farmer, has three children, and is also the guardian of two little sisters, who are in an apprenticeship. She works hard to be able cover family expenses. Her business selling baby clothes does not bring in enough money, since she lacks sufficient financial capital. Although business is booming, Ms. S. is not altogether happy about it. To have enough income for her family, she needs new capital to bolster her business. That is why she is requesting a loan of $800 to lease a place as a boutique, to enlarge her display of goods offered, and to buy new goods in order to meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame S. Rissikatou est une jeune femme très dévouée. Mariée à un cultivateur, elle est mère de trois (3) enfants et a à sa charge deux (2) petites sœurs en apprentissage. Elle peine énormément pour couvrir les dépenses de sa famille car son activité de vente des habits pour bébé et enfants ne rapporte pas, son capital étant trop infime. Malgré que ce commerce soit très florissant, Madame S. n’en jouit pas convenablement. Pour disposer d’un revenu suffisant pour la famille, Elle a besoin du capital frais pour renforcer son activité. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour louer un local qui va lui servir de boutique et agrandir son étalage, acheter de nouveaux produits pour répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To lease a place as a boutique and to enlarge her range of goods for sale

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra is 28 years old and lives in District 6 in Kabul City in a household of seven. Her father had lots of financial problems, so she is participating  in the loan program so she and her father can overcome these problems. The loan program enables them to open a business selling foodstuffs, and has made her father very happy with the help from his daughter. Zohra is requesting a loan to improve this business and her family's lives. She is grateful that these loan programs have been established and are so successful at helping poor people raise their standards of living. 


***Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur.  In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.***

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a deep freezer and animal feed

loans.name: Manjula

texts.en: Manjula J. is twenty five years old and is married with two children.  She runs a small business of selling chili peppers and palm oil in addition to her main business of selling yogurt.  She buys milk from farmers and makes yogurt to sell in the town of Kabala.  Manjula plans to buy her own cows “one at a time," she said.  She is requesting for a loan of $200 to start her dream.  She also plans to build a small and clean shelter in which to sell the yogurt.

loans.use: Purchase cows for her yogurt business

loans.name: Piyalo

texts.en:
Married and mother of one child, Piyalo is an expert in the preparation of fried yams and potatoes, called in local jargon “Koliko.” Koliko is a local food which any child loves to eat . Piyalo makes fried yams and sells them to students at nearby schools. As school is opening in Togo in few weeks, there will be more demand by the children to eat during the break time at school.

Therefore, Piyalo wants to take the opportunity to expand her business by buying more yams and potatoes, but money is a problem. That's why she is requesting this loan so she can buy as many yams as she needs. We estimated her business capability at US$ 200, a loan sum that she can afford to manage and pay back on time and still use some of the profit to take care of her family 's needs.

Piyalo is also a member of the women's group called “ARCB” which is affiliated to HELP Africa.

loans.use: Buy yams and make fried  yams for students at school

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Before joining TYM fund, the family of Lê Thị Bính was in difficult condition because they only had a small piece of land, 3/10 acre. She joined TYM fund and with the loan, she bought a boat and fishing net for her husband who is a fisherman. Everytime he comes back from the sea with fishes, she sells them at the market. The family income has raised and their lives have changed for the better. Today her children are grown up and they do earn their living. This time she's requesting a loan of 575 USD to buy a tractor to augment her farm's productivity also she can rent it to make money

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Trước đây vì chưa có vốn làm ăn nên gia đình chị Lê Thị Bính chỉ trông chờ vào 3 mẫu ruộng. Từ ngày có Quỹ Tình Thương cho vay lớn trả nhỏ chị xin vay vốn đầu tư vào mua lưới và thuyền đi đánh cá. Cứ sau mỗi lần anh đi biển về, chị lại mang cá ra chợ bán. Thu nhập tăng lên đáng kể và cuộc sống cũng có nhiều thay đổi. Đến nay con chị cũng đã lớn và biết làm ăn. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 575USD mua thêm máy cày để sản xuất đạt hiệu quả cao hơn, ngoài ra còn đi cày thuê nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập.

loans.use: Buy tractor-pulled plough

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is 50 years old. She owns a tailoring workshop in the region of Saida, in south Lebanon. Zahra was involved with group loans from Al Majmoua, and then began applying  for individual loans. Zahra is requesting $1200 to refurbish her tailoring workshop. These improvements to her business will enable her to earn more income and to participate, with all the members of her family, to the house maintenance expenses.

loans.use: To refurbish her tailoring workshop

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
A. Lola lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children. She became the client of MicroInvest because she heard many successful stories from friends who had been through the MicroInvest loan procedure and had helped her friends to develop and improve their businesses. Thus she has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006. The business stability and increase in income from her previous loans helped her to return her loans in time.

Mrs. A. is engaged in the furniture making and selling business. She has 7 years of experience in this business. Now Mrs. A. requests a loan of $725 for purchasing upholstery.

loans.use: For purchasing upholstery

loans.name: Fatuma's Jitihada Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 28 years old and married with one child, age 7. In 2004, Fatuma opened her own saloon and she works from 6am to 8pm at her business everday. She can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Fatuma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who have business dealing in timber selling.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Mautino

texts.es:
Señora B. is a member of the San Martín de Porras Communal Bank. She is dedicated to the sale of clothes in the market of the district and province of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With the loan of 1500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 2 dozen pants, 3 dozen jerseys, 2 dozen coats, 1 dozen dress pants, 2 dozen shirts and 1 ½ dozen polos for children.

She is 33 years old and has 2 children. Her husband works as a locksmith. Together they cover the expenses of the house and the education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora B., pertenece al Banco Comunal San Martín de Porras, se dedica a la venta de ropa, en el mercado del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 2 docenas de pantalones, 3 docenas de chompas, 2 docenas de casacas,1 docena pantalones de vestir, 2 docenas de camisas, 1 ½ polos para niños.

Ella tiene 33 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la cerrajería, juntos cubren los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy pants, jerseys, shirts, polos and coats for resale.

loans.name: Yolita

texts.es:
Yolita belongs to the Communal Bank “The Shipibas”, located in the Jr. Mayan of Britto Cdra. 1, of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 57 years old and is a mother of 3 children. Her husband is a merchant, but his income does not cover the costs of daily life for the family, so Yolita initially took out a loan of 300 PEN from Manuela Ramos in order to start her own business of buying and selling fish.

Currently she sells fish in the Bellavista market and begins her sales very early in the morning. She goes home each day at noon and attends to her children and her home. With this loan of 1,800 PEN, she will be able to buy various types of fish, including sardines, etc. and will be able to invest in products which she can sell for people’s homes. Yolita believes that the services offered by Manuel Ramos are a great support and it is thanks to those loans that her children are able to study while she continues to support them.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yolita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr. Maya de Britto Cdra. 1, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Yolita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de pescado.

En la actualidad vende sus pescado en el mercado de Bellavista, se va muy temprano para empezar su venta del día hasta las 12 pm, en las tardes atiende a sus hijos y su hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará pescados de diferentes especies como sardina, palometa, bagre, etc, y una parte lo invirtira en mercadería para vender a domicilio.

Yolita nos cuenta que los préstamos de Manuela Ramos son un apoyo excelente, gracias a eso puede hacer estudiar a sus hijos y sigue apoyándolos para que salgan adelante y sean todos unos profesionales de éxito.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more fish for her store

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Lê Thị Sách is 56 years old. Despite the fact that she is receiving a pension, she is still actively working to increase her income. She sells grocery and raises pigs. After a year with TYM, she notices that the investment has yielded good results. Also she likes that fact that she can pay back in installments. On top of her pension, she make about 100 USD a month.On this second year with TYM, she is applying for a loan of 825 USD to buy breeding pigs and grocery stock to sell. Her 2 children are grown up. She hopes that with this loan, she will be able to increase her revenue so she would be able to help her grand children and repair her house.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

56 tuổi, tuy đã có chế độ hưu trí nhưng chị Lê Thị Sách vẫn tích cực chăn nuôi và buôn bán để có thêm thu nhập. Sau một năm vay vốn Quỹ Tình Thương, chị thấy vốn vay đầu tư có hiệu quả, việc hoàn trả lại rất thuận tiện. Ngoài lương hưu trung bình một tháng chị Sách thu khoảng 100USD. Năm thứ 2 chị dự định xin vay 825USD để mua lợn giống và hàng bán. 2 con chị hiện nay đều đã trưởng thành. Với số vốn vay thêm chị mong muốn thu nhập sẽ tăng thêm để có điều kiện để hỗ trợ con cháu về kinh tế và sửa sang thêm nhà cửa.

loans.use: Buy pigs and goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Sophath

texts.en: Mrs. Sophath N. is a villager in Kraing Leav Village in Kampong Chhnang province. She currently owns a small restaurant, where she sells rice soup as breakfast food. Besides this business activity, Mrs. Sophath N. is a subsistence farmer. Her plantation business now has insufficient draft animals. Thus, Mrs. Sophath N. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow to add to her previous one to use as a draft animal. Mrs. Sophath N. is 48 and the mother of 3 children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another is attending school. The youngest one is staying at home. Her husband, Mr. Sreng Chay, is a policeman in the province. Previously, Mrs. Sophath N. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow cart. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to add to her previous one to use as a draft animal

loans.name: Mame Yacine

texts.fr:
Mame Yacine B. is a woman who was born in 1964 in Dakar. She now lives in Thies, is married and the mother of three children. After cooking for her family, she runs a small business selling food products such as tamarind. Her goal in requesting this loan is to increase her income.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Mame Yacine B. est une femme née en 1964 à Dakar. Actuellement elle vit à Thies ou elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Après avoir fait la cuisine pour sa famille, elle s'adonne au petit commerce de denrées alimentaires comme le tamarrin. C'est dans l'optique d'améliorer ses revenus qu'elle sollicite ce pret.

loans.use: Small Business Selling Food Products

loans.name: Francisco Emigdio

texts.es:
Francisco began his business after working for several companies. He found that the schedules that these firms demanded were so time consuming that they didn't allow him to do anything outside of work. Instead, Francisco decided to start his own business, and one that would allow time for him to study and spend time with his family. He began in 1998 when a friend invited him to work selling water coolers. Later Francisco decided to start an independent business, which was very successful. He was able to buy his own truck to distribute the jugs of water to individual homes.

Francisco needs a loan of $800, which he'll pay back in 6 months. He'll use the loan to buy jugs of water so that he can expand his route. The weather has been very warm and people have been consuming more water than usual.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco inició el negocio despues de trabajar en varias empresas pero los horarios de trabajo eran muy absorbentes y no le permitían realizar otras actividades, fue entonces que decidío iniciar un negocio que le permitiera tener tiempo para estudiar y atender a su familia. Comenzó en el año de 1998 cuando un amigo lo invitó a que se asociáran en el negocio de venta de agua en garrafones pero después, decidió seguir por su cuenta y le fue muy bien ya que pudo comprar su propia camioneta para repartir los garrafones casa por casa.

El necesita un prestamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más garrafones de agua que le permitirán expandir su ruta de trabajo, sobre todo en este tiempo de mucho calor que la gente consume mucho mas agua que lo normal.

loans.use: Buy water jugs.

loans.name: Mujeres Del 2000 Group

texts.es: La asociación “mujeres del 2000” trabaja hace mas de siete años en el centro focal de Villa tejada, grupo formado por 15 mujeres, la mayoría de ellas casadas y con un promedio de cinco hijos, afirman que los gastos diarios que tienen en sus hogares aumentan cada día mas, por lo que deben buscar otras fuentes de ingreso. Ellas realizan diferentes actividades algunas se dedican a la costura,  otras tienen sus tiendas de barrio, también se dedican al tejido a mano de chompas, mantillas y ponchos, entre otros, trabajos que los realizan en lana y en hilo, que una vez elaborados los venden al por mayor. Ellas quieren crédito para aumentar su producción y poder llevar sus productos al interior del país, de esta manera generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres del 2000" ("Women of 2000") has been working for seven years in the town's textile trade mostly. It is a group formed by fifteen women, the majority of them married and with an average of five children, and they say that the daily expenses that they have for their home increase more each day, which is why they must search for other sources of income. They do different activities. Some are dedicated to sewing, others have neighborhood stores, and some are dedicated to weaving by hand sweaters, baby clothes, and blankets, among other things, which are works that they create with wool and yarn and then sell in bulk. They want a loan to increase their production and to be able to carry their products to the interior of the country, and in this manner they can generate more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their production and to be able to deliver their products to the interior of their country.

loans.name: Aba Kessiwaa

texts.en:
Aba Kessiwaa O. sells cosmetics in Kotokoraba, which is at the heart of Cape Coast. Aba Kessiwaa has received some education. She is single and has no children.

Aba Kessiwaa has been selling cosmetics since 2006. She is responsible for paying utility bills and other expenses.

Her loan will be used to increase her capital so she can buy more cosmetics for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Getzamani Group

texts.es:
hola nosotros somos el grupo Getzamani, vivimos en la comunidad de Yusguare, estamos formados por tres integrantes dos mujeres y un hombre, los tres nos conocemos hace mucho tiempo y somos muy unidos, tenemos una cualidad que siempre nos hemos ayudado el uno con el otro y nunca dejamos que nos pase algo malo, nuestras familias estan muy unidas.
nosotros tenemos nuestros propios negocios como ser venta de empanadas y nacatamales, produccion y venta de tortillas y helados y paletas, todos realizamos estas actividades con el proposito de proveer el sustento a nuestras familias y asi poder cubrir con todas nuestras necesidades de nuestros hogares, en estos momentos necesitamos un credito para sacar adelante nuestros negocios.
texts.en:
Hello. We are the Getzamani Group, and we live in the Yusguare community. Our group is comprised of three members, two women and one man. The three of us have known each other for a long time, and we are very close. We have always helped each other, making sure that nothing bad happens to any of us, and our families are also very close.

We each have our own businesses such as selling empanadas and nacatamales (a Central American tamal: dough with a pork or chicken filling wrapped in plantain leaves then steamed or pressure cooked), making and selling tortillas, ice creams and popsicles. We all realize these activities with the aim of providing for our families and meeting the needs of our households. Currently, we need a loan in order to help our businesses grow.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cornflower, chicken and pork, vegetables, salt, cooking oil, lard, plantain leaves, ice creams, popsicles, etc.

loans.name: Piseth

texts.en: Mr. Piseth P. lives in Thmey village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Nin Ney, is an egg middleman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Piseth P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more eggs for his wife’s business. He hopes to increase income and improve his family living conditions. He is 23 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for resale.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the Universo (Universe) Village Bank.  Catalina is 45 years old and is married with two children. Catalina sells prepared meals in the Nery Garcia Zarate Market. Catalina sells breakfast with the help of her children. She also makes weavings, like hallway rugs, which she sells in the city’s markets.  Catalina needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy rice and sugar.  Catalina dreams that her children will grow up to be working professionals, of improving her two businesses, and of building her own home.
 
 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal  Universo. 
Catalina es casada, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Catalina vende comida en un puesto del mercado Nery García Zarate, Catalina vende desayuno y cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Catalina realiza artesanía en telar como pasadizos, y lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad. 
Catalina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar. 
Catalina sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios y construir su casa.

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo H. is 47 and married with three children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle and also breeding sheep. She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. She currently has 2 cows, a calf, and 4 sheep which she will fatten for some time to later sell them.

With the loan she wants to buy feed for her animals. In future she is planning to save capital to open a store in her home, because she is afraid that because of her age, in the future she will not be able to work buying and selling animals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing feed for animals

loans.name: Nghe Thi

texts.vi: Đỗ Thị Nghê sinh năm 1959, ( Mã số: 010117140034 ) Chồng chị đã chết, hiện chị đang sống cùng cháu tại thôn Đài Bi- Uy Nỗ- Đông Anh- Hà Nội. Chị bán hàng nước, hàng ăn sáng( phở, bún,…) Thu nhập bình quân của chị khoảng 200.000 vnđ/ tuần. Đây là lần đầu tiên chị tham gia vay vốn nên chị chỉ tham gia nở mức vay: 1.972.000 vn đ để dầu tư thêm hàng bán quán của mình. Chị cố gắng hoàn trả đầy đủ để ngày càng được vay cao hơn cải thiện kinh tế của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nghe Thi D. was born in 1959. Her husband has passed, and she is currently living with a nephew or niece in the town of Dai Bi, Uy No, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She runs a stand selling beverages, breakfast foods (beef noodle, vermicelli rice bowls, etc.) Her family's average income is 200,000 VND per week. This is her first time participating in the Fund so she is borrowing 1,972,000 VND to invest in her food stand. She will work very hard to repay the loan in full in order to be able to borrow larger amounts to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: food stand

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Greetings from Rachel U. in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda!  Rachel owns a small garage where she provides maintenance for vehicles.  She is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company S.A. for 500,000 RWF so that she can buy more stock in order to have all parts and tools necessary for making repairs.  She will repay the loan over a period of eight months on a monthly basis.  Rachel works every day from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm and earns approximately 450,000 Rwandan Francs ($820 USD) in sales each month.   She has owned the business for seven years and employs three people.  

Rachel is 26 years old, married, and has three children.

loans.use: To purchase more tools and vehicle parts

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice sells cooked foods like rice and beans, etc. She lives in Asaba, Delta, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She says thanks to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Shanna

texts.en:
Shanna O., 22, is married and has no children. She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 3 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

She has no previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Shanna’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy more tools, a garden sprayer, and chemicals to improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase tools and chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: Since 2000, Agartha P. has worked as a trader selling various items including clothes and maize at Bronybina, near Elmina. She is married, has one child and has received an education through Primary School. While Agatha works as a trader, her husband is employed as a carpenter.  Her loan will be used to buy more goods, including clothing, for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more goods including clothing for resale.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio D. L. , tiene la edad de  28 años , habita en el barrio , el Edén ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , al cual es comerciante y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , que actualmente estudia , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder construir su casa , el desde hace 16 años de dedica a la agricultura y con sus propios esfuerzos a logrado mantener sus cultivo , el mayor problema que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , los sueños de el es poder mejor la infraestructura de sus pequeña finca .  Con el financiamiento va a compra fertilizantes e insumos para lograr una buena producción y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio D. L. is 28 years old and lives with his wife in the Edén neighborhood located in the town of Ticuantepe. She is a businesswoman and helps him with the household expenses. They have two children who are still in school. Their plans for their family are to improve their living conditions and to be able to build their house. He has been engaged in agriculture for 16 years now and through his own efforts has been able to maintain his crops. The biggest problem he faces is a lack of capital. He dreams of being able to improve the infrastructure of his small farm. With the loan he is going to buy fertilizers and nutrients to achieve a good harvest and to be able to sell it for a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutrients and fertilizer to apply to the crops.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes K. N. is a businesswoman who works from her home. She rears chickens and keeps pigs and cattle. She also has a small retail shop in front of her house. This 45-year-old lady has two daughters.

Agnes is requesting the loan to purchase more chicks to rear in more shades to generate more income. She is a hardworking businesswoman who wishes to construct more houses to rent.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks to rear to generate more income

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa K. is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, four sons and two daughters. All are currently in the senior high and the junior high schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. She is a hardworking woman. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa own a ceramics factory. She produces items such as earthenware, pots, etc. from clay. She has hired hands. Yaa supplies her wares to retailers and treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over 25 years now and wants a loan to buy clay and other working materials to expand her business. She is hoping to improve upon her standard of living and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy clay

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie B. is from the village of Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.  She is 30 years old. Elsie is married and has 5 children.  To make a living, Elsie operates sari-sari store. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 5,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was use to invest in expanding the business. Elsie is requesting a new loan of PHP 8,000 which will be use to invest in expanding her business.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Expansion for sari-sari store.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Bayardo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Bayardo Antonio M. C.  es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales son menores de edad. El señor M. C. posee un una pequeña industria de bolis  que son refrescos en bolsa, los cuales luego sale a distribuir en una camioneta que posee. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Don Bayardo M. dio inicio a su negocio hace 15 años, cabe señalar que este negocio fue heredado por su mama, ya que ella tuvo la idea de establecer el negocio y la fabrica. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materias primas para su negocio. Su esposa trabaja como maestra en una escuela de primaria. Su meta principal es comprar mejores y más actualizadas maquinarias para mejorar su negocio, además que desea comprar otra camioneta que le permita distribuir mayormente su producto.
texts.en:
Bayardo Antonio M. C. is married and has two minor children. Mr. M. C. has a small factory that makes “bolis”, which are soft drinks in plastic sacks. He distributes them in his small truck. This business is located in his house. Bayardo M. started his business 15 years ago. He inherited the business from his mother. She had the idea of establishing the business and the factory. The loan is to buy raw materials for his business. His wife works as a teacher in an elementary school. His main goal is to buy improvements and more current machinery to improve his business. He also wishes to buy another truck that would allow for greater distribution of his product.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo L., no está solicitando un préstamo escolar para poder pagarle los estudios a su hijo ya que va a entrar a la preparatoria y el no cuenta con en esté momento para pagar la colegiatura y comprar el uniforme.
 Don  Alfredo trabaja en una maquiladora como supervisor de mantenimiento, esté es le ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte será para poder pagar esté crédito que le ayudara a que su hijo entre ha estudiar.

loans.use: Pago de colegiatura y uniformes

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Anas has owned laundry for over a year. Anas is requesting a loan of $1500 USD from A. Majmoua to purchase a new dry cleaning machine. This is the first time that Anas has requested a loan.

Anas is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty paying the rent for his laundry shop. He decided to start his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business by opening another laundry.

loans.use: To purchase a new dry cleaning machine.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is already 36 years old. She is the wife of Lary T.. She is a raiser of goat in the village of San Antonio San Agustin, Isabela. According to Esther, their place is too far and was along the mountainside of Sierra Madre Mountains. Despite of that, Esther is happily lives there because the place is peaceful considering that her whole family also lives there. Esther would like to manage well her goat raising business to be able to generate bigger income for her family need.

Esther and Lary is blessed with three children: Genie Rose - 9 years old; Jane Claude - 7 years old and Jeriebeth - 5 years old. All are attending school. Esther wanted the best education to give to her three children but since her family lacks of livelihood resources worries of not able to afford them sending to college someday. The couple wanted their children finish a higher level of education and for this reason, she would like to ask additional business capital amounting PHP6, 000 for the maintenance of her goat raising business. Esther would be glad if her loan request will be approve.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Rida

texts.en:
Mrs. Rida S., age 25 and her husband, Mr. Phally Bun, age 32, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married since 2003 and have 3 children-2 sons and daughter. All of them are still young.   

Rida has been selling finished silk fabric since 2008. She buys it from weavers in her village and transports for resale at other provinces, far a way from her house. Besides of the business, she also designs pattern for fabric. Her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh in 2003.

Rida is requesting a loan of $700 in order to purchase more finished silk fabric for resale. It will able be better for her to manage income for supporting the family.

loans.use: To purchase more finished silk fabric for resale.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda M. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Melinda is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Melinda owns and operates a specialized business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling different varieties of products such as rice, sticky rice, eggplant, bitter gourd, etc. in the local community. Melinda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2009, Melinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D. is from the village of Pangabuan, Tangub City. She is 42 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates  an "Olang" fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to purchase raw materials for her business. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP for the purchase of additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children’s schooling and the family’s daily needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard A. is from the village of Tapon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 43 years old. Richard is single. To make a living, Richard owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Richard has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Richard joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Richard has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Richard is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Richard from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand his business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes, 58 years old, comes from Morong, in the lovely province of Rizal, Philippines. She has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. She is married to Florante G., a farmer, and is a diligent and careful mother of four children.

Mercedes' husband's income is not enough to meet the needs of their family. In 2000, Mercedes got the idea of joining ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. She was given hope and a way to have access to capital, so she started her sari-sari store (a small retail business selling different goods). The business went smoothly and brings them good income. Mercedes also got the idea to put up capital for a canteen eatery (preparation of ready-to-eat food) because of the demand.

Currently on her seventh loan, Mercedes proposes the amount of Php 35,000 as additional capital to purchase stock and more supplies for her consumers' demands. Stock includes items such as soft drinks, beer, drinks, meat, fish, vegetables, rice, Fundador, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

Mercedes has disciplined herself to use all of the borrowed capital from ASHI-KIVA for her business, to gain more profit and to use that profit to support daily expenses. She got involved in ASHI (10 years) for the dreams of her family, to send her children to school and to finish their studies with a degree. Actually, she has already completed half of her dreams because her children have their degrees but she didn’t stop dreaming for her grandchildren, to offer them the best education, as she provided for her children. The couple feels very happy with the loan that changed their lives to be better than before. Mercedes wishes all lenders all the best and good luck and will continue to support her family and the expanded business.

loans.use: purchase of stock and supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 55, sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. She is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is married and has seven children.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan in the amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
El señor Gilberto G. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a mejorar su negocio. Compraron mesas y sillas para que sus clientes ya están mucho mejor al consumir sus deliciosos tacos. 
Nuevamente están solicitando un préstamo para poder acondicionar la camioneta para la venta de tacos, pero en este momento no cuentan con el capital necesario para está remodelación. 
Desean contar nuevamente con su cooperación para este préstamo, ya que planean pagarlo con las ganancias del negocio. 
Don Gilberto también trabaja en un supermercado en el departamento de abarrotes, con este ingreso será para los gastos de la familia.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Maria Del Rosario Silva esposa del señor Gilberto.
texts.en:
Sr. Gilberto G. is very grateful for the assistance provided through his previous loan which helped to improve his business. He bought tables and chairs so that his customers could feel comfortable while eating his delicious tacos.

Gilberto is requesting a new loan in order to restore the truck he uses for selling tacos. At the moment, he does not have the capital needed to pay for these repairs. He wishes to receive your assistance again with this loan and plans to repay it with the profits from his business. Don Gilberto also works at a supermarket in the department in charge of provisions. His income from this job will be used to pay for his family’s expenses.

The person who appears in the photo is Sra. Maria Del Rosario Silva, Don Gilberto’s wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his business vehicle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is a 38-year-old married woman living in a beautiful green place – the town of Binangonan in Rizal province. She has two children, both are elementary students. She and her husband have a positive outlook towards life. Among many goals in life, education is their priority for their two children.

This new loan of 19,000 Philippine pesos is for hog fattening business. She will buy four pigs, two sacks of feed, and supplements and vitamins for the pigs. She will also construct a small hut for her pigs to live in. Hog fattening is one of the best ways to support her family and lift her family out of poverty.

Her dream is to have a pig farm someday and to be a successful businesswoman. She is also dreaming of a beautiful concrete house.

loans.use: To pay for four pigs and for two sacks of feed, supplements and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy pieces of fabric

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is a 47-year-old married woman with eight children aged between 18 and 32 years. Two of her children go to school while the others work. Safina also takes care of additional family members. She owns a four-roomed house where she lives with 12 people. There is electricity and piped water at her home, and her family eat three meals a day. Safina lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business premises and water.
Safina is a poultry farmer and works seven days a week from her home in Kulambiro. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day. Safina buys her chicks from farmers in Biyinzika, and uses public transport to and from Kampala and Owino market where she buys chicken feed. She has been in this business for the last six years. Her main challenges are thieves and seasonality. Safina has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for over six years and is now on her sixteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more feed and chickens. Her aspiration is to own 3,000 chickens on her farm.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Dina Candelaria

texts.es: La Sra.Huaracca Q. Dina Candelaria 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en la casa su hermanos tiene 05 hijos de los cuales depende de ella 03 los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, es una mujer muy trabajadora, empeñosa, se encuentra trabajando como empleada del hogar , a parte en temporadas de fundo también se apoya de esa manera, pero siempre se encuentra realizando algunas labor, necesita el crédito para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Huaracca Q. Dina Candelaria is a 37-year-old single mother who lives in her brother's house. She has 5 children, 3 of whom depend on her financially and are still in school. She is a hard-working woman who is currently employed as a domestic servant. Additionally, she works as a farmhand during certain seasons of the year to support herself. Moreover, she is always working. She needs this loan in order to help her children get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her children's education

loans.name: Monika

texts.en: Monika J. is currently in the business of selling soft drinks in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more boxes of juice and crates of soda to sell. Monika is 40 years old and is married to a soldier. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more boxes of juice and crates of soda to sell

loans.name: Akimova Mahsuda`s Group

texts.ru:
Махсуде 48 лет. Она замужем и мать 3 детей.Дочь замужем, воспитывает детей, сыновья на заработках в РФ. Супруг работает врачом - хирург, зарплата около 120 долларов.Заемщица дома откармливает 2 коровы и разводит 13 овец.На кредит она хочет закупить овец для откорма и разведения.

Маликахон, 48, ее супруг работает инспектором РайОНО.'Старшие дочери замужем, младшая дочь дома, сын окончил школу настоящее время обучается в ВУЗе, младший учится в школе. Клиент же занята животноводством, откормом и разведением КРС, также реализует молочную продукцию (дома имеется доенная корова). Клиентка ранее занималась с/х, получив хороший доход от посеянного лука, закупила беременную корову. Сейчас она закупит телку для разведения.

Мендайым 49 лет. Она замужем, ее супруг член крестьянского хозяйства. У нее трое сынове. Старшие сыновья находятся на заработках в РФ, младший учится в школе.Она занимается торговлей, розничная реализация продуктов питания.Ранее клиентка занималась с/х, но в 1999 году соседка посоветовала возле дома открыть небольшой киоск, чтобы получить дополнительный доход. На кредит она планирует расширить ассортимент реализуемой продукции.
 
Саламат, 55, мать 3 детей. Клиентка имеет возле дома торговую точку с оборотом около 250 долларов. Супруг Частный водитель, заработок в месяц 100 долларов. Она хочет увеличить товарооборот т.е. купить товары для повседневного спроса.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Mahsuda is 48 years old. She is married and a mother of 3 children. Her daughter is married and raising children. The sons are working in Russia. Mahsuda’s husband works as a surgeon, whose salary is about 120 dollars. At home, Mahsuda is fattening up 2 cows and breeding 13 sheep. She wants to use the loan to buy sheep for fattening and breeding. Malikahon is 48 years old. Her husband works as an inspector at the district education department. The oldest daughters are married, youngest daughter is at home, son finished school and currently attends a university, and the youngest goes to school. The client is involved in animal husbandry, fattening and breeding cattle, and also sells dairy products. She has a dairy cow at home. The client was previously involved in agriculture, and having gotten a good income from onions she grew, she bought a pregnant cow. Now, she will purchase a cow for breeding. Mendayim is 49 years old. She is married, and her husband is a member of an agricultural collective. She has three sons. The oldest sons work in Russia, and the youngest goes to school. Mendayim is involved in sales, specifically retail sales of food products. Previously, the client was involved in agriculture, but her neighbor suggested opening a small store near home in 1999 in order to have a supplemental income. She plans to use the loan to expand the variety of products that she sells. Salamat is 55 years old. She is a mother of 3 children. The client has a retail outlet near her home that has a turnover of about 250 dollars. Her husband is a private driver, whose monthly salary is 100 dollars. Salamat wants to increase goods turnover, i.e. buy goods of everyday demand.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sheep

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.en:
Marie Jeanne is 27 years old, married with two children who are 1 and 3 years old.  Marie Jeanne is widely known in the business of selling different styles of clothes and this is her fifth successful year in this business, which she works at from 7 am to 8 pm every day.

Marie Jeanne is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand expand her business through adding different modern styles of clothing.  With these additional styles for sale, Marie Jeanne hopes to earn more profits than her previous business has, which in turn will allow her to continue taking good care of her family and keep reinvesting in her business for better progress.

loans.use: The purchase of different styles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El joven Jorge Albert S. R. vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la Zona conocida como Zona Hipódromo, actualmente vive con su Mama y su Hermana. Jorge Esta terminado su Carrera en Contaduría Pública y mientras lo hace trabaja como Auxiliar Contable en la Federación Departamental de Productores De Leche De Cochabamba (FEPROLEC) por casi 2 años.

Jorge solicita el crédito para poder comprar una Computadora que no solo es de extrema importancia en su trabajo sino también le ayudaría mucho en la Universidad. Jorge nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es primero salir profesional y segundo poder en un futuro trabajar mucho y ahorrar plata para lograr que su Mama ya no trabaje y el poder darle todo lo que necesita.
texts.en:
The young man, Jorge Albert S. R., lives in the town of Cochabamba in the zone known as "Zona Hipódromo". At the present he lives with his mother and sister. Jorge is finishing his studies as a public accountant and meanwhile he has been working as an accounting assistant at the "Federación Departamental" of "Productores De Leche De Cochabamba" (FEPROLEC) for almost 2 years.

Jorge is requesting a loan to buy a computer which is extremely important for his job and also for the university. Jorge tells us that his dream is to become a professional and then work very hard in the future to save money so his mother does not have to work and for him to be able to provide her with everything she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the purchase of a computer.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria Q. es socia del banco comunal Cochapamba, esta comunidad pertenece a la parroquia de El Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por su productividad agrícola, la misma que solo es para abastecer a su población, su gente también se dedican a la ganadería, muchos salen a la ciudad en busca de un mejor trabajo, como también una gran parte de la población joven a migrado a otras partes del mundo para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus familias.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 7 hijos de los cuales dos se encuentran casados y viven de manera independiente, una hija soltera que vive fuera del país y le ayuda un poco económicamente, dos de sus hijos trabajan y estudian y sus dos últimos se encuentran estudiando en el colegio, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en su taller de estucos (realización de cielos rasos).

La Sra. Gloria se dedica a los quehaceres en su hogar y también colabora en el taller de su esposo. Se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 3 años, los créditos le han beneficiado para crecer en su taller. Este nuevo crédito que recibe de parte de la Fundación Espoir lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales como cemento, yeso, etc. Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos llegar a ser unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Gloria Q. is a partner in the Cochapamba community bank, located to the El Valle parish. This parish is know for its agricultural activity, which feeds the local population. The people there also raise cattle, though many have migrated to the city in search of work, while a large number of the youth have migrated around the world to provide a better future for their families. Our partner is 49, married, and has borne 7 children. Two of the children are married and live independently, an unmarried daughter lives out of the country and helps out economically, two sons work and study and the other two are in high school. Her husband has a stucco shop (finishing ceilings). Gloria takes care of the household chores as well as helping out in her husband's shop. She has been part of the community bank for three years and the loans have helped grow the business. She will invest this new loan from Fundacion Espoir, in the purchase of cement, plaster etc. Her greatest dream is to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, plaster, paint, lime, resin etc.

loans.name: Loriza

texts.en:
Loriza L. thanks all those who supported her, allowing the development of her business. Loriza took out her previous loan of 25,000 PHP from Kiva  to purchase additional GreenLife products and to expand her natural medicine business. The loan enabled her to offer a wider assortment of goods to her customers which increased traffic to her stall and maintained customer loyalty to her products in the community. She has been pleased with how her investments are turning out and how her business is improving. Thank you so much for your kindness and generosity towards Loriza and her family. Loriza prays they all will be blessed. She has a sound and solid relationship with the Kiva/ASHI partnership.

Now, Loriza is proposing another Kiva loan to advance her growing business, which she has been able to improve due to her access to bigger loans from Kiva lenders.

Loriza also revealed the massive impact the loan has made on her family. With the additional income, she was able to afford to buy desired needs for her family and ensure prompt weekly payment of her obligation to ASHI. Loriza is also happy because she is able to support her husband in meeting the family's needs. The couple love what they do in making their business succeed. For her, it is joy to see fulfillment in her business and family and, with her children growing up, she wants to see them having a decent life someday.

Loriza is thankful to ASHI and Kiva lenders for their continuous support of her dreams. Her long term goals are to provide a sustainable life for her family and enable them to build their own comfortable house to live in.

loans.use: to advance and expand her natural medicine business

loans.name: Djima

texts.en: Monsieur Djima B., 32 years old, lives and works in his hometown of Lome, Togo. He has a general store called Ets. Mawusse, and has been in business since 2005.
