He is experienced in taking loans from WAGES and is now requesting his third loan of 500,000 XOF in order to purchase merchandise such as flour, canned goods, and other items, for his store .

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Gakuweebwa Munno Developement Group, Mityana

texts.en:
40,000 shillings as weekly profits for a retail business operating in a far off distant metropolis like Mityana is not a bad bargain, given the lower operational costs one incurs in comparison to more expensive places like Kampala. The example of 34-year-old N. Joelia, who has for the last two years been operating her retail shop in Mityana town, is testament to that. The good rapport Joelia has struck with her existing and new customers has been her winning magic formula.

This married mother of four has come quite a long way in establishing a firm foothold in her business. She used profits from this business to improve her family’s welfare in a relatively short period of time. With this loan, she wants to buy more general merchandise for her enterprise. For the most part, she wants to buy bags of rice, plastics goods and edibles to sell.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice, plastics goods and edibles to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic ingredients such as rice, beans and oil

loans.name: Mr. Shorn Bou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of 19 people from Kampong village in Takeo province. They are led by Mr. Shorn B., a village bank president who was born in 1966. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in this current year. 

Mr. Shorn B. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. He is a teacher while his wife, Mrs. Phorlla Tuon, sells dry fish and sour cabbage in the local village to earn some income to support her family. Since his wife’s business is going well, he wants to expand. So, Mr. Shorn B. is applying for a loan to buy more dry fish to resell. 

He is the father of four children who are studying at school and also help in their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy more dry fish for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from the village of Faustino, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 41 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Elizabeth is just starting this business.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Tiapita Ene

texts.en:
Tiapita has been practicing livestock farming in Naivasha town since 2000. She is 36 years old, is married to Kitupei Ole Siano, and they have two children.

Tiapita was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to buy animals which she will rear and sell during the peak season at a profit.

Tiapita also wants to start making traditional ornaments which she will sell to her community and also to tourists who are normally attracted by them.

loans.use: To buy animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamin, es un hombre sabio y dedicado a su familia, adora a sus 4 hijos, pero solo vive con su esposa en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Cachunayo. En todo este tiempo se siente orgulloso de los logros alcanzados, ya que sus nietos que ya son todos universitarios. En tanto él se dedica a trabajar en una minera, de la que hoy solo obtiene una pequeña pensión, además obtiene productos como el maíz y papa que cultiva y que los vende en el mercado central de su localidad, eso lo ayuda también es su economía. Le gusta mucho el campo y a tantos años de esfuerzos y sacrificios, desde continuar dedicándose a la agricultura. En adelante desea obtener una pequeña estancia, donde se dedicará a la crianza de cuyes. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y agradece todo este tiempo a su banco comunal, que le apoyo en el logro de sus objetivos. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono para su cultivo de maíz, que muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en:
Benjamin is wise and dedicated to his family.  He loves his four children but only he and his wife live in their home in Cachunayo.  He is proud of what he has achieved over time, especially now that all of his grandchildren are attending university.

He works in mining, but he only receives a small pension now.  He also obtains products such as corn and potatoes that he grows and sells in his neighborhood’s central market.  This also helps him financially.

He likes the field very much after so many years of hard work and sacrifice while farming.  In the future he wants to obtain a small dwelling where he can raise Guinea pigs.

This will be his 10th loan through MFP and he is grateful to his communal bank that has offered him support and helped him to reach his goals.  He will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizer for his corn crop, which he will be harvesting soon.

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia S. is 64 years old, married, and supports her family by operating one business venture: a Carinderia (or food stall). She lives in Bogy City, La Paz, Bogo, Cebu.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Carinderia (food stall), she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

Virginia is now borrowing PHP 10000 so that she can continue to fund her business. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Virginia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of her Carinderia (food stall)

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Забиров Баходур проживает в районе Файзабад. Возраст, 27 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Рядом с домом открыл продуктовый магазин. Два месяца как занимается торговлей. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Bahodur Z. lives in the Fayzabad district.  He is 27 years old, married and has 2 children.  He has a secondary education.  Bahodur opened a food store near his house and has been involved in sales for two months.  He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.  He wants to expand his business.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel P. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. He is 43 years old. Ruel is single. To make a living, Ruel owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "abal-habal" services to local community members. Ruel has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. Ruel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed to expand services provided. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ruel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed to expand services provided

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: By

texts.en: By T. is a 37-year-old professional teacher in the province of Kompong Cham. She was married, but she divorced her husband years ago. She now has two children. They are single and still living under her management. By T. has over 10 years teaching experience. She can make an income of approximately $3 per day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. Currently, By T. is concerned that her motorbike is getting old, and breaks down while driving. By T. will use her loan, combined with her personal savings, to buy a used motorbike to replace her broken one so she can drive to work reliably.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike

loans.name: G.s. Divino Niño N. 10 Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Divino Niño N. 10 lo conforman Dolores y Rosa Emelina, esta no es la primera vez que realizan financiamientos. Dolores se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, ella es una persona muy eficiente por lo que les gusta mucho este medio de vida. Rosa Emelina tiene la venta de bolsas plásticas la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingresos para sufragar los gastos de su familia, pues siempre le ha gustado mejorar su actividad y está pendiente para mejorar su actividad, juntas han logrado salir adelantes con sus negocio. Actualmente solicitan este crédito para la compra de  materia prima necesaria.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño N.10 solidarity group is comprised of Dolores and Rosa Emelina and this is not their first request for a loan.  

Dolores is a very efficient person who enjoys her business of selling general merchandise.  Rosa Emelina sells plastic bags in order to provide an income for her family.  She has always wanted to improve her business and is a hard worker.  Together they have been able to succeed in their respective activities.  They are currently requesting a loan to buy necessary raw materials.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Michael Jira

texts.en:
Michael Jira K. is a 38-year-old man married to Florence, and they have been blessed with six children. Michael owns a video café in Jomvu and has been in business for one year, while Florence is a business lady who owns a vegetable kiosk. Together they support their family.

This marks Michael’s first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase the latest new movies and seats for the café. He also plans to expand his wife’s vegetable kiosk with the anticipated profits.

Michael’s hope is to succeed in life.

loans.use: To improve his video café and expand his wife's kiosk

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school. Susan has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for less than one year.
To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Susan hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop. Susan is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her how to play games.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: El Trebol Magico Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama EL TRÉBOL MÁGICO, porque las integrantes dicen que el trébol es una hierba de tamaño pequeño y según las creencias trae buena suerte, al que lo posee le proporciona un poder especial: suerte en el comercio, en el amor y en la riqueza. ¡Suerte ilimitada!. El grupo esta ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo, la señora  Angélica C. L. tiene 22 años de edad  y se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace tres años, no tiene hijos, y su crédito lo solicitó para la compra de maíz y un comal para incrementar la producción.
texts.en:
This group is called “EL TRÉBOL MÁGICO” (The Magic Clover) because the members say that clover is a small herb that people believe brings good luck; whoever possesses it acquires special powers: luck in commerce, in love and in wealth.  Unlimited Luck!  The group is located in the state of Hidalgo.  

Mrs. Angélica C. L., 22, has been a tortilla merchant for the past three years.  She does not have any children.  She asked for her loan to buy corn and a griddle to increase production.

loans.use: To buy corn and a griddle.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.en:
Milagros’s family consists of her 6 children, but just five of them live together with her and their father. They are a big family, with older and younger members, some of them bringing in income to the household and others attending school.  Milagros's family goals are to have a big house where all her children can live comfortably and succeed . Milagros also wants to finish her own studies and to have a locale for her business. She will be using her profit toward this goal.

Milagros is one of our businesswomen. She operates a business producing and selling cassava bread and turnovers ("empanada", a small round of cassava flour, filled with meat and fried). She presently sells them by her home, that's why she wants to have a locale. She will invest in a machine for grinding cassava. She has more clients and she wants to expedite the process. After she has been running her business, she feels more comfortable with her income and expenses.

loans.use: to buy a machine for grinding cassava

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida T. is from the village of San Antonio, Cabisera 18, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 51 years old. Zenaida is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Zenaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El Señor Enrique M. de 44 años de edad, está en pareja desde hace 10 años con la Señora Juana Lesme de 32 años de edad; la pareja tiene un hijo de 7 años que está cursando el 2do. Grado de la primaria.
El sr. Enrique se dedica al negocio de ropería y mercería desde hace 6 años, su lugar de trabajo está ubicado dentro del mercado municipal y trabaja con su señora, quien le ayuda en el negocio y es también quien administra todo, porque el señor muchas veces sale al interior del país para traer verduras que luego comercializa en la zona o lleva en los grandes supermercados.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de pantalones, remeras, camisas, ropa interior, vaqueros, blusas, capri y otros artículos de ropería, para así ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y tener la posibilidad de aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Enrique M. is 44 years old.  He has been living with his partner, 32 year-old Juana Lesme, for 10 years.  The couple have a 7 year-old son who is in second grade. Enrique has a clothes business that he has owned for 6 years.  His sales location is in the town market and he works together with his partner Juana who helps him in his business.  She also manages the business because he often has to go abroad in order to buy vegetables that he then sells in their area or takes to the big supermarkets to sell.

Enrique is requesting this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, shirts, underwear, jeans, blouses, capri pants and other clothes so that he can offer more variety to his customers and have the possibility of increasing his income.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, capri pants, jeans and underwear

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره 39 سنة متزوج وله 7 اولاد يعمل كمزارع ومربي للمواشي وبيع الحليب واللحم له في عمله 20 سنة يحب عمله ويتميز به بالدقة والنظافة يمتلك عدد جيد من المواشي لكنه يواجه صعوبة بتأمين العلف لهم وصيانة المزرعة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء اعلاف للمواشي + اكنة للعلف لا يواجه صعوبات في المنافسة لكنه يريد ان يطور عمله ويطمح بشراء عدد اكبر من المواشي وتأمين المكان الجيد لهم
texts.en: Ali is 39 years old and married with seven children. He works as a farmer and raises livestock, as well as sells milk and meat. He has 20 years of experience in his work. He likes his work, and he stands out in his field of work through his attention to detail and cleanliness. He owns a good number of livestock, though he is facing difficulties in procuring feed for them, just as he is facing difficulties in keeping up his farm. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy feed for his livestock as well as a machine for the feed. Competition does not pose a problem for him, but he wishes to develop his business. His ambitions are to buy more livestock and to secure a good place for them.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his livestock and machinery for his farm.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Yucay,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lorenza; es soltera, la socia tiene 44 años de edad, la socia tiene 4 hijos 2 independientes, tiene otros 2 de (16, 10), la socia se dedica principalmente a la artesanía, la socia elabora todo tipo de artesanía en la puerta del hotel sonesta posada en Yucay, la socia vende guantes, coreas de lana con aplicaciones, chalinas, mantillas, mantas, gorros y todo hecho en lana de oveja, alpaca y lana sintética, la socia e esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de materiales para la confección de los diferentes tejidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas y otros para elaborar sus trabajos.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the Virgen Natividad Community Bank.  This bank is located in the Yucay village in the Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Lorenza is 44 years old, single, and has four children.  Two of her children are independent, and the other two are 16 and 10 years old.

She devotes herself primarily to making handicrafts.  She makes all types of handicrafts in the doorway of the Sonesta Posada Hotel in Yucay.  She sells gloves, wool belts with appliques, scarves, lace scarves, blankets, and hats.  Everything is made from wool from sheep and alpacas and synthetic wool.

She is now requesting a loan to be able to buy materials for making her different knitted products.  She is requesting the loan to buy wool and other things to make her pieces of work.

She is very grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy wool and other supplies to make her products

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro es una señora D. 60 años D. edad que vive con su hija y su yerno en una comunidad granD. en el distrito D. Patapo, departamento D. Lambayeque. Socorro es muy estimada en su comunidad, una comunidad urbana donD. la actividad predominante es la crianza D. animales y a pesar D. sus años Socorro  se dedica a eso.

Socorro cría cerdos desD. hace 15 años, en un corralón que es D. su propiedad y está hecho D. quincha. La quincha es una especie D. tejido D. tallos muy delgados (similares a los tallos D. bambú) que están pegados con barro. 

Socorro solicita un préstamo D. 3000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para levantar paredes D. adobe (material más resistente, hecho D. arcilla) en su corralón. Esto les brindará una mejor crianza a sus animales y contribuirá al crecimiento D. su negocio que se ha ido desarrollando D. manera positiva con el paso del tiempo.

Socorro  se siente segura D. que su negocio se beneficiará con ello, pues la raza D. sus cerdos es muy buena. 

Socorro  ha sido clienta D. Edpyme Alternativa y goza D. buenas referencias por cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Socorro is a 60-year-old woman who lives with her daughter and son-in-law in a large community in the district of Patapo, in the department of Lambayeque. Socorros is held in high esteem by her community, an urban area where the main economic activity is raising animals. In spite of her age, this is what Socorro does for a living.

Socorro has raised pigs for 15 years in a large patio on her property maD. of quincha. Quincha is a type of thin reed (similar to bamboo reeds) that are stuck together with mud. 

Socorro is asking for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to put up mud walls (more sturdy materials, maD. of clay) in her corral. This will help her to raise her animals better and will contribute to the expansion of her business that has been developing positively over time.Socorro feels sure that her business will benefit from this, since her pigs are from a good breed. 

Socorro has been a client of Edpyme Alternativa and has good references for making her payments on time.

loans.use: Construir corral para sus cerdos.

loans.name: Iboukoun-Olouwa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IBOUKOUN-OLOUWA  est composé de quatre personnes qui se connaissent et qui appartiennent au même groupe d’artisan.  C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Kolawolé est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Kolawolé est née en 1981, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Kolawolé est marié à une marchande du nom de Rosaline. Le couple a trois enfants à charge dont deux représentent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Kolawolé est un électricien. A côté de cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Kolawolé vend depuis six ans des pièces électriques, dans son atelier. Kolawolé s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Kolawolé sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un premier crédit.
texts.en: The Iboukoun-Olouwa group is composed of four people who know each other and belong to the same artisans' group. This is the first time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), and are doing so in order to raise the level of their businesses. The group representative, named Kolawolé, is the man whose hand is raised in the photo. Kolawolé was born in 1981 in the Ouémé department. He is married to a shopkeeper named Rosaline. The couple have three children in their care, of whom two are their own. All of the children attend school and live together with their parents. Kolawolé is an electrician. Alongside his job, which allows him to provide for himself and his family, Kolawolé has been selling electrical equipment at his workshop for six years. He gets his supplies in Nigeria, a country bordering Benin. With the goal of satisfying his clientele and increasing his sales volume and income, Kolawolé, together with his group, is seeking his first loan.

loans.use: To buy electrical equipment (starters, alternators, bulbs, etc)

loans.name: Belle Fille Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Belle Fille est constitué de sept femmes  qui sont mariées, majoritairement dans des familles monogames, avec en moyenne 30 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. 
Les membres du groupe font le commerce de jus locaux, de porte feuilles, d’encens et d’habits pour enfants. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce pour certaines et d’entreprendre d’autres activités génératrices de revenus pour d’autres, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata a une grande réputation dans la  fabrication - vente d’encens dans son quartier et au marché Château de Ségou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 kg de Magnonkissèni, deux flacons d’eau de Cologne et des parfums dont le choix se fait en fonction du goût de la clientèle. Elle se ravitaille en gros au grand marché de Ségou en ces produits. Pour faire de l’encens, on imbibe pendant 3 jours au moins le Magnonkissèni dans l’eau de Cologne puis on l’assaisonne avec des parfums. Ce produit obtenu est ainsi partagé entre les bouteilles destinées à la vente en détail, à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes. Madame Aminata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The Belle Fille group consists of seven married women with an average age of 30 and 3 children.  Most live in monogamous families.  They all live in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) and know one another through ties of neighborhood, marriage and kinship. The group members sell juice made from local fruits, pocketbooks, incense and children’s clothing.  The group members decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that some of them could increase their working capital and others could undertake new  lines of businesses.  They  are on their 1st solidarity loan cycle.  Aminata has a good reputation for making and selling incense in her neighborhood and at the Ségou  Château market.  She plans to use her loan to buy 5 kg of  Magnonkissèni (seeds of a wild plant), two bottles of eau de cologne and fragrances that are selected according to the tastes of her customers.  She gets her supplies of these products wholesale at the Ségou Grand Market.  To make incense, Magnonkissèni is soaked in eau de cologne for at least 3 days, then fragrance is added.  The product obtained is then divided among bottles that will be sold retail to a clientele composed for the most part of women. Mrs. Aminata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA from this loan which will be used to reinvest in the business and to take care of the family’s everyday expenses. Her goal is to increase the volume of her business in this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To buy basic materials for making incense

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 40 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  She and her family live in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Celsa is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living.  She has been cultivating rice for 30 years.  She plants this kind of crop because its  economically in demand.  She earns PHP 50,000 every quarter.  

Celsa is in need of rice seedlings to plant her next crop.  She has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 from GDMPC to buy rice seedlings to plant her field for the coming season. 

Celsa has been a member of GDMPC more than 3 years. In the future, she hopes that she can buy a 50-hectare field for rice planting.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 23 years old and has been practicing mixed farming for four years.  She produces maize, beans and milk which are sold to the local market in Nyamira in South Rift Kenya. She is married and has three children between 10 and 6 years old.

Rose has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the cow will make the provision of meals for her children a possibility and the additional income can be used to meet other family needs.  She wants to save enough to venture into the transport business in the future.

Rose says that challenges for her remain the poor road network and low market prices for her products.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, vive junto a su esposo y una hija, ella se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, este negocio lo tiene desD. hace 6 años surgió por iniciativa propia, sus clientes son vecinos y amigos que transitan en la zona, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades con el negocio.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. maíz y leña para la venta D. tortillas, esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y obtener buenas ganancias, las cuales le servirán para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Su objetivo es tener el negocio con todo lo necesario, ayudar a su familia a través D. sus ganancias cubriendo las necesidades más prioritarias.
texts.en:
Juana lives with her husband and her daughter.  She works selling tortillas, a business she started six years ago on her own.  Her customers are neighbors and friends who travel in the area.  Up until now, she has not had difficulties with the business.

She is asking for this loan to purchase corn and firewood for the sale of tortillas.  This investment will help her strengthen her business and earn a good profit, which will support her family.  

Her goal is to have everything necessary for the business and help her family by covering the necessities with her income.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood for the sale of tortillas.

loans.name: Mercy's Group

texts.en:
Mercy is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Mercy runs a business selling vegetables and fruits, which she has had for less than a year. 

Mercy is a member of a loan group comprised of three hardworking women. She is also a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.   

Mercy is requesting a loan of 250,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to purchase vegetables and fruit to sell. With the help of her loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Mercy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Kelly Yakeline

texts.es:
Kelly  de 29 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con el servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de Pítipo que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.
	
Desde hace algunos años Kelly se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, fideos, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su seguridad desde hace 3 años, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Kelly es una persona dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles más comodidades a sus hijos y otras oportunidades académicas.
texts.en:
Kelly, 29, lives with her husband and two children in her own house that only has electricity and is located in Pítipo District belonging to Lambayeque Department.  This zone is noted for farming and cattle raising.

For several years now Kelly has been selling basic need items (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, noodles, etc.) and beverages.  Her business is located in her home for safety and it’s been operating for three years.  Profits obtained from sales of her products she tries to use to cover all her expenses and to improve her family’s standard of living.

In order to be able to expand the business she’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy more merchandise.  Her only goal is that the business grows and to have more stock merchandise available for her customers.  Kelly is a hardworking, dedicated person who strives to provide more comfort for her children as well as other academic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
Малика замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Она порядочная, умная и добрая женщина. Она занимается приготовлением лепешек со своими родственниками более 10 лет и у неё очень богатый опыт. Она хочет, устроит своих детей в хорошую школу, и выросли хорошими образованными и трудолюбивыми людьми. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получит хорошую прибыль. Малика хотела бы получить займ в размере 2300$ США для покупки муку на запас с целью расширения бизнеса. Она благодарна вам Кива кредиторы за вашу поддержку и милосердие. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Malika is a married and loving mother of three children.  She is a decent, smart and kind woman.  She has been involved in preparing flatbread together with her relatives for over ten years and has a very rich experience in this field.  She wants to place her children into a good school, so that they grow up to be good, educated and hard-working people.  She wants to expand her business and receive a good profit.  Malika wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2300 for the purchase of flour to stock with the goal of expanding her business.  She is grateful to Kiva creditors for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe BENKADI 1 est composé de femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et l’arachide  avec Madame MICHATA debout au milieu.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et la semence d’arachide pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village à LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75 000 FCFA  en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi I is made up of  married women. They are on average 38 years old and have an average of 4 children each. For the most part they live in polygamous families in Maaro, a village located about 45 km from Sikasso, 3rd administrative district of Mali.

They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. This is their fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were fully repaid. The crops they grow are rice and groundnuts. Madame Michata, standing in the center, plans to pay for plowing costs and to buy inputs and groundnut seeds for 0.5 hectare of land. After the harvest, the crops are sold at the village of Loutanna and at the Sikasso market to customers who are both men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 75,000 CFA francs at the end of the season. The profit will allow her to repay the loan and help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and groundnut seeds and to pay for plowing costs.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transportation.  

For the past 20 years, she has operated a food vending business, selling from her home to neighbours and passersby. The high cost of transportation is a major challenge in her business. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With her KES 35,000 loan, Mwanajuma wants to purchase timber posts and barbed wire to fence her plot. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase timber posts and barbed wire to fence her plot.

loans.name: Blanca Azuvena

texts.es:
Blanca de 39 años, es una mujer trabajadora que es vendedora de ropa. Comenzó su negocio con un préstamo en D-MIRO para tener un capital de trabajo fuerte y comenzar con su negocio. 

Poco a poco fue desarrollando su negocio con variedades de ropa. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am vendiendo ropa y bebidas para generar dinero ya que tiene tres hijos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere mejorar la visualidad de su negocio ampliando las paredes para que el cliente tenga comodidad al ver la mercadería. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, arena y bloques.
texts.en:
Blanca, 39, is a hardworking woman who sells clothes.  She started her business with a D-MIRO loan to be well capitalized and start her business.  Gradually, she developed the business with a variety of clothes.  

Presently, she works from 8am selling clothes and beverages to generate income since she has three children.  She has many goals for her business and this is why she wants to improve its appearance expanding the walls so that her customers will be able to examine her merchandise more comfortably.  She will use the loan to buy cement, sand and concrete blocks.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 28 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Azim

texts.ru: Азим предприниматель широкого профиля. Он занимается и садоводством, и скотоводством и выращиванием селхозкультур. На земле он выращивает картофель и пшеницу, отходы от сельхозкультур идут на откорм крупного и мелкого рогатого скота, а садовые продукты он сушит и продает на рынке. Он хочет получить займ на расширение своего бизнеса, приобретения скота и семян для посева. Азим женат, имеет четверых детей. Все они находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. В бизнесе ему помогает его жена.
texts.en: Azim is a multidisciplinary entrepreneur.  He is involved in gardening, animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops.  He grows potatoes and wheat on the land and uses the agricultural crop waste for feeding cattle and small livestock.  As for garden products, he dries them and sells them at a market.  Azim wants to obtain this loan to expand his business, buy livestock and seeds for sowing.  Azim is married and has four children, all of whom are working in the Russian Federation.  His wife helps him with the business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds for sowing

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: La señora Rosa María es madre de 3 hijas jóvenes entre 13 y 20 años una ya se encuentra casada pero aun así no deja de ir a verla. Para Rosa es muy importante ofrecer a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida, por ello hace 4 años inicio con su negocio de ropa usada y zapatos al frente de su casa y algunas veces en una colonia de la ciudad. El esposo y ella trabajan en maquiladora 10 horas diarias para obtener un ingreso fijo y poder cubrir los gastos del hogar. Rosa María quiere comprar ropa de temporada como suéteres, blusas de manga larga, pantaloneras, chaquetas de esta manera estará preparada para el invierno.
texts.en: Rosa María is the mother of 3 young daughters between the ages of 13 and 20. One is married already but even so she still goes to see her. For Rosa it is very important to offer her daughters a better quality of life. Because of this, she started a used clothing and shoes  business 4 years ago in front of her house and sometimes in a neighborhood in town. She and her husband work in factory 10 hours a day to have a steady income and cover the household expenses. Rosa María wants to buy seasonal clothing such as sweaters, blouses, long sleeved shirts, pants, and jackets. In this way she will be preparing for winter.

loans.use: to buy seasonal winter clothing

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: La señora Janet es ama de casa y su esposo es jubilado rentista. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (arena, estuco, pinturas) ya que se realizara el arreglo y pintado de la fachada de su hogar. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Obrajes  de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada  y  tiene cuatro hijos pero ya están casados. Es la primera vez que Janet aplica para  obtener un crédito en IMPRO y también en Kiva.
texts.en:
Señora Janet is a housewife, and her husband is a retired property manager.  The loan requested is for the purchase of construction materials (sand, stucco, paint), as they are fixing up and painting the facade of their home.

She lives in her own home, which is located in the Obrajes area of La Paz city.  She is married with four children, who are themselves married.

This is the first time that Janet has applied for a loan through IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase sand, stucco, and paint to fix up and paint the facade of their home.

loans.name: Luis Uriel

texts.es: Luis hombre trabajador humilde tiene su vehículo el cual el mismo lo trabaja ofreciendo el servicio de taxi. Tiene planes grandes de mejorar su vivienda poco a poco, se le ha presentado dificultades de alza de combustible y de unos descompuestos de su vehículo en lo que es las tijeras siendo prejudicial ya que son partes importante del carro y para su funcionamiento. Con el préstamo que solicitad comprara repuestos como: válvulas, juego de rotulas, aceite, par de ranquin, terminales, tubo de grasa, sellos de empaques, polvera de flechas, entre otros repuesto que requieren para la elaboración del overol, reparación del sistema de dirección, eléctrico, cambio de banda de tiempo siendo necesario para seguir trabajándolo y recibir ingreso económico para su familia.
texts.en: Luis is a hardworking humble man.  He has a vehicle that he uses to provide taxi services.  He plans to make improvements to his home little by little.  He’s had some difficulties because of the increase in gas prices and some repairs have come up, on important parts of the car, vital for its operation.  He will use the money from this loan to buy valves, bearing sets, a pair of rakes, terminals, a tube of grease, seals, and other spare parts that he needs to repair the steering mechanism, the electrical system, and timing belt, so that he can keep working and receive an income for his family.

loans.use: to buy repair parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Ibrahim.  He is married to a trader, and has 3 children aged 16, 13 and 11 years.  He has 1 additional dependent, who lives with him.

In 2001, Ibrahim established his tailoring items business - selling materials, thread, needles, designing threads.   He began his business after he completed his high school.   Unfortunately, his father, who was taking care of his schooling, died and his mother, who was sick died too, so there was nobody to take responsibility for him.   He decided to assist other people in their business until he raised enough capital to start his own business.  

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,900,000 every month from this business.  He is assisted by his wife and treats his customers fairly.  His customers are people around the city center and tailoring shops.   Mr. Ibrahim offers quality goods to satisfy their needs.   He uses public transport to buy  goods in Conakry and Freetown twice a month.  He would like a loan for Le 5,000,000.  Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase popline 1 bale @ Le2,500,000, lace cord 300 pieces @ Le6,000 and stickers 10 rolls @ Le70,000.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 885,000.

He uses his profit to invest in his business as he wants his children to have a very good education.   Instability of foreign exchange rate is his major challenge.   He anticipates using his profit to buy more goods and is planning to open another shop.  He knows he will be able to accomplish this goal.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther de 20 años, convive con Hugo de 21 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 01 hijo. Juntos habitan en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Esther, es una joven creativa dedicada al arte en tallado esta actividad lo realiza juntamente con su querido esposo en un local alquilado. Cuenta que un día hizo su primer trabajo para un amigo y éste le pareció atractivo que le recomendó que hiciera en mayores cantidades, fue así que ella y su querido esposo empezaron a dedicarse a tallar la maderas en forma de animales exóticos entre aves y mamíferos. Siendo estas exhibidas y vendidas en una de las ferias del distrito de Pichari, donde causaron sensación entre los concurrentes y no se resistieron ante tanta creatividad. Esther está contenta con esta labor que realiza, ya que es una manera de poder generar su propio ingreso, generalmente trabaja en sociedad con su esposo. En un futuro desea ampliar su tienda de artesanía pero en un local propio. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará más materiales de trabajo, como madera y pintura.
texts.en:
Esther is 20 years old and lives with 21 year old Hugo.  They have a son and live together in a rented house in the Pichari district.  Esther is a creative young woman and she and her husband both do carvings from a rented workshop.  She says that one day she did a job for one of her friends and he liked it so much that he suggested that she do many projects and this is how she began making wooden carvings of exotic animals, birds, and mammals, which she shows and sells at one of the Pichari district fairs.  They’ve caused a sensation among the competition and [the couple’s] creativity has not been restricted.  Esther is happy with her work because it’s a way for her to generate an income of her own.  She generally works with her husband and wants to expand her arts shop and set up a location of her own.

This will be her first loan thorough MFP and she’s committed to making her payments on time.  She’ll use the 1,500 PEN ($575) to buy supplies like wood and paint.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Ofelia; La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de articulos de bazar, la socia vende regalos, adornos pequeños, vajillas, peluches, juguetes entre otros articulos. La socia desea en esta ocasión invertir el prestamo en la compra de articulos para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
The member is Ofelia. 

The member continues with her business of buying and selling gift items. 

She sells gifts, small ornaments, dishes, furry stuffed animals, and toys among other items 

The member wants at this time to use the money from a loan to buy supplies to be used in her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to be used in her business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married and has nine children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvira is 53 years old.

Elvira has a rice mill business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

Elvira has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
Cruz María tiene 45 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 18, 17 y 4 años de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely grande, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Cruz María se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

 Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura comprando semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, líquido para plagas, insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito aumentará los sembríos.

Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. El sueño es comprarse un terreno.
En el tiempo libre le gusta ver a los animales.
texts.en:
Cruz María, age 45, is in a common-law marriage and has three children.  She lives with her husband and three children, ages 18, 17, and 4, in Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

She is a member of the “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) communal bank in the Cachely Grande precinct of the Ventanas canton.  This communal bank devotes itself to the agricultural work of growing short cycle corn, rice, and pigeon pea beans.

Cruz María grows corn.  She buys and sells her agricultural products in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and supplies.  With the support of the loan her crops will increase.  She faces challenges like pest infestations, diseases, and climate changes.

Her dream is to buy a piece of land.  She likes to spend her free time with the animals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and supplies.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Crée le 14 Janvier 1998, le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles habitent toutes le même village, et partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. 

Madame Aminata (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée et un voile mauve), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans, mariée et  mère de 07 enfants dont 03 filles et 04 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus qu’elle achète dans la sous région pour le revendre dans son quartier.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des tissus teintés d’une valeur de 180000f et d’autres tissus d’un montant de 100000f et d’autres marchandises.

 Les bénéfices lui permettront de finir les constructions de sa maison et assister son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne
texts.en:
This group was created on the 14th of January, 1998. It is made up of women who have, in the main, built up a solid experience in the retail sector and who are primarily retailers. They all live in the same village and share the same values of solidarity and mutual help.

Aminata (sitting on the far right with her hand raised and wearing a purple veil) is the group's featured borrower. She is 56 years old, married and the mother of 7 children, 3 girls and 4 boys. She sells fabrics which she buys in the sub-region and resells in her district. This new loan will enable her to buy 180 000 francs worth of dyed fabrics, 100 000 francs worth of other fabrics, and other merchandise. The profits she earns will allow her to finish the construction project on her house and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabrics, other fabrics and other products.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Kapsowar, Kenya is a town that is famously known for producing the “creme de la creme” when it comes to athletics. It also has a lot of smallholder farmers who work the land and raise animals. 
Unfortunately, the people who do this farm work face many problems, like the high costs of the farm inputs. Monica has full knowledge of this but always finds a way to come through. 

Monica is from a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya and she is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her three children as the primary caregiver. For the past 8 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize and vegetables and also keeping dairy cows. Monica has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Monica is requesting a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Monica believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Monica waits for your kindness.

Be inspired to loan to her today to keep her big smile!

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Joyce Sempeyo

texts.en:
This business is a member of Enkakenya Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Joyce is an active member of Enkakenya Women Group which started five years ago. She is married with two children not yet ready for school.

Joyce attended WEECâ€™s livestock programme training and later was given a livestock loan. She has managed to pay it back. Meanwhile, she has been saving small money with the group and this has made her qualify for yet another loan.

loans.use: She plans to buy 4 steers, rear them for some few months and sell. She says the current season is good for them as there is enough pasture.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miquel has 7 years experience in selling seafood, which he learned from his Father, who took him to work with him from the time he was quite little. That was when he began to like this trade. Later, with his Mother, he decided to work on his own account since he was now married and needed to be able to cover the costs of his home. He works from 4am to 11am every day, along with his wife and a relative who helps them remove the meat from crabs so that later it can be put into tubs and sold. Miguel wants a loan to be able to invest in the business and get more income. He wants to provide work for his brother so that, with capital from him they can, little by little have their own business, that is his present goal. Miguel is married, 23 years old, and has a daughter six months old. He hopes with his work to have his own home, since he now lives with his parents. >p< >b> Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva Volunteer.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Hire his brothers to help him in the seafood business.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: "I changed to this business two years ago and I have no cause to regret it. I am 38 years old, married with three children; my numerous customers alway give me satisfaction," says Mrs. Mabel I.. She will use her loan of USD400 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sales

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Mr. Khiev Y. is 38 years old.  He is married and a father of three children, who are students.  He lives with his wife in Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. He makes a living by transporting passengers with a horse carriage.  With this business activity, he can typically make about $5/day in revenue.  His wife sells bananas along the roadside and earns around $2.50 a day in revenue. Khiev Y. is currently asking for a loan of $1200 to purchase a horse and repair a carriage. He expresses gratitude for your help as you can play a very important role in his business's growth.

loans.use: to purchase a horse and repair a carriage

loans.name: Sunui

texts.en:
Sunui joined SPBD in April 2005. She run a small taro plantation with the help of her husband and her two sons. She has six children and the family is very poor, to the point where she sometimes cannot afford to send her children to school. She has been working hard on her farm because this is the only source of income for her family. On Saturdays, Sunui sells the taro in the market where she can earn up to US$120-160. People in her village also buy from her sometimes.

Sunui is planning to use her Kiva loan to build a small place on the road side where she can sell coconuts, pumpkins, beans, tomatoes and cabbages in addition to taro.

loans.use: To help with her plantation.

loans.name: Lesy Belmalin

texts.es:
I have a small business selling fried chicken and fried potatoes. This business has been located in my home for five years. My sales are very good since my clients like the flavor of my chickens. With the business I help my family with monthly expenses that we have with our children.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

I have a small business of the sale of fried chicken and chipses. This business this hubicado in my house for 5 years. My sales are very good since my clients lesgusta the flavor of my chickens. With this business I help to my family with monthly expenses that we have with our children.

loans.use: purchase of chickens, potatoes, onion, garlic, spices etc

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Thai T., age 23, is housewife. Her husband is a recycler, earning about $1 per day in profit from reselling the items he collects to the recycling plant. They have two small children who are not yet in school. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase five piglets to raise, feed, and house in a barn. Once she resells the grown pigs, she will increase her family’s income which will help finance her children’s education one day. Her husband is pictured in the photo as his wife was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan was born in 1975. He lives in Khachmaz town. This man is single. Four years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy one cattle for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy one cattle

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan L., 26, is married with two school-age children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has no job outside the home but stays at home cooking food for her family, while her husband is employed as a security-guard and typically makes on average around $5 each day.

L. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use to ride to work. With a new motorcycle, her husband will save a lot of money that he presently has to spend using a motor-taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use to go to work

loans.name: Katogo D(2056)A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Lydia B.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Lydia is 26 years old and married. She has 3 children ranging from age 1.5 to 12 and two of her children go to school.

Lydia is joined in her small group by Deborah Namuddu, Jennifer N., Hadija M., and Elizabeth N.. Deborah Namuddu has a business in poultry farming and wants to purchase poultry feeds. Jennifer N. is currently operating a business in selling used clothes and wants a loan to purchase more clothes for sale. Hadija M. operates a business of beauty parlor and wants to boost business. Elizabeth Namkwaya is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to increase inventory.

loans.use: To boost retail shop business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is a single mother of a thirteen-year-old unique son.  To make a living and support her son, Isabel sells cleaning materials such as brooms, mops, detergents and the like.  Isabel operates her business mainly from her house, but from time to time she visits her friends and people in the close-by neighborhood to sell her products.  With her loan, Isabel will increase her stock so that she can better satisfy her customers’ needs.  Having more items available will increase her income and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning products to resell in her community.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
Eufemia C. D. R. is 65 years old. She currently lives in Chongoyape, in the district of Paiján, in the province of Ascope in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She has 10 children, none of whom are dependent on her. Eufemia studied up until the first graD. of primary school.

She began her business selling various vegetables, yucca and potatoes in the door of her house in Paiján. Through some friends she joined the Community Bank “Manos Unidas” (Hands together).

The last loan she received was used in order to buy spices wholesale, which resulted in lots of sales. Currently every morning she sells in the Casa GranD. market, which is going well because she has sold in the market for quite a long time now, and so has attracted many customers.

With the loan of 2000 Soles, which she will repay within 6 months, she will buy two sacks of dried chilies, garlic, spicy pepper, black peppers, cumin seed and a variety of vegetables.

Her dearest wish is to expand her business and secure a larger stall.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Eufemia C. D. R. tiene 65 años D. edad, actualmente vive en Chongoyape, Distrito D. Paiján, Provincia D. Ascope del Departamento D. La Libertad - Perú; tiene 10 hijos, ninguno dependen D. ella. La señora Eufemia estudió hasta el primer grado D. primaria.

Inició su negocio vendiendo unas cuantas verduras, yuca, papa en la puerta D. su casa en Paiján; por unas amigas ingresa al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”.

Su anterior préstamo que recibió lo utilizo para comprar especias al por mayor el cual tuvo muchas ventas. Actualmente todos los días por las mañanas venD. en el mercado D. Casa GranD., le va bien pues ya tiene bastante tiempo vendiendo en este mercado y ha conseguido mucha clientela.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 el cual pagara en seis meses, comprará dos sacos D. ají seco, ajo entero, rocoto, pimienta y comino entero, y una variedad D. verduras.

Su mayor sueño es ampliar más su negocio y conseguir un puesto más granD..

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi L., 37 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1998. Her family has 4 members: 2 parents and 2 children who are still going to school. At first, she usually invested borrowed money in general store. These days, since the price for building materials has gone up and since she is able to borrowed a larger amount of money from the Fund, Mrs. L. switches to doing business in building materials. Besides, she also sells fuel and gas. Her current average income is 250 USD/month. Her wish is to be continually assisted by the TYM Fund to improve her business. This time, she wants to borrow 625 USD to buy more materials.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị L., 37 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1998. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Thời gian đầu chị L. thường vay vốn buôn bán hàng tạp hóa. Công việc này có thu nhập thường xuyên rất thuận lợi cho việc hoàn trả tuần. Trong những năm gần đây khi giá nguyên vật liệu xây dựng đang tăng cộng với được vay những mức vốn lớn từ Quỹ, chị L. chuyển sang kinh doanh vật liệu xây dựng. Bên cạnh đó chị còn bán thêm mặt hàng xăng dầu. Thu nhập hàng tháng hiện nay của chị là 250USD. Mong muốn của chị L. là được Quỹ hỗ trợ vốn lâu dài để phát triển công việc kinh doanh. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị vòng này là 625USD mua vật liệu.

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Juma Omary's Mt Udzungwa Group

texts.en:
Juma O., age 40, is married with six children (ages 16,14,12,10, 8, and 6). He has been a carpenter for 10 years. He works from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $169.

Previously, Juma has taken out one loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his capital. He hopes for a new loan to buy more wood for his furniture mart and to buy a passenger truck for transporting goods. Juma will share this loan with his group members dealing in poultry, animal keeping, and selling food, fruits, vegetables, and cold drinks and beers. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Juma is second from the left in the back row.

loans.use: To buy more wood for his furniture business and to buy a passenger truck

loans.name: Adelaide Joaquim

texts.pt:
Adelaide Joaquim C. is 50 years old and is from Manjacaze, province of Gaza, in southern Mozambique. She is the single mother of 7 children. Besides her children she supports her grandchildren, who live with her.

Adelaide studied until the 4th grade and then had to quit because she got pregnant and was forced to go back home. In 2000 she decided to go back to school to finish 5th grade, and she is currently in the 7th grade.

In 1987 Adelaide, along with her husband and children, was forced to abandon Gaza province due to the war and move to the outskirts of the city of Maputo. In 2001 her husband decided to abandon her and the 7 children, leaving them in the worst possible conditions, especially in terms of housing. The house he left them collapsed, and Adelaide is trying to solve the problem by building a better one.

Adelaide has worked as a cook since 1982. Her workday begins at 7:30 a.m. and ends at 4:00 p.m. Her monthly salary is 1,800.00 MT, and she is not able to set aside any of it. Her savings go toward paying her loan, and whatever is left goes toward food expenses. This is Adelaide’s third loan through Hluvuku. All her loans have been for construction materials, since she is building her home in phases. Her biggest dream is to see her family living in good housing conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Adelaide Joaquim C. tem 50 anos de idade e natural de manjacaze provincia de gaza ao sul de Moçambique. Solteira e mae de 7 filhos. Para alem da sua familia sustenta netos que vivem com ela.

Adelaide estudou até 4ªclasse e parou por ter se engravidada e foi obrigada a ir ao lar. Só em 2000 é que decide voltar a escola e fez a 5ªclasse e agora frequenta 7ªclasse. Em 1987 Adelaide foi obrigada abandonar a Provincia de gaza junto com a familia que tinha formada ( Marido e filhos) devido a Guerra e foi para nos bairros perifericos da cidade de maputo onde em 2001 o marido decide abandonar a ela com os 7 filhos em piores condições principalemte habitacional e a casa que lhes deixou ficou a tumbar e agora está nesta de procurar resolver o problema construindo uma casa melhorada.

Adelaide trabalha como cozinheira desde 1982. Tem um horário de 7:30 até 16:00h. Aprendeu o serviço dentro da empresa a 20 anos atras. Tem um salário mensal de 1800,00mt,não consegue poupar . a minha poupança é para pagar o credito e o que resta é para despesas de alimentação.

Para Adelaide este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku sempre pediu para compra de material de construção uma vez que está construindo em fazes. Constitui seu grande sonho ver sua familia bem alojada.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Llesica

texts.es:
Llesica belongs to the Communal Bank “Teresa Ramos”, she lives at Jr. 3 de Octubre, Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali state. She is 29 years old, has 2 small children, and her husband is a mechanic. With the first loan from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 she decided to invest in selling chickens.

Llesica today continues her business raising chickens, and she enjoys raising animals and therefore has decided to invest her money in buying and selling chickens, thereby helping her husband with the family expenses.

With the current loan for S/2.000 which will be repaid in 5 months, she will invest in purchasing 200 chickens, chicken feed, and waterers.

Llesica is very happy to participate in the Manuela Ramos Bank, as it is a great support for all women who have businesses and want to improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Llesica, pertenece al Banco Comunal Teresa Ramos, ubicado en el Jr. 3 de Octubre, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años, tienes 2 pequeños hijos, su esposo es mecánico. Llesica con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de Pollos.

En la actualidad esta con el negocio de crianza de pollos, a Llesica le encanta la crianza de animales es por eso que decidió invertir su dinero en compra y venta de pollos, y así puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de su familia.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 200 pollos, alimentos balanceados y bebederos.

Llesica, se siente muy contenta de participar en el Banco Manuela Ramos, ya que es un gran apoyo para todas las mujeres que tenemos negocios y que queremos progresar.

loans.use: Purchase chickens, chicken feed, and waterers.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch B., 57, is married and lives with her husband in a part of Siem Reap province, which is an attractive tourist site in Cambodia. She and her husband work making and selling a variety of desserts to the people in her community and they collectively earn around $9/day of income. Mrs. Touch B. has five children. Her single son is employed by a construction company. Her other two daughters work at a local restaurant, and the rest of her children are married and live outside the family home. Mrs.Touch B. would like to request a loan from KIVA to expand her business and purchase more utensils and some other equipment in order to meet her growing customer demands.

loans.use: To buy more utensils for her food business

loans.name: Zumra

texts.en: Zumra K. comes from a suburb of ŽIvinice. She is married and lives with her husband and her grown son. Her husband and son are employed, but they earn little, and that is the reason that they all work together in their field. The men work hard and Zumra does the daily job of caring for the sheep and goats. They have enough food for the animals but they want to buy more goat to rice and resell it. Zumra decided to take a loan in WWI in amount of 800 KM to extend her herd.

loans.use: To buy a goat

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson A. K. is a 38-year-old married man. He and his wife have two kids, both of whom are currently in school. Johnson is a dealer of plumbing materials and food stuffs; to illustrate, he sells maize, which he receives from local farming communities. Notably, he has been in this line of business for 6 years and, over that course of time, he has developed a loyal customer base.

He buys his supplies at wholesale prices and he then sells such supplies to his customers at retail prices. Now, he is seeking a loan to increase his stock of plumbing materials, including pipes and sinks. In turn, he hopes that he will generate greater income in order to expand his shop.

Johnson is a member of the group known as "Bamali Sha Allah" (without God, you can do nothing) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. His picture was taken at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: The increase his inventory of plumbing materials and to eventually expand his shop

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon S., 57, is a farmer and raises pigs from her house in Pursat Province, which is located 200 kilometers west of Phnom Penh. She can earn around $1.50 per day. She lives with her husband and one child. Her husband is a local doctor and runs a small business selling medicine targeted at the customers who live in his area. Nuon needs a loan for her husband's business to purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine for her husband's business to sell

loans.name: Ange

texts.en:
After graduating from business school a year ago, Mrs. P. Ange was still jobless. In order to meet her basic expenses such as rent and food, she has decided to pursue her mother's path by opening a small business to sell cakes.  In the local language, the cakes are called “bodocoin.” She sells these cakes in a school with 500 students. 

She earns a decent income from her business, but she remains limited financially to meet the high demand of her clients. Therefore she is requesting a loan of 500 dollars to expand her business and enable her to sell more “ bodocoin”, as well as orange and pineapple juice to her clients  By doing so, she will be able to make a profit and pay back for her loan within 18 months. She appreciates the support of those who are helping her fulfill her business dream.

loans.use: to make and sell more cakes

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabali (composé de 5 femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 33ans avec en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles resident dans le quartier  Ouayerma I dans la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes telles que l’achat vente des chaussures, du bois de chauffe, du bazin, des tasses et seaux en plastique.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante les membres de ce groupe ont  intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, il y a 3 ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Tous les prêts  précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 4 douzaines de chaussures, 10 chargements de bois de chauffe, 1 trentaine d’habits  pour enfant, 1 dizaine de pagnes et bazin (de 5 mètres bien teintés) et 1cinquantaine de tasses et seaux en plastique. 
Elles s’approvisionnent soit en Côte D’ivoire pays frontalier du Mali soit à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  ou sur place à Sikasso.
