According to her work references, Agustina is a woman of good principles.  She is honest and very hard-working.  Agustina is a loyal client of our institution.  She receives financial help from her older children and makes income from her small farm.  Her dream in life is to keep her beautiful family united, and for them to enjoy good health and job security.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna, 53, lives in the Philippines and is married with nine children. She has a karaoke shop that provides videoke, where customers pay 5 pesos per song. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the electricity of the services.

Digna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Digna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity of the services.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is applying for another loan to expand her current business. She will use this loan of KES 20,000 to purchase building and construction materials to build her retail shop. In the future, Eunice aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Eunice has been able to improve her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase building and construction materials to build her retail shop

loans.name: Gandaria 2 Group

texts.en:
Dahlia is 35 years old and married with three children. She began her business selling snacks five years ago but this is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She sells snacks from her house and thus far it has been profitable and supplements her husband's income. 

The loan will help her increase her stock of snacks to resell so hopefully her income can increase. She hopes that her children can stay in school and can eventually attend college because she was only given the chance to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy more snacks such as cookies and cakes to resell

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is married and blessed with one child who is in school. For the past four years, she has been running a beauty salon to bring up her family. She is also an employer. Winnie has employed two people to assist her in the business. Her potential customers are the local residents. She is requesting a loan of 23,995 Kenya shillings to buy hair braids and hair chemicals. In the next 5 years, she wants to own a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and hair chemicals for her salon.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia de treinta años de edad vive con su hija la cual todavía asiste a la escuela. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad arroz, frijoles, leche, pan entre otros, últimamente ha aumentado la demanda en su tienda ya que las personas siempre encuentran lo que necesitan a precios accesibles y con un servicio excelente; Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora se levanta desde muy tempano para aprovechar su venta y al final del día obtener provecho, piensa que crear un canal de oportunidades hace nuestro camino al éxito mucho más fácil es por eso que Ana quiere abrirse nuevas oportunidades y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, lácteos, embutidos, pan etc. Ana Cecilia tiene confianza que de estar forma logrará llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Ana Cecilia is 30 years old and lives with her daughter who is still in school. Ana Cecilia has a store where she sells staples including rice, beans, milk, bread, and other items. Lately, the demand in her store has increased because people always find what they need at affordable prices and receive excellent service.  Ana is a very hardworking woman who wakes up very early to take advantage of sales. At the end of the day, this is a benefit to her. She believes that creating a channel of opportunities makes our road to success much easier. For this reason, Ana wants to open up new opportunities for herself and she requests a loan from INTEGRAL which permits her to purchase basic grains, instant products, sweets, drinks, dairy products, sausages, bread, etc. Ana Cecilia is confident that she will thus be able to secure economic stability for her household.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, instant products, sweets, drinks, dairy products, sausages, bread, etc.

loans.name: Lukose Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lukose Group in Western Kenya! Consolata is the facilitator of the Lukose group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Consolata takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Consolata had a good maize yield, harvesting 17 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Consolata was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Consolata  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Consolata will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Lukose group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 20 años de edad, convive con Richard de 27 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Gladys es una mujer dedicada a la venta de verduras hace ya más de un año. Éste negocio lo realiza en el centro poblado de puerto cocos y canayre solo los días domingo, lunes y martes, mientras que los jueves y viernes esta de viaje a la ciudad de huamanga con la finalidad de realizar sus compras para luego expenderlos en las ferias de dichas comunidades. Gladys se inicio en este negocio gracias a la invitación de unas amigas que ya venían realizando esta actividad. Ella esta contenta con esta actividad que realiza, por que asi obtiene mejores ganancias. Generalmente trabaja sola pero en ocasiones  recibe el apoyo de su esposo. El único inconveniente que tiene es el riesgo que corre su vida ya que las vías que transita son muy accidentadas. En un futuro desea contar con un terreno propio donde pueda construir su vivienda. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles incrementará el volumen de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Gladys is 20 years old and lives with Richard, who is 27 years old; fruit of this relationship they have two children. Together, they live in a rented house located in the district of Pichari. Gladys has been selling vegetables for a living for more than a year, which she does in the towns of Puerto Cocos and Canayre on Sundays, Mondays and Tuesdays, while on Thursdays and Fridays she travels to the city of Huamanga to make her purchases, so that she can then resell those goods in local markets. 

Gladys started her business thanks to the invitation of some of her friends, who were already in that line of work. She is happy with her work, because it allows her to earn more profit.  Generally she works alone, though sometimes her husband helps her. The only obstacle she faces is that she has to risk her life, because the roads she travels on have many accidents. In the future, she hopes to own her own plot of land so that she can build a home there. This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her loan payments on time. With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles, she will buy a larger volume of vegetables.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es: La señora CORNELIA, la socia continua con su negocio de preparación de pollipapas (comida peruana que consta de papas y un trozo de pollo); la socia compra papas y pollos al por mayor y los prepara en la mañana, ella condimenta los pollos y pela las papas y prepara todo lo referente para la praparación de la venta de pollipapas. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de pollo y papas.
texts.en: Cornelia continues with her business making “Pollipapas” (Peruvian dish consisting of potatoes with a piece of chicken).  She buys potatoes and chickens at wholesale and prepares the dish in the morning.  She spices the chicken and peels the potatoes and prepares everything needed for the preparation and sale of pollipapas.  She wants to use the loan to buy chicken and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy chicken and potatoes.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. Ofelia is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Ofelia has been in this business for 13 years now.

Ofelia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Las Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Amelia, tiene 3 hijos  es conviviente  y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desde hace 1 año, Amelia  es tesorera del grupo “Las Esmeraldas”, grupo conformado por 11 socios que se dedicana diversas actividades de comercio. Amelia  trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza  desde hace 10 años y a su vez también vende gaseosa, cerveza y los domingos comida, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a  logrado mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, brindándoles educación  y con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería y así poder emempezar a vender ropa. Sabemos que, Amelia  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Amelia has three children, and she is in a common-law marriage.  She has been working with Edaprospo for one year.  Amelia is the treasurer of the “Las Esmeraldas” communal bank.  The group is comprised of 11 members who devote themselves to different business activities. 

Amelia has worked selling beauty products for one year.  She also sells soft drinks, beer, and on Sundays she sells food.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she has managed to improve the quality of life for her children by giving them an education.

In order to continue growing she has requested a new loan to buy merchandise so that she can start selling clothes.  We know that Amelia will accomplish her goals with a lot of work and effort.  We also know the loans from Edaprospro will help her.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 40 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, sugar, personal care products and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rachel Koimeyian

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Naretoi Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Rachel is married with 4 dependants. She did not have formal education but she was able to educate her children by keeping steers. She is a devoted Christian and a member of Anglican Church of Kenya (ACK) and a Mothers Union member. She is a chairlady of several merry go rounds in Olturoto.

She was given a loan of USD 300 by WEEC in 2001and bought two steers. She later bought She paid very well and qualified for another loan. She sold them and made a profit of USD.200.Her 2nd loan of USD.450 was used for the same business. Right now, she has 10 steers which are about to be for sale.

loans.use: She is planning to add more three steers such that she maintains a steady supply to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: START DAIRY FARMING

loans.name: Mamle

texts.en: Mamle has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has taken several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She makes beads for the local and foreign markets. She is seeking a loan of US$900.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zulfi

texts.en:
Zulfi has been engaged in the trade of childrens' clothes for over 4 years. She is married and has two daughters. She started her business 6 years ago, from the trading of leather goods in the open-air market in Khujand. The conditions of her business place were not good. Often her goods were dirty from the rain and snow, and it was very cold in winter which was not good for her health.

In 2003 she decided to change her business, so she started trading childrens' clothes. Today she is renting a place in the central shop at the Panjshanbe market. The diversity of her goods attracts more and more clients, who are left satisfied with the beautiful babies' dresses they bought from her. Zulfi’s business is successful now and that’s why she would like to rent one more place, where her daughter will be partly responsible for the business.

loans.use: Zulfi would like to increase her goods for her children's clothing store.

loans.name: Elisabet

texts.en:
Elisabet Jerez Chamale is a single mother, just 26 years old with two children, aged 2 and 7. She’s struggling to make ends meet and keep the older one in school. With her first Friendship Bridge loan she was able to start her business weaving huipiles, the traditional Mayan women’s blouse, because she could finally purchase some yarn. Now she’s ready for her second loan, which she’ll use for the same purpose.

Elisabet rents her small one-room shack in the back of a parking lot for about US$20/month, plus $5/month for electricity. She’s put cardboard all around the inside walls to keep the wind out. Although yarn is fairly expensive, at about $7/pound, she is making huipiles that sell for up to $10, so is finally making a little bit of economic progress. Elisabet is also buying and reselling huipiles woven by other women. She dreams of someday having her own store, maybe a big store with woven goods.

Here is a video of the paperwork meeting that Elisabet attended to apply for this loan.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.en:
Maria Antonia A. L. has been selling cosmetics for 6 years. During the day, she sells creams, shampoo, and lotions in the streets in San Lorenzo, where she lives. In the evening, she sells the cosmetics in the business market opposite her house.

She is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase more cosmetics to sell during the Christmas season. She uses the profit form her sales to purchase her medicine.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Alberto José

texts.pt:
Alberto José C., age 33, lives with his partner and 5 children in the neighborhood of Laulane, Mozambique. He sells leather goods (shoes, belts, brief cases, etc) in the Magoanine's central market. Since he joined the program, in January of this year, his business has grown from a small stand to a much bigger one, where he now sells clothing in addition to leather goods.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Alberto José C. tem 33 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 5 filhos. Vive no bairro Laulane e tem o seu negócio no mercado de Magoanine.Vende diverso calçado, cintos, capulanas,pastas, etc. Entrou para o programa em Janeiro do presente ano com um empréstimo de 6.000MT. Está no terceiro ciclo e vai tomar 20.000MT para pagar em 6 meses. Teve um crescimento assinalável no negócio: quando entrou para o programa tinha apenas um pequena banca e agora tem uma barraca bem grande na qual vende diverso vestuário e calçado.

loans.use: stock increase

loans.name: Mila Esther

texts.es:
Mila is 26 years old. She studied only through primary school. She wasn't able to continue her studies because her parents had very little money and so she had to give the opportunity to learn to read and write to her younger sisters and brothers. She has 2 children; both remain dependent on her. She lives in the housing development Palermo in the district of Chao in the Virú province of the department (region) of La Libertad in Peru.

Mila decided to start her own business as a way of helping with the household expenses, since her husband does not have a full time job. She prepares and sells grilled chicken weekends in her house. She sells beer and soft drinks, as well. She does this work during the weekends because weekend days are the pay days of the workers in the local agribusinesses. She also works growing and selling ducks, pigs and sheep. With her earnings she is beginning to set up a small general store.

Mila is the President of the group Las Luchadores. With this group she received her first loan of 200 soles (Peruvian currency) with which she bought an oven to prepare the chicken; previously she had been renting her oven. With this new loan of 600 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, Mila will buy feed for the animals with plans to sell them duing the end-of-year holidays. Mila dreams of having her own house someday.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mila tiene 26 años de edad, estudió solo primaria, no pudo continuar sus estudios porque sus padres no tenían dinero y tuvo que dar oportunidad a que sus hermanos más pequeños por lo menos aprendan a leer y escribir. Tiene 2 hijos y ambos dependen de ella. Vive en el Poblado Menor Palermo del Distrito de Chao de la Provincia de Virú del Departamento de La Libertad.

Decide empezar su negocio para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar ya que su esposo no tiene un trabajo fijo. Se dedica a preparar y vender pollo a la brasa los fines de semana en su domicilio, ahí aprovecha también para vender cerveza y gaseosa. Esta actividad la realiza solo los fines de semana porque son los días de pago a los obreros de las empresas agroindustriales; también se dedica a la cría y venta de patos, pavos, cerdos y ovejas. Con las ganancias que tiene está empezando ha implementar un apequeña bodega. La señora Mila es Presidenta del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Luchadoras”, en este grupo obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.200.00 soles, con los cuales compró un horno para preparar el pollo a la brasa ya que antes tenía que alquilarlo. Con este préstamo de S/.600 soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará alimento para sus animales los que venderá en las fiestas de fin de año. La señora Mila sueña con tener su casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase of animal feed

loans.name: Maina

texts.en: Mrs. Maina T. lives with her husband and one son in a village called Sainbu-Bhaishapati in Nepal. Her son is eleven years old and is studying in primary school.  Mrs. Maina T. and her husband Mr. Dipak T. are both farmers and grow seasonal vegetables on their land. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the mornings and evenings and Mrs. T. is seeking a loan of Rs 10000 that will allow her to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Chidima

texts.en: Chidima O. is a 35 year old married woman with 3 children, who lives in Ajangbadi, Lagos, Nigeria. She has been in business since 1993. She now needs a loan in the amount of $700 to enable her to buy more medicine for sales. This loan will help her to serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more medicine

loans.name: Vilma Rosario

texts.es:
Vilma, 28, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She is a certified midwife. She has one son who lives with her. She earns a living making and selling vests, quilts, skirts, blouses, etc. and mending articles of clothing. She started with simple mending. Her neighbors then asked her to make articles of clothing for them but she was unable to do so because she didn't have a sewing machine. Her father surprised her with one, though, and she hasn't stopped working since. She was finally able to use the skills that she'd learned in school.

Vilma belons to the Luis Alberto S. community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. She used the loan to but materials, threads and buttons. With this loan of S/.300, to be repaid in four months, she will buy wholesale supplies of cloth from a market in Trujillo so that can fill an order for 60 vests for drivers of the area's moto-taxis. The work will take about two weeks. Her greatest wish for the future is to have a tailoring shop and her immediate wish is to have an embroidering machine.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Vilma Rosario T. Sánchez tiene 28 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche en la provincia de Trujillo departamento La Libertad. Tiene grado de instrucción superior técnica se especializo en la carrera obstetriz. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Su negocio es la confección de chalecos, edredones, faldas, blusas, shorts y reparaciones de prendas. Su negocio se inicia haciendo algunos arreglos a mano, algunos vecinos de la zona le solicitaban algunas prendas que no podía realizarlas porque era necesario una maquina de cocer, su padre le dio la sorpresa y le regalo una, desde entonces no ha dejado de trabajar en ella. Este oficio lo aprendió en el C.E.O. de su colegio por cinco años y siempre que tuvo la oportunidad lo ha puesto en practica.

Ella pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Luis Alberto Sánchez” lugar donde recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro telas, hilos y cierres. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 que cancelará en cuatro meses comprará tela dril al por mayor en el mercado mayorista en la ciudad de Trujillo, para la elaboración de un pedido de 60 chalecos para los moto taxistas de la zona. Este trabajo lo realiza en un promedio de dos semanas. Su mayor sueño a futuro es tener un taller de costura y su sueño mas próximo es tener una maquina bordadora.

loans.use: Buy supplies for tailoring business.

loans.name: Thị Huong

texts.vi:
Mrs C. Thị Hương is 31 years old. She has had a loan with SEDA before and she has already paid back. She gives support and counsels other women in her G.. She is requesting a loan of 2.714.000 VND to buy flowers. She makes about 150.000 VND a day. Her husband is a cadre and they have 2 school age children.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Minh is 35 years old. She's requesting a loan of 2.714.000 VND to buy telephones, she has a phone repair shop.
- Mrs Lê Thị Hà is 33 years old. She also has a phone repair shop. She needs 2.714.000 VND
- Mrs Đặng Thị Hoa is 32 years old. She needs 2.714.000 VND for her phone repair shop.
- Mrs Tống Hồng Xuyên is 30 years old. She needs 2.714.000 VND for her photography studio for bridals

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị C. Thị Hương (MS: 030017), năm nay 31 tuổi. Chị đã vay được một C. kỳ 6 tháng và hoàn trả rất tốt , chị cũng giúp đỡ các chị em trong nhóm rất nhiều. Chị vay 2.714.000 VND mua hoa và mua kính thời trang để bán, chị bán hàng rất chạy và có thu nhập 150.000 VND/ngày. Chồng chị làm công an xã và chị có hai con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Chị Nguyễn Thị Minh (MS: 030018), năm nay 35 tuổi, vay 2.714.000 VND để buôn bán và sữa chữa điện thoại. Chị Lê Thị Hà (MS: 030019), năm nay 33 tuổi, vay 2.714.000 VND để buôn bán và sửa chữa điện thoại và kính thời trang. Chị Đặng Thị Hoa (MS: 030020), năm nay 32 tuổi, vay 2.714.000 VND để buôn bán và sửa chữa điên thoại. Chị Tống Hồng Xuyên (MS: 030021), năm nay 30 tuổi, vay 2.714.000 VND để kinh doanh chụp ảnh, áo cưới.

loans.use: Buôn bán và sửa chữa

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia comes from a humble family. Her economic independence when she was young made her into a self-assured woman ready to achieve what she sets out to do out of love for her five small children. She works buying and selling bread and candles and above all recycling cardboard, which she then sells to a plant that makes liquor and crackers. Herminia wants a loan so that she can increase her revenue. She feels that this investment will improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Herminia, proviene de una familia muy humilde, su independencia económica desde niña la convirtió en una mujer segura de sí mismo dispuesta a alcanzar lo que se propone por amor a sus 5 menores hijos.Está dedicada a la compra y venta de pan, velas y sobre todo a reciclar cartones, mercadería que luego de reunir una buena cantidad los ofrece a una fábrica de licores y galletas.El deseo de Herminia es obtener un préstamo para aumentar el monto de su capital, considera que haciendo esta inversión mejorará sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: An injection of funds to increase stock.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi A., 41, is married and the father of four children, all of whom are enrolled in school. He does fish-farming in Adéta, a village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this first loan through FECECAV, he hopes to have a dam built so that he can raise fish, since importation does not cover the needs of the population. Kossi will make a profit on this business and will be able to support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Kossi A. est âgé de 41 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants tous à l’école. Il pratique la pisciculture à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il espère avec ce premier crédit à FECECAV se faire construire un barrage pour pratiquer l’élevage des poissons étant donné que les importations ne couvrent pas les demandes de la population. Monsieur Kossi tirera profit de cette activité et arrivera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
To have a dam built for fish-farming

Se faire construire un barrage pour pratiquer l’élevage des poissons

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Zainabu R., who is married and has two children aged four and nine. She has two other dependents who live with her because they are attending school in the area.. In 2008, Zainabu established her charcoal business. Working six days a week, and 11 hours a day, she earns about $230 every month. She now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of charcoal. In the future, Zainabu plans to to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

These small, black, and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Itzel

texts.es:
Itzel started the business in order to make money to help her husband with the expenses of their household, supporting him mainly because their son was born recently and she wanted to give him the best and support him so that he can study at the university and have better opportunities. She started in 2005 and first helped her mother with her business selling books either as a cashier or delivering orders. Her mother was her example because, in spite of the fact that she was single without the support of a husband, she helped her children get ahead. Because of her advice, Itzel became motivated to have her own business and she joined a friend who works selling jewelry. May 10th, Mother’s Day, was approaching and it was in her best interest to make an investment in jewelry because during that time, people buy a lot to give to their mothers. Since then she has done well in this business.

Itzel needs a loan for US$400, which she plans to repay in four months, to buy more silver jewelry and have a better selection for her clients who buy more all the time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Itzel inició el negocio para poder ganar dinero para ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar apoyando a su esposo sobre todo porque acaba de nacer su hijo y queria darle lo mejor y apoyarlo para que estudie una carrera universitaria y tenga mejores oportunidades. Comenzó en el 2005, primero le ayudaba a su mamá en su negocio de ventas de libros, ya sea cobrando o entregando pedidos, y ella fue su ejemplo pues a pesar que se quedó sola sin el apoyo de un esposo ella sacó adelante a su hijos. Fue por consejo de ella que se animó a tener su propio negocio y se presentó con una amiga que también se dedica a la venta de joyería ya que se acercaba el 10 de Mayo, día de las madres, y le convenía hacer una inversión en joyería ya que en esa época la gente compra mucho para regalar a sus mamás, desde entonces me ha ido muy bien en esta actividad.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para poder comprar más joyería de plata y tener un mejor surtido para mis clientes que cada vez se incrementan más.

loans.use: Purchase jewelry to sell

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mr. Sek P., 51, lives in Russei Chuor Village in the Kampong Cham Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Uk Tep, grow potatoes in a field located next to their house. The couple have three children who all help their parents in  the field. Since this business is going well, he has decided to ask for a loan to buy more potato seeds to cultivate a larger crop.

loans.use: To buy more potato seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Livia

texts.es: Livia tiene 47 años, vive con su hijo Rafael de 15 años, es divorciada.  Se dedica a la venta de anticuchos (brochetas de corazón de res) de forma ambulatoria por alrededores del estadio de la ciudad de Juliaca, desde hace ya 20 años, trabajo al cual le  ha puesto mucho empeño y dedicación para poder solventar los gastos de su hijo, el cual requiere mayores gastos por sus estudios.   Livia sale a trabajar desde las 5 de la tarde en la venta de anticuchos y se queda hasta acabar todo lo preparado, usualmente hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche, lo dificultoso de su trabajo es la inestabilidad de los precios para adquirir la carne ya que suben frecuentemente, haciendo que tenga que ofrecer sus anticuchos a mayor precio, pero a sabido lidiar con esos pequeños detalles y disfrutar de su trabajo, ya que hace nuevos amigos, que es lo que más le gusta.  Livia trabaja para sacar adelante a su hijo Rafael, quien esta estudiando en la secundaria.  Con el dinero que solicita podrá comprar una nueva parrilla para cocinar sus anticuchos y algunas bancas para atender mejor a su clientela.  Quiere  en el futuro, estabilizar su negocio vendiendo en un pequeño snack.
texts.en:
Livia is 47 years of age, lives with her 15 year-old son Rafael, and is divorced. For the last 20 years she has worked in the traveling sale of "anticuchos" (kebabs of beef-heart meat), she has put much effort and dedication into this work to be able to afford her son's expenses who has high expenses costs because of his studies. Livia leaves for work from 5 in the afternoon to sell the "anticuchos" and she stays until she has run out of all she has prepared, usually at about 9 or 10 at night. The difficulty with her work is the instability of beef prices which increase often, making her have to charge more for her "anticuchos." But she knows how to contend with these little details and to enjoy her work. She has made new friends which is something that she likes the most. Livia works to get her son Rafael ahead. He is in high school. With the money that she requests she will be able to purchase a new grill to cook her "anticuchos" and some benches to better serve her clientele. In the future she wants to stabilize her business, selling in a small snack bar.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new grill for the preparation of her "anticuchos" (a type of beef kebab)

loans.name: Maku

texts.en:
Maku T. is a 60-year-old married woman. She and her husband have six children, all of whom are married. With her business, Maku has been able to support her family from a financial standpoint. Specifically, she is a food vendor, and she sells kenkey and maize. (Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains: it is cooked and then eaten with hot pepper and fried fish.)

She proudly states that she has many loyal customers because many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and/or supper. Nevertheless, she is seeking a loan in order to buy more raw materials for her operation, including bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Accordingly, she hopes to increase her savings to enable her husband to embark on their building project.

Maku is a member of the community group known as the Favour Trust Group. In this group, members not only support one another as they try to repay their loans, but they also guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken when she at one of her group's meetings.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional raw materials (e.g., maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood).

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married and has one daughter. They have a family business selling shoes at the market. He started this business 5 years ago with a small amount of inventory and just one location. The business turned out to be successful. Later he opened a second location, and then a third one. Today, his gross monthly income is about 10,000 UAH.

This time, Sergei would like to get a seasonal loan of 2,000 UAH with the purpose of purchasing more inventory. Sergei has a goal in his business - to open his own small store and work there together with his wife and daughter.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
These three group members live in Battambang Province and are requesting this small loan.  Group leader, Mrs. Ly S. is 40 years old and a widow. She makes a living traveling from village to village selling soft drinks. She sells to her  neighbors, students, and passer-bys. Ly earns about $3 a day and has been in this business since 2005. She is a generous women that is responsible of five children who are single and attend school. One of her younger brothers lives with her and is employed as a fisherman. This helps with meeting the family's expenses. Ly needs to expand her business and is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of soft drinks to sell.

Res M. is 45 years old. She sells fish in the local market. Res requests a loan to buy more supplies of fish to sell for a profit.

Sman S. is 55 years old and a widow. She is a grocery seller who is applying for a loan to begin a new business, growing corn.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of soft drink for sale

loans.name: Ladi

texts.en: Ladi J. is 39 years old and married with 5 children. She sells smoked fish. With her previous Kiva loan, she was able to increase her sales and make more profit. She is requesting the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more fish for sale. She says thanks to all who lend to her and to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale

loans.name: Tuyet Thi's Group

texts.vi:
Đinh Thị Tuyết sinh năm 1962.( Mã số: 010105030036  )  Gia đình chị có cửa hàng giải khát( bán bia, nước mía,…) và có nghề phụ: làm chổi. Vợ chồng chị có ba người con đã lớn phần nào phụ giúp công việc gia đình cho bố mẹ. Thu nhập theo ngày từ bán hàng và tiền công làm thuê đem lại khoảng 4.000.000 vn đ/ tháng cho gia đình chị. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 2.436.000 vn đ để đầu tư vào cửa hàng. Chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Chu Thị Bích sinh năm 1974 .( Mã số: 010105030039 ) Chồng chị làm thợ xây, gia đình chủ yếu vẫn làm nông nghiệp. thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng:2.500.000 vnd /tháng. Chị vay vốn mức vay: 2.436.000 vnd để đi chợ.
 Nguyễn Thị Khánh Hồng sinh năm 1952, ( Mã số: 010105030040 ) hàng ngày chị đi chợ bán hàng khô, có thu nhập theo ngày khoảng 100.000 vnd/ngày. Chị vay mức vốn: 2.436.000 vnd để mua hàng hóa về bán.
 Chử Thị Vân sinh năm 1966, ( Mã số: 010105030038 ) chị có nghề làm chổi có thu nhập. chị vay mức vốn: 2.436.000 vn đ để mua nguyên vật lieuj về làm chổi.
 Nguyễn Thị L. sinh năm 1957, ( Mã số: 010105030037 ) chị là giáo viên mầm non, có thu nhập ổn định. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 3.000.000 vn đ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức ; 2.900.000 vn đ để chăn nuôi lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyet T. D., 47 years old, SEDA ID# 010105030036. Her family owns a beverage store and make and sell brooms for extra money. The couple has three children, who are able to help with housework. The family’s income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. She wants to borrow 2,436,000 VND to invest in the store. She is the leader of the group of following persons: Mrs. B. T. Chu, 35 years old, SEDA ID# 010105030039. Her husband is a construction worker, when she works on her family’s field. The family’s income is about 2,500,000 VND per month. She borrows 2,436,000 VND for personal use. Mrs. H. T. K. Nguyen, 57 years old, SEDA ID#010105030040. She sells dried food in the local market, earning about 100,000 VND per day. She borrows 2,436,000 VND to buy more inventory. Mrs. V. T. Chu, 43 years old, SEDA ID# 010105030038. She makes and sells brooms. She borrows 2,436,000 VND to buy raw material. Mrs. L. T. Nguyen, 52 years old, SEDA ID#010105030037. She is a teacher in the local kindergarten and has stable income. Her family’s income is about 3,000,000 VND per moth. She borrows 2,900,000 VND to raise pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy inventory, raw material, and some personal use

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hà năm nay 29 tuổi,  là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 2008. Hiện tại chị đang buôn bán chiếu tại Hà Nội. Anh Hà chồng chị năm nay  28  tuổi cũng đang tham gia hỗ trợ vợ trong công việc buôn bán. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng . Với mức vốn 9.000.000đ dự định xin vay trong vòng vốn tới chị sẽ sử dụng để đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán chiếu của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. H. is 29 years old. She is a member of TYM Fund since 2008. Currently, she buys and sells sleeping mats in Hanoi. Mr. H., her husband, is 28 years old and helps her with the business. This business brings the major source of income for her family with a monthly income of VND4,000,000.

With a requested loan of VND9,000,000 in this loan cycle, she will invest more in the family's sleeping mats business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for selling sleeping mats

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline sells provisions and drinks. She started this business in 2005. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She is 48 years old and married with 7 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Olympia

texts.en: Mrs. Olympia R. is 54 years old and lives in Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married to a businessman and they both operate their business. They have no children, but busy themselves with their business. They engage in copra-buying and hog-raising through their own small capital, and their customers are from neighboring Barangays. She is now seeking a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 for capital as a copra buyer and to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Her business is still stable and operating at this time. They are hoping that they can buy their own cargo truck for easy transport of copra.

loans.use: Additional capital for copra buying and to purchase feed for pigs

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Además trabaja como transportista de ganado porcino desde su comunidad a la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Kallutaca  Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa quien le colabora en los quehaceres del ganado y su hogar que consta de 1 hijos. 
 
El crédito lo destinará a  la compra de una vaca lechera  de raza mejorada y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Juan works raising cattle, whose milk he sells to PIL Andina (Industrialized Milk Plant). He also works transporting pigs from his community to the city of El Alto. He lives in the Kallutaca community, in the Los Andes province, department of La Paz, located two hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife, with whom he has one child, and together they collaborate in the necessary duties for the cattle. This loan will be used to buy a milk cow of a better breed so he can increase milk production and increase his income. This is his first loan with Kiva partner Impro, and his credit evaluation has qualified him to take out this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a milk cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Aurora E. le está haciendo falta los acabados del interior de un cuarto que es el de su hija que vive con ella.
Doña Aurora E. trabaja en limpieza en casa particular y su hija María De Los Ángeles Cura se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en el mismo domicilio, estos son los ingresos de la familia. 
Están solicitando el préstamo para poder realizar la mejora ya que en esté momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario y reparar la recamara.
texts.en:
At Mrs. Aurora E.'s house they are missing the interior finishings on her daughters room who lives with her. Mrs. Aurora E. works cleaning homes and her daughter María De Los Ángeles Cura sells used clothing at the same address, these make up the family income. They are requesting a loan to make improvements, as they currently do not have the necessary funds to repair the bedroom.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior finishings in the bedroom.

loans.name: Mrs. Ny Khen Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank, which consists of twenty-three members, is located in Chrouy Ampil village in Kandal province and they plan to use the loan, which they obtained, for different purposes. Mrs. Ny K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fruit middle woman in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fruit to resell to earn more income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Un Sophorn, is a construction worker. Mrs. Ny K., 40 years old, is the mother of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchasing more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Tinei

texts.en:
Tinei F., 32, is married with six children. She has one year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and village people four days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala.

Tinei has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack sprayer, chemicals, knives, a spade and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
A. Akram is 36 years old, and is married with two children. Akram sells sweets such as candies, cookies, pastries and fruit jellies. He has been in this business for about 18 years. The income he generates allows him to support his family, for whom he is the sole breadwinner. Now, Akram is requesting 8000 TJS to purchase sweets to enlarge the range of goods he offers. Akram thanks you for all your support and promises to repay the loan in time.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase confectionery to enlarge his range of goods

loans.name: Srea

texts.en: Srea S., 29, is married and lives in the Batambong province with her one child. Daily, she is busy with her work raising pigs, making around US $2, while her husband, a construction foreman commuting from place to place for his business, typically makes US $3 each day. S. has asked CREDIT for a loan of US $1000 to purchase pigs to raise. Raising pigs is a good way for her to generate some extra income for her family, and she will be able to raise her standard of living. It is a difficult time economically for most Cambodians because inflation has soared. However, S. sees these pigs as a good opportunity for her to help her family and to make it through these difficult times.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells provisions and drinks. She is 60 years old and married with 8 children. She has been in business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of N80000 to purchase more provisions and drinks. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Jose Amos

texts.pt:
Jose Amos D. nasceu na provincial de Tete, tem 44 anos de idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 04 e 17 anos, todos a estudarem com excepção dos dois menores de 6 anos. Estudou ate 4 classe tendo parado quando saiu o seu nome para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive em boane na casa própria com família constituída.

Foi assim que chegou a maputo na companhia de outros colegas em 1981. Após a passagem a disponibilidade, no ano dos acordos gerais da paz, da guerra dos 16 anos, no ano de 1992, fixou sua residência no distrito de boane. Sofreu acidente ainda na tropa tendo perdido seus membros superiores. É deficiente físico e visual e recebe pensão de invalidez permanente no valor de 7.800,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e, juntando com outros rendimentos provenientes de negócios, consegue poupar algum valor no banco.  
A esposa também dedica se a pratica de pequenos negócios (vende produtos de primeira necessidade).

Nunca tinha contraído empréstimo em outros bancos e com a Hluvuku-Adsema este é o seu quarto credito no valor de 25.000,00MT para compra de materiais de construção (cimento, pedra e barrotes) para edificar um estabelecimento comercial de pequena escala. Os outros empréstimos foram para compra de bens de consumo e habitação nos valores de 6.500,00MT; 15.000,00MT e 20.000,00MT, respectivamente.

Sonha ver terminado o seu estabelecimento comercial e aceder a mais empréstimos para compra de produtos para revender e para tal, espera pagar o credito sem problemas.
texts.en:
Jose Amos D. was born in Tete. He is 44, married and the father of six children between the ages 4 and 17. All of them students, except for the two little ones under 6. Jose finished 4th grade but had to drop school when he was drafted to the army. He lost his upper limbs while serving in the military, and he also has vision disabilities. He earns a monthly disability check of 7.800,00MT (about U$284) that he uses to support his family, and makes extra money working different businesses. His wife sells basic commodities to help with household expenses. Jose never applied for a loan from other banks and this is his 4th loan with Hluvuku-Adsema. He asks for $950 to buy construction supplies and build a small store. The other loans were to buy basic items and food and were in the amount of $235, $550 and $730. He dreams of seeing his store finished and be able to get more loans to get the merchandise he is going to be selling.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies (concrete, rock, sand)

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rosemarie lives peacefully outside the city, in the village of San Antonio San Agustin, Isabela. She is happily married to Edmar who manages their farm lot, which is their main source of income. On this lot, Rosemarie manages a hog raising business which, along with caring for her children, keeps her busy. Rosemarie is determined to improve their quality of life and therefore is seeking capital to expand her hog-raising venture.

As part of her plans, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from the KIVA lenders. Rosemarie believes that hardwork and preserverance will help one to achieve their life goals.

Rosemarie and Edmar are striving to achieve their business goals for their children's future. For now, their income allows them to send their children to school. Their children: Errol Jay - 18, Karen Joy - 15 and Kristen Joy - three, are their inspiration to continue to preservere and provide for them.

loans.use: To expand hog-raising business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson D. owns and manages a small rice field. His farm is what he hopes will provide his family with enough income to buy adequate food, clothes and other basic needs. He has six children and his eldest child is 27 years old now and is already working.

Most of the harvest is saved for the family's own consumption while the remainder is sold to their neighbors for additional income.

Nelson would like to grow his business more. He intends to fund his farm by buying farming necessities to improve his harvest. Receiving a loan is truly worthwhile since he doesn’t have ready cash to finance his business at present.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Sanyazbek

texts.en:
Sanyazbek H. operates a grocery in his town. He started in the grocery business in 1999, selling goods in partnership with his older brother. The two built a stable operation and made much progress with their business. However, in 2006, H. used his earnings to start his own grocery. With his past experience and knowledge of the trade, he was quickly able to establish a good position in the local business community. H. purchases and transports his products from both Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and China. He is always focused on the future and dreams of one day opening a grocery trading center. H. is requesting a 2,000,000 tugriks loan to import grocery products from China.

H. is 36 years old and lives with his parents, wife and two children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both his daughter and son, ages 14 and 9, attend a local secondary school.

loans.use: To import grocery products from China

loans.name: Akot

texts.en:
Akot L.  is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials. Akot is 40 years old and is married to a soldier. She has seven children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a big bar.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more brewing materials

loans.name: Chuch

texts.en:
Chuch I., 49, is married and lives wI. her husband in the Takeo province. She is a professional weaver who is able to make about $2 of profit every day, while her husband earns $3 a day as a moto-taxi driver. This couple has four children and all of them are employed as garment-factory workers. 

Chuch I. is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk so that she can weave more clothes to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase silk

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah Adhiambo Mauda is a 34-year-old single mother of one toddler: Isaack Baraka, 5 years old. Sarah resides in Kabarnet town, where she operates a business as a fish monger in the Kabarnet municipal market. Sarah started her business nine years ago. This is the third loan she is receiving from KADET.

Sarah plans to use the loan to purchase fish for Kshs 10,000 during the December festive season and use the rest of the money to buy a refrigerator for the storage of fresh fish. KADET Ltd is the only MFI that has financed Sarah’s business. Sarah was introduced to KADET by a business partner who was already a KADET client.

Sarah does her business in Kabarnet town; her clients are residents of Kabarnet town. If her business does well, Sarah plans to expand her business and build residential houses for renting.

Sarah hopes to one day buy a lorry which she will use to transport and distribute fish from Kisumu to Kabarnet and other towns, which will increase her turnover immensely. She also dreams of giving her son a better education than she had. She describes herself as hardworking and determined to achieve her desires and goals.

loans.use: To buy fish and a refrigerator for storing fresh fish

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia, 34, a married mother of four children who are all in school, lives with her family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Working hard to support her husband to provide for the family, Lydia buys cabbages from nearby farming communities and then sells them to retailers and other food vendors in her community. She also sells at the local market. Lydia has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cabbages

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia S. is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in Punta Cabahog Brgy Zone 1, Cadiz City Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari sari (general) store.

Letecia’s husband, Alfredo S., is a fisherman.  They have 3 children, 2 of whom are adults.  One child currently goes to school and helps his parents with the business as part of his daily chores.

Letecia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income with the profits from her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6000 from her business activities.

Letecia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 13000 was used to fund operations and buy inventory for her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now Letecia is borrowing her 15th loan, in the amount of Php 13000, which she intends to use to buy stock for her general store. Letecia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Turmunh

texts.en:
Turmunh is 27 years old and lives with his wife and infant daughter in Uvs province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". His daughter attends kindergarten and his wife help with the family business.

Turmunh operates a shoe making business in his town. He specializes in making a variety of traditional Mongolian shoes and boots such as the "Buriad" and "Mongol".  He makes shoes that can be used both cold and hot weather. He started his business in 2008. He has worked hard to grow his business over the last two years in his rented apartment. With his business profit he enabled himself to buy a ger for his family.

He is focused on improving his skills as a shoemaker and growing his business. The most important thing to him is being able to provide for his children's education. He says, "I would be happy to hear about nice feeling from my customers." He is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~420 USD) loan to purchase leather, glue, thread and other necessary material for his business.

loans.use: To purchase leather, glue, thread and other necessary materials for shoe and boot making.

loans.name: Youssou

texts.fr: Youssou D. est une homme de 37 ans, qui vie avec sa femme et deux petits enfants. Ils habitent a Ziguinchor, une ville dans le sud de Senegal, qui est connue pour son beau paysage. Youssou fabrique les sandales en cuir et vend au tourists dans la complex artiste à Ziguinchor. Il a commencé son apprentissage dans ce metier quand il était jeune car son pere etait dans la meme entreprise. Grace a son experience (plus que 20 ans!) le qualité de son travail est tres elevée. Avec le pret de Kiva Youssou va acheter plus de cuir pour fabriquer les sandales. Nous sommes au milieu de la saison touristique à Ziguinchor donc il veut etre preparé.
texts.en:
Youssou D. is 37 years old, and lives with his wife and two small children in Ziguinchor, a town in the southern part of Senegal, renowned for its pleasing vistas. Youssou makes leather sandals which he sells to tourists in the Arts and Crafts Center in Ziguinchor. He learned this trade when quite young, as his father was in the same business. Thanks to his experience (over 20 years) the quality of his work is very high. With the loan from Kiva, Youssou will buy more leather to make sandals. It is the middle of the tourist season in Ziguinchor, so he wants to be well prepared.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUy leather to make sandals

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso works hard to feed his family. He has three children whom he wants to be given proper education. His oldest child is only six years old but he wants to start saving for their future early.

Celso is a rice farmer and also raises pigs for a living. He is grateful that, after three years, his hog-raising business is starting to grow. Now he requests a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI which he will use to buy farm supplies and also piglets and feed for his pigs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies as well as piglets and feed for his pigs

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana Elizabeth P. de 39 años de edad, reside en Cojuteque, un bello pueblo el cual es muy famoso por sus embutidos, este lugar está ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a sus tres hijos de 16, 14 y 10 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ana posee una venta de mochilas, juguetes para niños y niñas, relojes, accesorios para el cabello, maquillaje y otros productos más. El negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal de Ilobasco, en donde cuenta con un lugar muy concurrido lo cual le trae grandes ventajas, ya que cuenta con una venta bastante estable. Es por esta razón que Ana solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de productos, sobre todo aquellos que gozan de mayor demanda por parte de sus clientes, algunos de estos son: los juguetes y los cosméticos. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora y esforzada, la cual se dedica por completo al bienestar de sus tres hijos, los cuales dependen por completo del trabajo de su madre. Es por esta razón que Ana desea poder seguir adelante y crecer en su negocio el cual le permita obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Elizabeth P. is 39 years old and lives in Cojuteque, a beautiful village which is very famous for its cured meats. The town is located in the Department of Cuscatlán. She lives with her three children, aged 16, 14 and 10, who are all in school. Ana has a business selling backpacks, boys' and girls' toys, watches, hair accessories, makeup and other products. The business is located in the municipal market of Ilobasco, where she has a stall in a high-traffic area. This brings her great advantages, and her sales are quite stable. For this reason, Ana is asking for a loan so that she can invest in her business by purchasing a larger quantity of products, above all those which are in greatest demand among her customers., such as toys and cosmetics. Ana is a very hard-working and energetic woman, and she is fully dedicated to the well-being of her three children, who are completely dependent on their mother's work. For this reason, Ana wants to be able to expand her business and make progress, allowing her to obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cosmetics, toys and backpacks

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Danelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Esta señora se llama Danelia del Socorro D. Varela, tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera, ella desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la venta de comida, estuvo un tiempo en el País de Costa Rica, actualmente tiene más ó menos un años de haber regresado, ella tiene siete hijos tres mujeres y cuatro varones, de los cuales dos viven en Costa Rica, los de más viven en nuestro país, ellos ya han formado sus familias.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de dos con el actual, e igual que este, el crédito anterior lo solicito para el negocio.
texts.en:
Danelia del Socorro D. V.is 60 years old and single. Since she was very young, she has worked selling food. She spent some time in the country of Costa Rica, and she returned a few years ago. She has seven children, three girls and four boys, of whom two live in Costa Rica, and the rest live in our country. They are already grown with their own families. This is her second loan with our institution, and just like the previous one, she is requesting this loan in order to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chickens and industrial kitchen equipment

loans.name: Allah Diwae's Group

texts.en:
Allah diwae is the wife of M. M. and they have lived for the last ten years in a two-room brick house in a city named Multan (famous for its shrines and sweetmeats) in Pakistan. 

She is 54 years old but she is still very active and operates her decorative embroidery business. Her family supports her in her business. They all prepare the embroidered dresses and complete the orders of the customers, which generates income. 

She became the breadwinner of her family after the death of her husband. She is a regular client of Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). She has repaid her two loans to Asasah and now has applied for the third time to purchase the supplies she needs (colored thread, beads and fabrics) to expand her decorative embroidery business.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery items for preparing embroidered dresses

loans.name: Florecitas De Villa Hermosa Group

texts.es:
”FLORECITAS D. VILLA HERMOSA” está conformada por 11 socios entusiastas y luchadores, quienes se dedican al comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. varios años.
Nelly se dedica al comercio ambulatorio ella venD. ropa para todas las edades, además venD. comidas rápida que le permiten mejorar sus ingresos ya que tiene 2 hijos a quienes mantener, Gracias a su trabajo pudo arreglar su casa, además D. pagar la educación D. sus hijos, ella agradece el préstamo.
Apolonia tiene una bodega en la cual trabaja más D. 10 años, su objetivo es aperturar otra bodega y mejorar su calidad D. vida. El préstamo otorgado a la socia lo invertirá en la compra D. abarrotes.
Con mucho esfuerzo Luis pudo comprar su mototaxi hace varios años estos ingresos le permiten ayudar a su familia el préstamo lo invertirá en arreglar algunos accesorios que le falta a su mototaxi.
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos respectivos
About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
"FLORECITAS OF VILLA HERMOSA" is a group of 11 members who are enthusiastic and fighters. They work in retail. They have worked with EDAPROSPO - prosperidad for various years. Nelly works as a street vendor. She sells clothes for all ages and also sells fast food, which enables her to improve her earnings, since she has two children to support. Thanks to her work she was able to repair her house and also pay for the education of her children. She is thankful for the loan. Apolonia has a store in which she has worked for more than 10 years. Her intent is to open another store and improve her quality of life. The loan given to this member will be invested in buying groceries. With much effort, Luis was able to buy his mototaxi and for several years these earnings let him help his family. The loan will be invested in fixing some buying that his mototaxi lacks. All of our members are grateful for the help given and promise to pay their loans. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Gerrit Larsen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and materiels

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene 42 años, tiene tres hijos y es natural de Ollantaytambo. Actualmente, Su actividad principal es vender pasamanería  en el mercado de Virgen Asunta de Ollantaytambo. Ya son tres a cuatro años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien.

Rosa es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario salir adelante, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa, materiales de plastiqueria e implementar su casa. El anhelo de la socia es tener una tienda propia.     

Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 5 ciclos de funcionamiento, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito y también se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42 years old, has 3 children, and is from Ollantaytambo. She sells braids and tassels (for drapes and upholstery) in the Virgen Asunta de Ollantaytambo market. Her business is 3 or 4 years old and is doing well. Rosa is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman that looks for opportunities to grow everyday. She needs a loan to buy clothing and plastic cutlery to set up her house. She hopes to have her own store one day. Rosa belongs to the community bank “La Unión de Ollantaytambo”, in the Arariwa Association. The bank has been in operation for 5 loan cycles. As a member, Rosa is happy and satisfied with the loan services. She is also grateful for the opportunity this provides her, and promises to repay her loan according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and plastic cutlery.

loans.name: Altanshagai

texts.en: Altanshagai D., age 31, lives with his parents together in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a ger. His father is a guard and his mother runs a small shop attached to their fence. Since Altanshagai started his business activity in 2008, his work has been very stable. After graduating from high school, he attended a mobile phone repair and service course in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Now he is studying in a language training center to learn Chinese in order to import cheaper mobile phone spare parts from China. Altanshagai is a hardworking, optimistic and aggressive person. He says, “I have never asked for money from my parents for my living. Also, I bought a small car and now I have a plan to expand my workplace. I am able to make money for my Chinese language training fees from my mobile repair business.” Altanshagai is requesting a 560,000 MNT loan to purchase mobile phone spare parts such as displays, chargers, key buttons and so on.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone spare parts

loans.name: Flora Mae

texts.en:
Flora Mae C. is from the village of Manolo Fortich Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Flora Mae is married and has one school-aged child. Flora Mae owns & operates a business in which she makes and sells specialty food products. Flora Mae has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Flora Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Flora Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es: Bacilio, de 51 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Bertha de 35 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Bacilio trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, junto a su esposa siembran semestralmente papa, maíz y alverja, los cuales venden en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas. Lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante espera mejorar la calidad de sus productos y así obtener mejores precios. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultor. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy participativo y solidario. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Bacilio is a very happy and hard working 51- year old family man. He lives in his own house with his 35- year old wife, Bertha, and their three dear children, to whom they want to offer a better life. By working arduously every day with his crops, Bacilio is trying to change the life he currently leads. Together with his wife, he plants potatoes, corn and peas every six months. They sell their crop at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where they get the best prices. What he likes most about his work is keeping his plants safe from pests. He has been farming for 40 years and considers transporting his produce to be the most difficult part of his work because the bags he has to carry are very heavy. In the future, he hopes to improve the quality of his produce and thereby get better prices. This is his sixth loan with MFP. He feels that this loan will greatly benefit him in his growth as a farmer. He is a very participatory and supportive member of his communal bank. With the two-thousand nine-hundred PEN he is requesting, he will purchase more fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase better fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Bakyara Tutungukye Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
K. Jesca is a married mother with 7 children and she also takes care of three dependents. She has a restaurant business in Rwomuhoro Trading Center where she is able to generate 150,000/- as monthly profits. She has had the restaurant for 15 years and her biggest challenge has been having few customers but because of her good customer relations, she has been able to win many over to her side amidst stiff competition. 

Jesca's dream is to have a better equipped restaurant and educate all her children. This loan is to help Jessica with paying rent as well as buying more hotel equipment.

loans.use: Paying rent and buying other hotel equipment like plates and forks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong P., 47 years old, is a humble villager living in the capital, Phnom Penh, in the middle of Cambodia. She was married but divorced her husband when her four kids (two sons and two daughters) were very young. All of her children are now teenagers who are no longer in school and work at different occupations.

To earn a living, Kong P. sells many kinds of vegetables, which she either buys in bulk from her supplier or grows them. She doesn’t have her own vehicle, so Kong P. always has to hire a taxi to transport vegetables from her farm supplier to the market. Kong P. is taking her first loan to buy a new motorcycle that she can use to pick up vegetables or to travel anywhere else without hiring taxis. Mrs. Kong P. was not available when the photo taken, so her son is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to pick up vegetables or to travel anywhere else.

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en:
Dorjsuren S. is 52 years old and a widow who lives with three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent owned by her daughter-in-law and surrounded by a fence. Her oldest son is in bad health and so stays at home. Her youngest son attends a university for defense force while her daughter has recently graduated from her university and is employed as a designer for a private company.

Dorjsuren operates a clothing business in a rented workplace next to a silk market where she makes a variety of clothing. She started her clothing business in 2007 and because the clothing has been so popular, she has been able to hire an assistant. Her business is in a popular spot that attracts many customers. She is a very responsible and hardworking person and says, " All I want is to help complete my son's education." Dorjsuren is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to enlarge her home's fence and to pay her son's tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Joseph  Mutuku

texts.en:
Joseph is married and is servicing a fourth loan from KADET LTD, and has no history with any other MFI. Joseph will use the loan to buy equipment for mining and also to buy another place for mining. He was introduced to KADET LTD by other existing clients, and his business is located near customers who build houses,who actually requires stones for construction.

With the extra profits, Joseph will grow his business and do furnishing on his home. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy mining equipment.

loans.name: Esmeraldas De San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Esmeraldas D. San Francisco el grupo eligió el nombre por ser un piedra muy bonita y es una manera D. motivación pues se consideran personas muy valiosas para cada una D. sus familias. 
Está ubicado en Atlacomulco, México, es una comunidad que se distingue por ser muy responsables y D. calidad moral, además es un grupo muy consciente D. los constantes cambios en la economía y siempre solicitan lo que pueden pagar. La Sra. Andrea E. es una integrante del grupo D. 41 años, es casada y tiene un hijo D. 10 años.
