Ella estudió hasta la primaria, comenta que desafortunadamente no pudo seguir estudiando por la responsabilidad que adquirió en su casa y con su familia, actualmente se dedica a la costura y a la venta D. plástico, realiza costuras D. muy buena calidad que es el producto que más resalta D. lo que venD., dado que muy pocas personas se dedican a realizar este tipo D. trabajos por el tiempo que lleva realizarlos, a pesar D. ello a la señora Andrea le gusta mucho su trabajo y considera que eso es el fundamento que le permite vender dia a dia y salir a adelante.
El fin que tiene la señora al solicitar el crédito es lograr poco a poco hacer crecer su negocio, y del ingreso que D. allí obtenga lograr que su hijo termine los estudios, puesto que ella no pudo estudiar por las carencias que vivió.
texts.en:
This group is named "Esmeraldas of San Francisco" (San Francisco Emeralds). The group chose the name since it's a very beautiful stone and it is motivating since they're considered valuable people for each of their families.

The group is located in Atlacomulco, Mexico. It is a community that is distinguished by being very responsible and of moral quality. Additionally, it is a  group that is very aware of the constant changing nature of the economy and they always request what they can repay. Andrea E. is one of the members of the group. She is 41 years old, is married and has a 10 year old son. She finished elementary school, but notes that, unfortunately, she couldn't continue her education because of the responsibility she acquired in her home and with her family. Currently, she is dedicated to sewing and selling plastic items. Her sewing is very good quality and is the product that stands out most from everything she sells due to the fact that few people are dedicated to this type of work because of the time required. Despite this, Andrea likes her work and considers it to be the foundation for her to sell day after day and get ahead.

Andrea's goal in requesting this loan is to gradually grow her business and, from the income she obtains, to help her son finish his education since she was never able to do so due to the shortcomings of her life.

loans.use: To grow their business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Helena Musyoka is 35 years-old and married with six children aged between five and 14 years-old.  They hope to give quality education to the university level to their children. Her business is located at the busy Mwingi market though she is served by the Thika branch office. Thika is the region in Kenya known for the production of pineapples. 

Helena sells rope to the local people and has been in this business for six years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is transport since she walks from one area to another to sell the ropes. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 15,000 to buy more rope to increase her business. She hopes to be selling ropes in bulk in future. She describes herself as aggressive, committed and innovative.

loans.use: To buy rope to sell.

loans.name: James Kibii

texts.en:
James Kibii K. is 42-years-old and married to Hellen Chebii, who sells second hand clothes. He is a businessman who operates a retail shop on a busy street of Kapsowar in Eldoret Town. He has been running this business for the past three years.

He learned about KADET from a friend who is already registered as a client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to increase his stock by buying six boxes of cooking oil, five bags of sugar, and any other stocks needed. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan he plans to rent a permanent shop. 

James believes he is hard working and he only needs the resources to attain his goals.  In the future, he hopes to grow his business and build a house and be running the shop on his own premises.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, and othe stocks for resale

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Bayasgalan M. is a 32-year-old and lives with her husband and three children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in her sister's yard, in one of the 'ger' districts on the outskirts of the city. Her older two children both attend a primary school and Bayasgalan operates a clothing-making business. 

She makes a variety of clothes and sells them in Narantuul, the largest and most important market in the city. She began her business in 2004 and has since gained significant experience. After several years of hard work and determination, her working capital now exceeds 1,500,000 MNT with cash balance of 450,000 MNT. Her hope is to keep growing her business so that she can afford to pay her children’s tuition fees. 

Bayasgalan is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase two new, more efficient sewing machines at 500,000 MNT and more clothing fabric at 800,000 MNT for her growing business.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines

loans.name: Tumurbaatar

texts.en:
Tumurbaatar L. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest child, a daughter, is a university student and his two younger children both attend a local secondary school. His wife works as a conductor of a mini-bus and Tumurbaatar operates a taxi service.

 He began his taxi business in 2004 and has gained a lot of experience since then. In addition, he worked as a driver of a mini-bus between 2008 and 2009 to supplement his earnings. After years of running this business, his earnings have enabled him to not only provide for his family but also pay his daughter's tuition fees. 

Tumurbaatar is a modest, open-minded and hard-working man and is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to improve his car that is used as a taxi.

loans.use: To improve his car

loans.name: Amor Y Esperanza 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Elene is the coordinator of her group Amor y Esperanza 1, 2 (love and hope). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She says that her dream is to have her own house. 

Elene is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for amost 14 years, starting to sell products before she moved to the Dominican Republic. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different products like clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. She will also use future profits to reinvest in her business.

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water — none of which is potable.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian forma parte del banco comunal “Los Principiantes” de la ciudad de Linares.  Ella se dedica a la artesanía en artículos de decoración, como pinturas en cuadros,  cajas de madera y cartón, restauración de antigüedades y muebles entre otras cosas, desde hace 20 años.  Tiene un taller para elaborar sus productos en el patio trasero de su casa. 
Lilian comenzó a trabajar independiente cuando aprendió a pintar sobre tela, en un curso gratuito. Con el tiempo fue investigando por su cuenta y aprendiendo otras técnicas para usar diversos materiales, perfeccionándose en su trabajo.
Actualmente, tiene varios clientes, quienes son trabajadores de empresas conocidas de su ciudad. 
Con este préstamo comprará materiales.
Su sueño es tener un vehículo más grande para transportar su mercadería y así poder venderla más fácilmente. 
Liliana es la única fuente laboral de su hogar. Tiene 5 hijos, pero vive solo con los 2 menores, de 17 y 20 años. 
A Lilian le han servido mucho los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha podido ir creciendo en su negocio al invertir en mas materiales. Además le ha sido muy grato compartir con sus compañeros de grupo y aprender sobre cómo administrar su negocio, durante las reuniones. 
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
Lilian is a member of the "Los Principiantes" (The Beginners) community bank in the city of Linares.  She has been in the handicrafts business for twenty years, making decorations such as paintings and boxes made from wood and cardboard.  She also restores antiques and furniture.

Lilian has a workshop in the area behind her home where she makes her products.  She started working independently when she learned to paint on fabric through a free course.  Over time, she did some research of her own and learned other techniques for using other materials, perfecting her work.  She currently has several customers who work for well-known businesses in her city.  

Lilian will use this loan to buy materials.  Her dream is to have a larger vehicle for transporting her merchandise so that she can sell her products more easily.  Lilian's is the only source of income for her household.  She has five children but now only lives with her two youngest who are 20 and 17.  Fondo Esperanza's loans have been very useful for Lilian since she has been able to grow her business, investing in more materials.  It has also been pleasant for her to share with her fellow group members and to learn how to run her business during the group meetings.

Linares is an important urban center in Maule region which is located in the country' central zone.  Farming and wine production are important activities in this area and a lot of the products are exported.  Some of the main crops grown here are cereals (rice, wheat, corn and oats), vegetables (beets, cabbate, lettuce, chard and other vegetables) and fruit.  Linares is the main rice-producing province in Chile.  In fact, 78% of the national production of this cereal is grown in this province, especially in the town of Parral.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
El señor Víctor F. M., trabaja como Conductor de Transporte Liviano en una Empresa Aguadora, desde hace 4 años.

Es casado, con 57 años de edad, tiene 3 personas a su cargo, de los cuales uno está en edad escolar. El vive en la ciudad de Managua, por la carretera a Masaya.

Este es su primer crédito en CEPRODEL, el cual piensa invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para la mejora de su casa. Y poder darle a su familia una mejor condición de vida, a través de una buena casa.
texts.en:
Sr. Victor F. M. has worked as a driver for the Aguadora transportation company for 4 years.  

Victor, 57, is married and responsible for 3 people in his care, one of whom is still in school.  He lives along the road to Masaya in the Nicaraguan capital, Managua.  

This is Victor's first CEPRODEL loan.  He will use it to buy construction materials so that he can improve his house and, in turn, give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: House construction and improvements

loans.name: C 2387 Jyambere Group

texts.en:
Fresixan is a hardworking 31-year-old man. He is married and has a two year-old child. He runs a well-organized small shop, which sells various products and employs seven people.  He got into this business because it is profitable in his region, and has been operating it successfully for four years.  His shop is open from 7am until 5pm every day. 

Fresixan is the leader of a group called "Jyambere" in the local language. The group includes five members (four men and one woman) and five businesses, including a spare parts business and a business selling cakes.  The group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more products for their shops so that they can provide better service to their customers. The loan will impact the group members by helping them to purchase larger quantities of stock, which will allow them to earn more profits. With the extra income they all earn, Fresixan and his group hope to save some money and to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more products for his shop

loans.name: Nerly

texts.es:
Nerly  G. tiene un negocio de variedades donde vende papelería, cosméticos  y accesorios femeninos.  Ella con un pequeño capital deicidio empezar a vender productos de belleza y le fue muy bien cuando comenzó a ganar clientes y  a reinvertir sus ganancias;  así fue que cuando   fue creciendo en mercado,  adicionó tres vitrinas para organizarlo mejor y  lograr una imagen empresarial apropiada.  Con su negocio   ha logrado responder a sus gastos personales y   a las necesidades de su hijo.  Su sueño y gran desafío es convertirlo   en un gran almacén para continuar aumentando sus utilidades y brindarle una educación que le asegure muchos éxitos profesionales  a su hijo. Aun que posee un capital de trabajo, muchas veces requiere de más dinero para responder a los clientes, pues aun no tiene todo lo que ellos piden y su meta es tener   un poco  de cada producto para que ellos encuentren   lo necesario y Nerly logre el posicionamiento de su negocio.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y también su primer  credikiva con el cual  comprará útiles escolares, interiores, accesorios de vestir y sandalias, aprovechando la temporada escolar, que es la que impera en este momento, en el que jóvenes y adultos ingresan a clases y sus productos rotan frecuentemente.
texts.en:
Nerly G. has her own business selling stationery supplies, cosmetics and ladies' accessories.  With a little bit of capital she began selling beauty products and was so successful once she established a customer base that she decided to reinvest her earnings.  She added three display cases to enhance her corporate image and began growing in the market.  Through her business she has been able to cover her personal expenses and meet her son's needs.  

Her dream and biggest challenge is to expand and have a shop one day so she can increase earning and give her son a good education so he can have a successful career.  Though she has her own working capital, many times she needs more money to meet customer demand.  Her goal is to be able to stock a little bit of everything so she can position her business well.

This is Nerly's first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She plans to use it to buy school material, clothing accessories and sandals for the school year which is about to begin.  Her products have a high rotation rate now that youths and adults are going back to school.

loans.use: To buy stationery supplies, school materials, ladies' accessories and school shoes

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 40 year old farmer. He has been engaged in dairy farming for over ten years. He also does poultry farming to earn extra income. Being a married man with three children in school, he works hard in his business to provide for his family.

David joined Faulu Kenya after he was introduced by his friend. Since then, he has been able to improve his business and his living standard. He has requested a loan of 70,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene 54 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba en la provincia de la Convención, Cusco, Perú. Aurelia es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene un hijo. Actualmente, Aurelia vive en la comunidad de Yanahuara a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ella nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en hacer fermentar el maíz comúnmente llamado en la región del Cusco Jora. La Jora es un producto que sirve para la preparación de la bebida tradicional de la región del Cusco que comúnmente le dicen Chicha de Jora. 

Aurelia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más maíz.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 54 years old and was born in the community of Quillabamba in the Convencion province of the department of Cusco.  Aurelia is married, and from this marriage she has a son. Now Aurelia lives in the community of Yanahuara, which is 10 minutes from the city of Urubamba.  She tells us that she has a small business making fermented maize that is known as  "Jora" in the Cusco region.  This Jora is a corn-based product that is used in the preparation of a traditional Peruvian beverage called "Chicha de Jora."  

On this occasion, Aurelia needs a loan to purchase more corn.

loans.use: to purchase more corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to build up his business and buy a big shop for his business.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta L. is from Mercy Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Loreta is single and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Loreta owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing & shoes from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Loreta has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Loreta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreta is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional T-shirts & blouses. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Loreta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional T-shirts & blouses.

loans.name: Esie

texts.en:
Esie is 46 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Esie has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from Ready-To-Wear clothing.

Esie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Aguilas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUILAS DEL SUR” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Justina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de muebles, ayudante de minibús, Tienda de barrio, costura de sombreros, venta de queso, venta de enaguas, macramé de mantas.

La señora Justina,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que ingreso la institución por invitación de su hermana. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace cinco años atrás, con ayuda de su esposo. El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra mercadería (para aumentar productos en su tienda) artículos que comprará de la Ceja (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos; pero no vive con su esposo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio

En la fotografía podemos observar que estan compartiendo un almuerzo comunitario, por esta razón la prima de doña Justina acompaña este grupo; pero no se encuentra Jorge, porque se le presento un examen.
texts.en:
The “AGUILAS DEL SUR” (Eagles of the South) communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members and is led by a governing board headed by Justina.  The members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them are: furniture sales, minibus helper, neighborhood store, hat making, cheese sales, skirt sales, macramé blanket weaving.

Justina states that this is the first cycle she’s worked with Pro Mujer; her sister invited her to join.  She currently has a neighborhood store that she’s run for the last five years with help from her husband.  The loan she will take out now is to buy merchandise to increase the stock in her store.  She will buy it in La Ceja (commercial part of the city of El Alto).  This way of work allows her to generate income to support her family because she’s married and has six children but does not live with her husband.

When she’s asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the health office.

In the photograph we can see that they are enjoying a community breakfast and because of this Justina’s cousin appears with her in the group but Jorge is not in the photo because he had to take an exam.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene  44 años de edad está casado y vive con su esposa y 5 hijos  en el caserío San Pedrillo en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.  Esta es una comunidad pequeña y rural que no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Sin embargo, esta lleno de gente pujante y trabajadora.

Luis se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, teniendo actualmente 38 de ellos. Cuenta con una experiencia de 9 años en el rubro. Además,  es agricultor y tiene terreno agrícola en el cual siembra limón y mango, ambos frutales en producción y bien conducidos. Complementariamente trabaja como peón agrícola en una quinta de 30 hectáreas  de mango que hay en el caserío. Luis tiene gran conocimiento sobre ambas actividades y es por eso que tiene clientela fija que prefiere sus servicios y productos.

Luis solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus 38 ovinos y para la fertilización de sus cultivos de mango y limón.

Luis es un cliente  conocido para Edpyme Alternativa. Siendo este su  segundo crédito, el primero lo canceló puntual y responsablemente.
texts.en:
Luis is 44 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 5 children in the village of San Pedrillo, located in the district of Tambogrande – Piura.  This is a small and rural community that does not have many basic services.  Despite this, it is full of people that thrive and work hard.

Luis dedicates himself to raising sheep, and currently has 38 of them.  He has 9 years of experience in this line of work.  In addition, he is a farmer and has land where he plants lemons and mangoes, both fruit trees in production and well managed.  He carries out complementary work as a laborer on a 30-hectare mango farm located in the village.  Luis knows a lot about both activities, which is why he has a steady customer base that prefers his services and products.

Luis requests a loan of 1500 new Peruvian soles through Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for his 38 sheep, and for fertilizer for his mango and lemon crops.

Luis is a customer known to Edpyme Alternativa, as this is his second loan.  He paid off the first loan punctually and responsibly.

loans.use: buy balanced feed for his sheep and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Maricel  Group

texts.en:
Maricel is married with one child. She is 27 years old and lives in Cogon, Ozamis City. Maricel sells a variety of products for her general store to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month she earns Php 3,500 for doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase more products such as shampoo, toothpaste, and soap for her general store business.

Maricel has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchased more products such as shampoo, toothpaste, and soap for  her general store business.

loans.name: Jinja Central B Group

texts.en:
36-year-old Florence has been in the shoe sales trade for 8 years running now, in the town of Jinja. The happily married mother of five says she began this business with capital from her first business, milk sales. It’s taken her eight years of nothing but unwavering diligence and determination to succeed. She says it was not a flying start at the threshold, but once she got her foot in the door, she has not looked back. 

Florence has been making gradual inroads and she is very upbeat about the future prospects of her enterprise. Weekly she says her sales revenue totals up to  shillings 200,000 Ugandan shillings. Florence is asking for this Kiva loan to expand her business. She says she is going to purchase more pairs of shoes and also pay for a market stall where she can sell her shoes.

loans.use: to purchase more pairs of shoes to resell and pay for a market stall.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres de nombre Virgen del Pilar, se conformó en el año 2009 con mucho esfuerzo y esmero. Actualmente están en el cuarto ciclo, cuenta con 12 miembros, donde todas trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Señora Digna, quien se dedica a la venta de chipa (comida típica paraguaya) sale todos los días a muy tempranas horas de la mañana a vender sus productos. Anteriormente solo vendía los sábados, pero ahora vende todos los días. Ella trabaja sacrificadamente para buscar mayores ingresos y de esa forma solventar los gastos que tiene en la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de las chipas, como ser harina de maíz, huevo, anís. Desde ya agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, ya que por medio del crédito podrá aumentar la cantidad de insumos que tiene y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 'Virgen del Pilar' women's committee was formed in 2009 with a lot of care and effort.  They are currently in their fourth loan cycle.  The group has 12 members who work jointly and in a supportive manner within the program.

Digna sells 'chipa' (typical Paraguayan food).  She used to only sell on Saturdays but now she sells every day of the week.  She works with a great deal of sacrifice, looking to make more income so that she can cover her household expenses.

Digna is requesting this loan to buy the ingredients she needs for making 'chipas' (cheese buns) such as cornmeal, eggs and aniseed.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving her as this loan will enable her to increase the quantity of supplies that she has available.

loans.use: compra de harina de maíz, huevos, anís y demás para elaboración de las chipas

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is married and has five children. She is 52 years old and lives in Dapitan City. 

Zenaida sells clothes to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase clothing to sell. 

Zenaida has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Virgielyn

texts.en:
Virgielyn, 23 years old, is married and has one infant daughter. At her young age, she is  working hard for the future of her family. Her husband is the one who manages their farm. While Virgielyn is busy for her business making charcoal to sell in the community.

Virgielyn is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy wood and fuel for doing her charcoal. She has been in this business for two years.

Virgielyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood and fuel for her charcoal business.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam’s group is comprised of five hard working women. Mariam is 21 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Mariam has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Mariam hopes to expand her business. Mariam is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony has practiced farming for the last three years.  He is 41 years old, married to Margaret, and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to start building rental houses on his other piece of land. Once complete, these houses will supplement his farming income and give him a steady source of income.

In future, he hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To start building rental houses on his other piece of land.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old and married. He lives with his wife, two children and one family member who works.

K. has owned a large electric generator since 2008, leasing electric lines for his area and its surroundings. He worked in this field for four years so he has good experience and a good reputation; he is well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to purchase a new large electric generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a new large electric generator.

loans.name: Rosa Micaela

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal San Vicente, vive por una comunidad que  pertenece a la parroquia de la Victoria del Portete, este lugar es de clima frió y propicio por sus pampas para la cría de ganado, su población se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes actividades,  mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 40 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos de 20, 18, 17, 15, 14 12, 5 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija es independiente, su segundo y cuarto hijo trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su tercera hija pasa en casa ayudando en lo quehaceres del hogar, su hija de 14 años  estudia en el colegio y sus hijos de 12 y 5 años estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de propiedad.

La Señora María como tiene hijos pequeños pasa en casa y se dedica a la cría cuyes, pollos y cerdos los que los vende cuando tiene  alguna necesidad económica. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y ganado para la cría.
 
Su meta es tener más animales para la cría.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "San Vicente" communal bank. She lives in a community that is part of the Victoria del Portete parish. This is a place with a cold climate, and because of its grasslands it is suitable for raising livestock. The people living there raise animals and farm. Many work in the city of Cuenca in various activities, and maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

María is 40, married, and has eight children; ages 20, 18, 17, 15, 14, 12, 5 and 3 years old. Her first daughter is living on her own. Her second and fourth son are working and help her financially. Her third daughter spends her time in the home, helping with the household chores.  Her 14 year-old daughter is in high school, and her sons, 12 and 5 go to a small village school.

Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. They own the house where they live. As María has small children, she stays home and raises guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs, which she sells when she has any financial need. She has been with the communal bank for two years, and she is going to use  her new loan to buy chickens and livestock to raise. Her goal is to have more animals to raise.

loans.use: To buy chickens and livestock.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Elvira has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy African clothing to resell

loans.name: Grace Wangui

texts.en:
Grace used her second loan to buy a bull and two sheep for farming purposes.  It's been profitable ever since, and she has been paying her loan back, and in good time.

This is her third loan.  She plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs and equipment as well as to hire manual labor workers at her farm.

In the future, Grace hopes expand her farm and gain more income so she can improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and equipments.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old, separated, and has nine children. She lives in the Philippines. Vilma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages, which she has had for five years. 

Vilma is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages. Vilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen tiene 42 años de edad y viven en Villa Guadalupe, un barrio que pertenece al municipio de Colinas. Se casó hace 15 años y su esposo Julian, es un despachador de materiales en una ferretería. Tienen 4 hijos de 11, 12, 15 y 17 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando. 

Doña Carmen se dedica a la costura. Especializa en la elaboración de cortinas, ropa de cama, y otras prendas de vestir. Empezó su negocio hace 15 años. Ella compraba tela en las maquilas para elaborar ropa para niños y luego empezó a elaborar cortinas. Sacó 6 créditos para surtir su negocio. Compró una maquina eléctrica para coser ya que tenía una de pedal. Los ingresos del negocio le han ayudado  educar a sus hijos y comprar algunos electrodomésticos para el hogar. Hoy en día, trabaja de las 9 de la mañana a las 4 de la tarde elaborando los pedidos. Cuando tiene pocos pedidos, ella solo trabaja por las tardes. 

Solicitó este crédito de L6,000 para la compra de tela para la elaboración de cortinas y calzonetas (pantalones cortos) para niños. Espera obtener mayores ventas y ganancias para ayudar a sus hijos titularse.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 42, lives in Villa Guadalupe, a neighborhood in the Colinas municipality.  She has been married to her husband, Julian, for 15 years.  He dispatches materials in a hardware store.  They have four children; age 11, 12, 15, and 17.  The children go to school.

Carmen is a seamstress.  She specializes in making curtains, bedding, and clothing.  She started her business 15 years ago.  She bought fabric at the factories in order to make children’s clothes.  Later, she started making curtains.

She took six loans to stock her business.  She bought an electric sewing machine because she already had a pedal sewing machine.  The income from her business has helped her educate her children and buy some domestic appliances for her household.  She now works from nine in the morning until four in the afternoon making items to fill her orders.  When she does not have many orders she only works in the afternoons.

She requested this loan for 6,000 lempiras to buy material to make curtains and children’s shorts.  She hopes to obtain greater sales and income to help her children graduate.

loans.use: to buy material.

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда женщина 47 лет, торгующая на рынке нижним женским бельём и женскими гамажами и колготками. У неё трое взрослых уже семейных детей, одна дочь и два сына. Мавчуда давно в разводе с мужем. Её старший сын работает в Р.Ф строителем и присылает маме каждый месяц деньги на семейные расходы. Мавчуда  сама смогла выдать дочь замуж с помощью сына, т.к её товарооборот не большой, а следовательно и прибыль тоже, и хватает лишь на ежедневные расходы домашнего обихода. Каждый свой кредит она использует на завоз товара, поэтому на следующий кредит она хочет привезти зимние гамажи и колготки для женщин. Она благодарна всем инвесторам и «Арванд» за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Mavchuda is a 47 year-old woman, who sells women's undergarments and women's leggings and stockings.  She has three adult children - one daughter and two sons, all of whom already have their own families.  Mavchuda has been divorced from her husband for a long time.  Her oldest son works in the Russian Federation as a construction worker and sends money to his mother every month to cover family expenses.  Mavchuda was able to marry off her daughter with the help of her son because her goods turnover is not high and neither is the profit, which is only enough to cover household expenses.  Mavchuda uses each one of her loans to bring in merchandise and wants to use this loan to bring in winter leggings and stockings for women.  She is grateful to all investors and "Arvand" for the support and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Sevelina

texts.en:
Sevelina is 55 years old and is married. She has two children, ages 15 and 19. She has been in the business of raising pigs for three years. 

Sevelina earns 2000 PHP per month raising pigs. Sevelina also runs a small sari-sari store where she sells items like canned goods, soap and shampoo. 

Sevelina plans to use her loan to buy pig feed, vitamins and more items to sell such as canned goods. She hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins and more items to sell such as canned goods.

loans.name: Sovkat

texts.en:
Sovkat is 51 years old and married with three children. She is a schoolteacher. Her monthly salary is 130 AZN, which is not enough to cover even the basic demands of her three children. To improve her situation, she started her primarily farming business seven years ago. Now this is the main source of income for her family.

Raising and selling fresh fruits and vegetables brings stable income and is in high demand among Azerbaijani people. Fresh vegetables are good for national dishes like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are favorites for punch. Sovkat usually sells her crops in the central bazaar and her profit per month is 250 AZN. 

Sovkat decided to expand her business. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. She will buy seeds and fertilizers to increase the number of crops and cover her customers' demands.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nidia Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Nidia tiene 40 años de edad, esta separa de su esposo y tiene un hijo.

A los 18 años de edad Nidia se caso, pero cuando tenia dos años de casada su esposo la abandono quedando sola con un niño, entonces ella pensó en que podía hacer para sobrevivir con su hijo, a los 20 años a Nidia se le ocurrió instalar una granja de pollos y gallinas con mucho esfuerzo lo logro, vio que le era muy rentable obtenía muy buenas ganancias y así fue que saco a su hijo adelante.

Cuando tenía 30 años de edad Nidia, tomo la decisión de casarse nuevamente, pero hace dos años se separo de su esposo, aunque no están divorciados. Desde hace dos años ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdas parideras, y este negocio le esta siendo rentable, con lo que esta ahorrando ella planea repellar su casa, ponerle ladrillo al piso, para convertirla en una vivienda digna para su hijo.

Para comprar los insumos de la semana para la crianza de sus cerdas, Nidia se traslada una vez a la semana a una ciudad  del oriente del país, para llegar ahí ella camina a pie durante treinta minutos, desde su casa hasta donde aborda el autobús que tarda una hora en ir y venir. Cuando llega al desvió Nidia paga una mototaxi para trasladar los insumos hasta su casa, ya que el autobús no la deja en su casa. Por falta de dinero ella no compra más insumos para no viajar tanto a la ciudad.

Nidia esta solicitando el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar dos cerdas engrilladas cada una cuesta $350, y el resto lo utilizara para comprar concentrado lechero para alimentarlas. Con esta compra ella espera obtener ganancias de sus crías y así reparara su casa para vivir en un lugar mas digno el resto de sus días, que es lo que siempre ha soñado y no lo ha podido realizar porque lo primero que pensaba era en brindarle la educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Nidia, 40, is separated from her husband and has a son.  Nidia got married at the age of 18 but when she’d been married for two years her husband left her alone with a child.  She had to think what she could do to survive with her son.  At the age of 20 it occurred to her to set up a chicken ranch and with much effort accomplished it.  She saw that it was very profitable and this is how she supported her son.

When she was 30, Nidia decided to remarry but two years ago separated from her husband although they aren’t divorced.  For the last two years she’s raised breeding sows and this business is profitable.  She plans to use what she’s saving up to plaster her house, install brick flooring and turn it into a proper home for her son.

To buy the weekly supplies she needs to raise her pigs, Nidia travels once a week to a city in the east of the country.  To get there she must first walk 30 minutes from her house to catch the bus which takes an hour to go each way.  When she arrives at the fork in the road, Nidia pays a mototaxi to transport her supplies to her house because the bus doesn’t bring her all the way home.  For lack of money she does not buy more supplies in order not to have to travel to the city so often.

Nidia is asking Fundación Campo fore this loan to buy two pregnant sows which cost $350 each and will use the rest to buy milk concentrate to feed them.  With this purchase she hopes to earn profits from the litters to repair her house and live in a more proper place for the rest of her life which is what she’s always dreamed about but has been unable to do so because the first thing she thought about was providing an education for her son.

loans.use: to buy two sows and feed for them.

loans.name: Baraa

texts.en:
Baraa, 25, is married from Ya’bod near Jenin. His wife is not working, she is a housewife. Baraa is a hardworking man who works daily to improve his living conditions, and prepare himself to his new baby born. Baraa owns a retail shop which is the only source to his family. He is thinking to increase his sales, he wants to add milk, candies, flour, sugar, drinks, sweets … etc. so, he has requested a loan of $2000 from Alibdaa.
Baraa goal is to open a large wholesale food distribution.

loans.use: to add milk, candies, flour, sugar, drinks, sweets … etc. so he can improve his standard of living.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is a farmer living in Getq village of Shirak region. Continuing his father's job, Samvel became a farmer. He currently keeps cattle and cultivates potato and wheat for sale. 
Samvel lives with his mother, father, brother and wife. The farming business is going well and Samvel is able to cover family's basic needs. HE asks this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation and also forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will be a big support for the farm to develop it and Samvel hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation and also forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Kilama

texts.en:
Kilama G. has been an active member of Life in Africa for the last six months. He works as a bracelet maker for the Invisible Children Bracelet Project.

He lives with his wife and children in the Acholi quarters. He has been there for five years ,and he came from Pader district he has six children. Before coming to LiA, he worked in the stone quarry with his wife and had a very difficult time supporting his family. His wife still works at the quarry while he works at liA. Together, their incomes now support the family and their lives have improved. However, housing is very poor in the Acholi quarter.

He has acquired a plot of land from the King of Buganda who has sympathy for the people of Acholi. On this land he plans to build a two room house for his family. For this he is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000/=. He will be able to repay this loan in 10 months, and he will be paying 94,000/= per month.

  • 3000 BRICKS @ 60----------180,000/
  • 2 TRIPS OF SAND @ 30000------60,000/
  • 12 BAGS OF CEMENT @ 18000------216,000/
  • TIMBER (4X2) 8 PIECES @3000------24,000/
  • (3x4) 5 '' @500--------25,000/
  • 14 IRON SHEETS @ 10,000 --------------140,000/
  • TRANSPORT----------------------------------33,000/
  • LABOUR------------------------------------------110,000/
  • NAILS 4 INCHES 3KGS @ 1,500/-------6,000/
  • NAILS 6 INCHES1KGS @ 2,000/------2,000/
  • ROOFING NAILS 2KGS @ 2,300/-----3,400/
TOTAL-------------------------------------------800,000/

Kilama will be paying 94,000/= per month in a period of ten months and he saves Ushs 101500/ on his account. He has dedicated 25% of the interest he will pay on this loan to supporting the new Life in Africa WE Center in Gulu.

loans.use: Purchase building materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. She settled with her children in Sumgait city. Zamina has been working as a stylist for the past 20 years. She is a widow with three children. She used to work at a beauty salon, but decided she wanted to start her own business. The room she now works in is clean and professional, though bare. 
Zamina needs a loan of $600 to buy equipment, instruments, additional tables as well as lighting for her salon.

loans.use: To buy equipment and instruments, additional tables and lighting for her salon

loans.name: Daniel Dede

texts.en: Daniel K. is a school drop-out and has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She makes beads for local and foreign markets. She is seeking a loan of US$900.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 52 years old. She is married and has 6 children, but she takes care of just one now. She is an artisan, making tablecloths and napkins which she later embroiders. She sells them to local shops and in the artisan's market in San Cristobal. She belongs to the group Rosas 2. She will use her loan to buy embroidery thread and materials to make more products and thereby increase her output.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA TIENE 52 AÑOS , CASADA TIENE 6 HIJOS PERO ACTUALMENTE SOLO UNO DE ELLOS ESTA BAJO SU CARGO , ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA , CONFECCIONANDO MANTELES , SERVILLETAS Y BORDANDO SUS PRODUCTOS , POSTERIORMENTE LOS VENDE A PERSONAS QUE TIENEN LOCALES ESTABLECIDOS EN EL MERCADO ARTESANAL DE SAN CRISTOBAL.. PERTENECE AL GRUPO ROSAS 2.SU PRESTAMO LO VA A INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAS HILOS PARA BORDAR Y GENEROS PARA CONFECCIONAR MAS PRENDAS Y ASI AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DE SUS TRABAJOS

loans.use: Craft sales

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Mr. Anthony Akhuemokhan sells ladies & gentlemens wears.  He has been a LAPO client for 7 years.  He is requesting for the above loan to buy more clothes & VCD’s to sell and rent.  He is 30 years old.

loans.use: To buy clothes, VCD’s to sell and rent

loans.name: Masina

texts.en: Masina K. is a 62-year-old married mother of 6 kids. Two of her children have moved overseas, but the rest are still in Samoa. Masina used to rely on regular remittances from her overseas children until she joined the program last year. Since then, she has started a taro plantation and started making her own money by selling taro at the market and to fellow villagers.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her taro plantation

loans.name: Mamurdjon

texts.en: M. Mamurdjon is father of three children. His wife is a housewife. He supports his family and additionally he helps his grandparents.He started his business in 1999 selling fabrics. Gradually, as he was able to expand it further, he concluded an agreement  with a workshop for sewing traditional clothing to sell at his stand. Currently his business is going well. He has shown himself to be a punctual client of Microinvest and now he is taking advantage of applying to the Kiva porgram with the purpose of receiving a loan to purchase warm traditional fabrics.

loans.use: Purchase of warm fabrics

loans.name: Sonia Isela

texts.es:
Sonia is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado" (Enterprising Women of the Market). She makes a living by selling breakfast. Her business is located in the central market of Huaraz in Ancash. With this loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 box of eggs, a box of coffee, tea, and mate (a South American tea). Sonia is 35-years-old, is married, and has 2 children, who are 5 and 3 years old. Her husband is a taxi driver, and both contribute to their family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado” de Huaraz, se dedica a la venta de desayunos. Su negocio está ubicado en el Mercado Central de Huaraz, del departamento de Ancash. Con este préstamo de 300.00 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, una caja de huevos, una caja de café, té y otros mates. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, de 5 y 3 años, su esposo es moto taxista (transportista), ambos contribuyen para los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago is 36 years old and his entire life he has been a hardworking man. He has opened his own tire service shop which is situated along a main highway in the city of Carapeguá, near the cutoff to the city of Alcahay. It is in a great location where there is always a lot of business.

Along with the success of his shop, another great experience in his life has been the recent adoption of his baby. He and his wife were not able to have children of their own. With the loan, Santiago will buy more inner tubes and tools for his tire shop.

loans.use: To buy tire tubes and tools.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith G. is 37 years old and runs a small butcher shop and convenience store with her husband. They have been running this convenience store for 10 years and it has successfully earned enough income for her small family of three.

Edith manages the stock in the convenience store and her husband runs the small butcher shop. Over the years they have built up a large number of customers and are in a great location. Edit is asking for a loan of $650, which she will use to invest in more merchandise for her convenience store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her convenience store like milk, rice, sugar, yerba, and pasta

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov L. and his wife have been married for twenty four years. They have four daughters, two of whom work in a garment factory. The other two are in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Pov has been a construction worker for twenty fours years. He does construction work in Phnom Penh, in nearby villages and sometimes in other provinces. His wife stays home and takes care of their children.

Mr. Pov is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1,000 to repair his house and buy one motorbike to use for work.

loans.use: To repair his house and buy one motorbike to use for his work

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35 -year-old Christina K.. She is single and has three children, ages 3, 9, and 13.

In 1996, Christina established her rice business. Christina requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk to resell

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
The business of selling candies has become the main source of income for the family of Filomena, who has been doing this for 9 years. Her kiosk is located at the Santa Catalina elementary school in Juliaca. In addition to this business, on the weekend she sells second-hand clothing. Thanks to these two businesses Filomena is managing to take care of the most urgent necessities in her household, but she is sure that by making some investments in her candy business she will increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de venta de golosinas se ha convertido en el ingreso económico más importante de la familia de doña Filomena, quien desde hace 9 años viene dedicándose a esta actividad, su puestito está ubicado en las instalaciones del centro educativo primario “Santa Catalina” de la ciudad de Juliaca; adicionalmente a este negocio los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, gracias a estas dos actividades doña Filomena está logrando cubrir las necesidades más urgentes de su hogar, pero está segura que haciendo algunas inversiones en su negocio de golosinas mejorarán sus ingresos.

loans.use: Increase in capital in order to offer a larger quantiy of candy

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 20 year-old Hadija H.. She is married and has no children. In 2006, Hadija established her café business. She opens her business six days a week, 5 to 8 hours a day. She is assisted by her mother, husband, and one employee.

Hadija requires a loan in order to purchase additional ingredients in bulk, to make rice, ugali, chapati, tea, and juice. In the future, Hadija plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk, such as rice, flour, sugar, fruits and vegetables, to make a range of dishes such as pilau, ugali, chapatis, tea and juice.

loans.name: Cancio

texts.es:
Mr. Cancio Y. works in public transportation with his motorcycle taxi. He has 2 school age children, who are his reason for getting ahead in life. He is a 39-year-old man who works arduously on a daily basis because he would like to be able to provide for his children’s college education. Cancio needs to repair his motorcycle taxi and purchase another one, which will allow him to obtain greater profits. Furthermore, he would like to hire a responsible driver, which means that he will be creating a job for someone else, much like the chance that he had once been given. He needs a loan in order to realize his dream.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Cancio se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros, es propietario de un motocarro, es padre de 2 hijos que aún estudian y son su razón de seguir adelante. Tiene 39 años, a diario trabaja arduamente porque es su deseo poder pagar la universidad de sus hijos. Cancio tiene la necesidad de reparar su motocarro y poder comprar otro, para así, obtener mayores ganancias, además de contratar a un chofer responsable, con lo que estaría brindando trabajo, como una vez se lo dieron a él. Para esto necesita de un préstamo para realizar su sueño.

loans.use: Repair motorcycle taxi and purchase a second one

loans.name: Ni Made Lina

texts.id:
Made Lina R. decided to farm pigs because she foresaw good prospects in the business. Her first loan from DINARI was used to grow her farm by purchasing a breeder pig and a slaughter pig. Her diligence resulted in good production from her farm. She earns $20 per month for each 6 months growing cycle. This earnings helped supplement her husband who works as a mechanic in a local garage. She is now applying for second loan that Made Lina plans to use to increase her pig farm population and buy more feeds. She hopes to earn more profit by farming more pigs. She hopes to be able to save more money for her little baby's education.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Tinggal di desa membuat Made Lina R. mengambil keputusan untuk beternak babi. Karena prospek yang dilihatnya sangat bagus untuk mengembangkan usaha babinya. Pinjaman pertama ke DINARI digunakannya sebagai modal usaha ternak babinya dengan dibelikan 1 induk babi serta 1 babi penggemukan. Dari ketekunannya memelihara babi itu Made mampu menghasilkan keuntungan sebesar Rp.200.000,- per bulan selama 6 bulan masa pemeliharaan. Hasil ini sangat membantu suaminya yang bekerja di bengkel untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Setelah permohonan untuk melanjutkan pinjaman periode kedua ke DINARI disetujui, Made Lina R akan memanfaatkannya untuk menambah populasi babinya serta sisanya akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi. Nantinya diharapkan akan menghasilkan hasil yang lebih bagus dari sebelumnya sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh lebih banyak dan bisa disisihkan untuk ditabung yang kelak akan digunakan untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya yang masih kecil.

loans.use: Purchase Pig Feeds

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Mrs. Yean M. was born in1969 and now lives in Kokir Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a widow with four children, one is a construction worker and two children are employed in a garment factory. The youngest one attends school.

Mrs. Yean M. is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables. She owns one hectare of land which she uses for rice and she owns three hectares of land which she uses for vegetables. The vegetable field is too large for her to cultivate potatoes by herself, thus she decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to work in the field. She hopes to improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in the vegetable field.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 33 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos.    Es una persona muy  trabajadora, por ello, hace más de 2 años, decide vender todo tipo de accesorios para damas; como aretes, pulseras, monederos, carteras y maletas de distintos precios, en un inicio, salía diariamente a recorrer las calles principales de la ciudad, pero en la actualidad, por su bebé, solo sale los fines de semana, este es un negocio rentable, además que la mercadería no es perecible como los alimentos y no necesita de preparación previa, ya que solo es comprar al por mayor su mercadería, por lo que Jessica está muy animada de seguir en este rubro, su mayor dificultad es cuando no consigue un lugar estable para poder vender, por la cual seguirá ahorrando para tener su propio espacio comercial.  Jessica realiza todos estos esfuerzos para ayudar en el sostén económico de su hogar, para que sus pequeños tengan un futuro estable.  Con el préstamo, viajará para adquirir más mercadería, que le permitirá tener mayores ganancias, su meta es ser una gran comerciante, hasta ser proveedora de accesorios para mujer.
texts.en:
Jessica is 33, she lives with husband and two children. She is a very hardworking person, more than two years ago, she decided to sell accessories for women; such as earrings, bracelets, wallets, purses and bags of different prices. At the beginning she went out to sell everyday in the main streets of the city, but now, with her baby, she only goes out to sell on weekends. This is a profitable business, with merchandise that is not perishable and doesn’t need previous work, such as food, she only has to purchase the merchandise. Jessica is very willing to keep this type of business, the most difficult part is not having a stable location to sell, for which she will keep saving to afford her own store location. Jessica makes all these efforts to help with the expenses of her home, for her little ones to have a stable future. With the loan, she will travel to purchase merchandise and have more income. Her goal is to be a great vendor and become a supplier of women accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Travel to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Teofila es casada, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Teofila viaja a la ciudad de Cañete todos los fines de semana que se ubica a 6 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende cereales y de Cañete compra frutas como fresa, pepino que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Teofila tiene un establo en la ciudad de Cañete y junto a su esposo se dedican al engorde de ganado vacuno.
Teofila necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales variados.
Teofila sueña con construir su casa, ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Community Bank "Despertar" (meaning, Awaken).

Teofila is married, she is 31 years old and she has 3 children. Teofila travels to the city of Canete on the weekends, located 6 hours from the city of Ayacucho, where she sells cereals. And from Canete she purchases fruits such as strawberries and cucumbers which she then resells in the great markets in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Teofila has a stable in the city of Canete and together with her husband they raise cattle.

Teofila requires a loan amounting to 800 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of various cereals.

Teofila dreams of building a house, expanding her busienss and providing a good education for her children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TTeofila requires a loan of 800 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of various cereals.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mrs. Suy S., age 58, is a widow who makes a living by raising pigs and by selling a little rice and food. This is the main source of income for her family. She has three children. All are married, and one of her daughters is a local tailor who earns an income of $4 per day. They live together in Banteay Meanchey Province. 

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle to make the family's transportation easier, to buy a piglet to raise, and to purchase a sewing machine for her daughter's business.

Mrs. S. was not available, so her daughter is presented in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambat V., 53, and her husband, Mr. Set Sam, 61, residents of an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home; two others are weavers, while the youngest daughter attends school.
	
Sambat has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a teacher since 1979.   

Sambat is now requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame  Kadia D.  a 36 ans, elle réside avec son époux et leurs 5 enfants (1 garçon et 4 filles) à Mamassoni, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Kadia D. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à la fabrique des savons traditionnels (savons noirs) il y a maintenant six (06) ans qu’elle a appris auprès d’une amie. Elle mène son activité dans son domicile de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par une grande clienèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant trois (03) ans. Après 2 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) avec une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 4 futs des déchets d’huile de coton (pates noires) et 2 sacs de soude caustique. Après fabrication des savons à base de déchets d’huile de coton et de soude caustique, elle les revend en détail de façon ambulante à une clientèe composée généralement des femmes de sa localité..
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadia D., 36, resides with her husband and their 5 children (one son and 4 daughters) in Mamassoni, an outlying district of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mrs. Kadia D., after having tried out a lot of businesses without success, began to manufacture traditional soap (black soap) 6 years ago, when she learned the skill from a friend. She runs this business out of her home in Sikasso where she is much in demand with a big clientele due to the quality of her product. To satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided 3 years ago to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After two group loans together with an association of women from her neighborhood, she is now on her third individual loan, all preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed.

With this loan she intends to buy 4 barrels of cotton oil waste (a black paste) and two sacks of caustic soda. After making the soap out of this cotton oil waste and caustic soda, she sells it retail door-to-door to a clientele mainly made up of women from her neighborhood.

With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA which will be used essentially to grow her working capital and cover her costs, contributing to family expenses and making repayments on her loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing cotton oil waste (black paste) and caustic soda to make soap

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 43 years old and married with four children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. Mary sells provisions like noodles, detergent, toothpaste, etc. She sells retail to her customers. Mary hopes for a loan to purchase more provisions to sell to her customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Jose Celestino

texts.es: Flavio Julio es un pequeño productor agropecuario que desde muy joven a dedicado su vida a la siembra de arroz en pequeñas cantidades, cuenta con la experiencia en las actividades productivas. Su familia esta compuesta por 6 personas, todos sus hijos son mayores y trabajan en coordinacion familiar para la siembra de arroz, su esposa atiende el hogar despachando muy temprano a su marido hacia sus areas de cultivo; don Flavio sueña con participar en la construccion de un trillo y se materializara con la presente solicitud de este credito.
texts.en:
Flavio Julio es un pequeño productor agropecuario que desde muy joven a dedicado su vida a la siembra de arroz en pequeñas cantidades, cuenta con la experiencia en las actividades productivas. Su familia esta compuesta por 6 personas, todos sus hijos son mayores y trabajan en coordinacion familiar para la siembra de arroz, su esposa atiende el hogar despachando muy temprano a su marido hacia sus areas de cultivo; don Flavio sueña con participar en la construccion de un trillo y se materializara con la presente solicitud de este credito.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Aporte para construccion de trillo arrocero

loans.name: Shahida Parveen

texts.en: Shahida parveen K. A. has lived in the city of Riwind, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Her husband, K. A., has been in the dairy business for the past five years and currently owns one buffalo. Shahida runs a business sewing clothes. She earns an income by taking clothing orders from her relatives and neighbors. She saves her income as part of a collective in hopes of covering wedding expenses for her single daughter. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband’s dairy business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her family's dairy business.

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Mrs. Gena D., 32, is married and lives in Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. When she learned about Paglaum MPC, she became a member in July 2008 so that she could get help to set up her business. She used her first loan of PHP 3,000 to buy one piglet and this is how she started her hog-raising business.

She is grateful to God that her hog-raising business has done very well and she has buyers already. Now she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and more piglets. She also wants to build a concrete piggery for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed and more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica B. is married and five dependents. She has received an education through primary school. Since 1989, Monica has worked as a trader selling maize, food, and groceries in Elmina. While Monica works as a trader, her husband is employed as a teacher.

Monica uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. Monica will use this loan to purchase more food and other groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Monica plans to build a house.

loans.use: Monica will use the loan to purchase more food and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
"I started farming using a 3-hectare farm. My husband and I are tenants. We are working in the farm of our friend. During harvest, we decide for share. From our experiences, farming is the only thing that sustain our family," says Mae S., a farmer and mother of two children.

Mae would like a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy certified seeds, complete fertilizers, and herbicides. The loan will greatly help the family improve their harvest.

CEVI provides not just loans to their clients. It also offers training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase certified seeds, complete fertilizers, and herbicides.

loans.name: Phạm's Group

texts.en: V. Phạm Thị (20213020001) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. She is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ân Tập 04 (4). V. is married and has three school-aged children. V. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month. V. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan for the first time from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Đinh Thị T. (20213020002) is a 45-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business. 2. Vũ Thị D. (20213020003) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. 3. Tô Thị D. (20213020004) is a 45-year-old female who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. 4. Chu Thị T. (20213020005) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** V. Phạm Thị (20213020001) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. V. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ân Tập 04 (4). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. V. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, V. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. V. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. V. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Đinh Thị T. (20213020002) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 2. Vũ Thị D. (20213020003) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 3. Tô Thị D. (20213020004) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 4. Chu Thị T. (20213020005) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Delphin

texts.en:
Delphin P., 22, is married with one child. She has two years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the general public five days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala. She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Delphin’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, fabrics, threads and zippers

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Нуринисо на полученный повторный кредит планирует съездить в Истаравшан и привезти несколько видов мужских летних брюк.Она пунктуальная заёмщица и ни разу не нарушала условий организации.Нуринисо благодарна KIVA за понимание и поддержку в финансировании.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization.
