Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Nuriniso plans to use this repeat loan to travel to Istaravshan and bring several kinds of men's summer trousers. She is a punctual client and has never broken the policy of our organization. Nuriniso is thankful to Kiva for understanding and financial support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fulfill the assortment of men's clothing

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en: Mrs. Chroeb P. lives in Ank Prasat village in Takeo province. She sells clothing in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Chhay Thy, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Chroeb P. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy more clothing to add to her business. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. She is 44 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are attending the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her husband's rice field and to buy more clothing to add to her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is from the village of Buyog, Banlag, Valencia City. She is 54 years old. Virginia is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Virginia has been in business for over five years, and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is thirty-one years old. He is married and the father of two children, a boy and a girl. Both of his children are in school. Moses works very hard to be able to provide for the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He is a fitting mechanic by profession. Moses repairs faulty vehicles. He has a workshop in his community. He also deals in spare car parts. Moses wants a loan to buy working materials and spare parts to expand his business. He has been in business for two years.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for vehicles

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a fish vendor.  She is married to Agusto and he works as a tricycle driver and sometimes they also uses their tricycle as their service in selling fish.  The couple also tills a small farm lot where they also get some of their needed income for their living survival. Maricel is 29 years old. Her goal in life is to supply the needs of her family and send her two children in school. 

Maricel and Agusto is striving for their business improvement. To be able to generate bigger income, they are now asking to avail a loan of PHP5, 000 from the KIVA lenders.  She will use the loan to buy more fish that she will sell in their village. She hopes that she could avail the amount of loan she is requesting for her to sustain all the needs of her family and for her to save money for the future schooling of their two children.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Chenita

texts.en:
Chenita Q. previously lived in Zamboanga del Sur on the island of Mindanao together with her family, but the family decided to move back to Negros Occidental in 1991. Before they left Zamboanga del Sur, they sold their property so that they could have enough capital to start a new life in Negros. When they arrived in Negros, they used the money to buy land and planted fruit-bearing trees like calamansi, guava, and pineapple.

Today Chenita is 49 years old and lives in the village of Sitio Minahan, Brgy. Odiong, Moises Padilla, Negros Occidenal. She is married to Abuncio who takes care of their farm. The couple is blessed with three children who are 12 to 20 years of age, and are all still going to school. Her older son plans to join the military in Bulacan when he graduates from the Negros State College of Agriculture in Kabankalan City, and this is why Chenita and her husband are working really hard so that they can help their son reach his goals.

Their small farm earned a good income for the family and Chenita started a pig-fattening business to supplement their income from the farm. In 1998, Chenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon because she needed fresh capital to buy fertilizer and other necessities for the farm and her pig-fattening business. When she paid off her loan, she borrowed new capital and started to sell generic medicine in her community. For all her efforts she earns a $340 monthly income from her various businesses.

Previously, for her 14th cycle loan, she borrowed Php 11,000 to use as capital for her businesses. That loan was fully paid in full and on time without any delays. For her 15th cycle loan she is borrowing Php 20,000 to use as additional working capital for her generic medicine business and to buy fertilizer for their farm.  Whatever additional income results from the loan will be used for the education of her children and for the expansion of the businesses.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Generics Medicine business and for farm supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is a 53-year-old married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has six children. The eldest is 25 years old. Aside from rice farming, she also plants corn. Despite having a good harvest from her rice crops, she still needs additional capital for her corn. A member of CEVI for more than a year now, she requested a loan of PHP 12,000. She will use this loan to purchase corn seeds and other farm inputs she needs to grow her farm.

loans.use: To purchase corn seed and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kop

texts.en: Kop S., 58 years old, is a villager living in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. To earn a living, Kop S. rents a medium-size kiosk at the market, where she sells beef for a profit. She sells beef that she gets from her husband’s slaughtering. Her husband buys and raises cows for slaughter. Kop S. is blessed with two children, who are married and have already started new family homes. Kop S. is pursuing a loan for capital to buy more cows for slaughtering. Note: Kop S. was not available for photographing, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy more cows for slaughtering

loans.name: Ana Yanci

texts.es: Ana Yanci P. de 26 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo, el  cual es empleado de una empresa privada. Ana posee una venta de ropa para personas de todas las edades, el negocio esta ubicado en el centro de Ciudad Arce y ella es muy conocida por las personas por ser una mujer muy responsable, la cual comercializa ropa de primera calidad y precios muy accesibles. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más ropa y de esta manera aumentar la mercadería y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
26-year old Ana Yanci P. lives in Arce, in La Libertad department. Her husband works for a private company. Ana owns a business located in the centre of Arce selling clothing for people of all ages. She enjoys a reputation as a very responsible woman. The clothing she sells is high quality at good prices. Ana is asking for a loan so she can buy more clothes and in this way increase her stock and thus offer a greater choice to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Peter Macharia

texts.en:
Peter Macharia M. is a 48-year-old gentleman who is married to 44-year-old Ann Wangeci. His wife is a teacher by profession and together they have four children with the eldest being in college while the rest are in primary and secondary levels of schooling. 

Peter has a small candle-making business which he does from his house. He makes the candles and sells them to people in different places where he gets orders. 

Peter joined KADET after being introduced by friends from within a group they had formed to support each other in their businesses. This will be his second loan after successfully repaying the first one. He hopes to use the loan to buy more raw materials for his candle-making business as the demand is quite high now. 

In future he wants to expand his business to cater for more orders as he wants to be able to meet all his family obligations especially paying for the college education for all his children.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his candle-making business.

loans.name: God's Gift Group

texts.en:
John, age 30, runs a grocery store, and this is his main source of income to support his family. He is married and the father of two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. He lives with his family in their own house in a farming community.

John is the leader of a village trust bank group called "God’s Gift." The members are all traders and food vendors who support their families through these businesses. They want to use the loan to purchase stock in bulk to avoid costly price hikes and also to cut down on frequent travels. They are expecting to make higher profits this season, and this will help them support their families and pay their kids' school fees. Your support through this loan would enable them to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk

loans.name: Soli

texts.en:
Soli L. is 56 and married with 5 children (ages 12 - 26).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Soli has many years of experience in this business.  Soli needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 tala or US $63 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Soli joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Soli's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Soli L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.9 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa A. is from Barangay Ibung, a village in Villaberde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 45 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Luisa owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Luisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Luisa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Brisas 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Victoria is the coordinator of her group, Brisas (Breezes), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums north of the capital, Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Victoria is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing, by purchasing a dozen men's and women's pants to sell as well as a dozen polo shirts and blouses to sell. She will use the profits to invest in her home by improving the roof as well as saving money to proviD. for a day when she may become sick. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase pants, polo shirts and blouses for resale

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila, age 46, manages a rice field and a rice mill. Now a widow, she is left with seven children. Her oldest child does not live with her anymore. She keeps herself strong in order to bear the hard work required at the farm and the mill. Her older children also help her manage the business.

Petronila wants to improve her income. So, she applied to CEVI. She is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP. She will use that loan to buy fertilizer and other needed farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other needed farm supplies

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic C., 37, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Rodel C., a salesman, she is blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Marivic has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 18,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying groceries needed to replenish stocks in her product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying groceries needed to replenish stocks in her product inventory

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MARTHA, EN UNA NUEVA CLIENTE DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION, CON 4 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, VIVE AUN EN LA CASA DE SU PADRE, EN EL MISMO LUGAR SE ENCUENTRA SU RESTAURANT DONDE PREPARA ALMUERZOS TODOS LOS DIAS DE LA SEMANA Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA CON PLATOS ESPECIALES Y TIENE BASTANTE AFLUENCIA DE CLIENTES POR SU DELICIOSA COMIDA Y ANTE LA NECESIDAD DE GARANTIZAR LA HIJIENE Y COMODIDAD DE SUS CLIENTES, SOLICITA EL FINANCIAMIENTO PARA COMPRAR UNA CONSERVADORA DE ALIMENTOS Y DE ESTA MANERA INCREMENTAR SU CLIENTELA Y POR ENDE SUS GANACIAS, ES MUY TRABAJADORA SACA ADELATE A SU FAMILIA SOLA YA QUE ES MADRE SOLTERA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
MRS. MARTHA IS A NEW CUSTOMER AT OUR INSTITUTION. SHE HAS 4 SCHOOL-AGED CHILDREN AND STILL LIVES IN HER FATHER’S HOUSE. HER RESTAURANT IS IN THE SAME PLACE. SHE MAKES LUNCHES EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK AND SPECIAL DISHES ON THE WEEKENDS. SHE HAS A GOOD CUSTOMER TURNOUT FOR HER DELICIOUS FOOD. IN ORDER TO GUARANTEE HYGIENE AND FOR CUSTOMER CONVENIENCE, SHE IS APPLYING FOR FUNDING TO PURCHASE A REFRIGERATOR. THIS WAY SHE INCREASES HER CUSTOMERS AND THEREFORE HER EARNINGS. SHE IS A VERY HARD WORKER PROVIDING FOR HER FAMILY BY HERSELF SINCE SHE IS A SINGLE MOTHER. SHE IS VERY THANKFUL TO EMPRENDER AND KIVA FOR THEIR TRUST IN GRANTING THE LOAN.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE A REFRIGERATOR

loans.name: Charo Masha

texts.en:
Charo is a 60-year-old farmer who lives in Malindi with his wife and ten children. Six of his children are all grown up. 

Charo has been farming for the past six years, and he normally gets a monthly profit of Kshs 6,500. He sells his harvest on wholesale terms to distributors within Malindi town. 

Charo was introduced to Kadet by an existing member of his group and is on his second loan. He has applied for a loan, with which he will use Kshs 7,500 for land preparation, Kshs 6,000 on fertilizers, Kshs 2,000 on hybrid seeds and Kshs 8,000 on labor, and he plans to save the balance for weeding. With the extra earnings from this loan, he will buy another dairy cow and save for his children’s education.

Charo is a hardworking man who hopes to build a better residential house for his family and educate children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: Land preparation, to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay for labor

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: El Sr. Rafael R. A. de  56 años de edad, es conviviente. Tiene 2 hijos que son independientes. Vive en casa propia ubicada en el Caserio de la Venta Baja. Trabaja como obrero de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir la vivienda. Su sueño es lograr construir toda la vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. Rafael Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Rafael is 56 years old, and has a live-in partner. Rafael has 2 children who are independent and he lives in his own house located in the Venta Baja community. Rafael works in the countryside for agro-industrial enterprises. He is an enterprising person who, thanks to his efforts, came to acquire his own property. He needs the loan to finish building his house. His dream is to finally finish construction of his home, in order to achieve a better quality of life. Rafael is very grateful for the help that we are able to offer by means of this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FINISHING BUILDING HIS HOUSE

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 25 años y tiene dos hijos. Ella nos cuenta que estudió la carrera de administración rural en la institución CENFOPAR (Centro de Formación Profesional - Arariwa). Actualmente, su actividad económica es vender refrigerio a las artesanas por ejemplo vende leche y hamburguesas, pero  ahora va empezar a trabajar como supervisora en el PRONAMAR (Programa Nacional de Alfabetización). Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va excelente. 

Luisa es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario salir adelante, ella requiere el préstamo para implementar el negocio y va comprar dos termos que cuestan cada uno 130 soles.

Luisa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luisa belongs to the Union of Ollantaytambo Community Bank, a part of the Arariwa Association. She is 25 years old and has two children. She studied business administration at CENFOPAR (Arariwa Professional Formation Center), a rural educational center. Currently, she sells refreshments, like hamburgers and milk, to artisans. Soon she will start working as a supervisor with PRONAMAR (the National Alphabetization Program). She has had her business for many years and has had excellent results. Luisa is a hard-working self-starter who is always looking for opportunities to improve her life through hard work. She is applying for the loan to buy two thermoses, each of which costs 130 soles, for her business. Luisa is thankful for the opportunity offered through this organization, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of thermoses

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Мусоев Чамшед проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 32 года. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Брат, преподает в средней школе. Сам Чамшед имеет среднее образование. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он продает мужскую одежду и обувь. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Jamshed M. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 32 years old, married, with 7 children. His wife is a housewife. His brother is a middle school teacher. Jamshed himself has a secondary education. He has worked in retail for more than five years. He owns a store where he sells men's clothing and shoes. He is applying for credit to increase the selection of merchandise at his store.

Translated from Russian by Irina Chakraborty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase merchandise selection

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa P., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. She is married to Francisco P., a vendor, and they are blessed with six children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own clothing buy and sell business while also operating a food stall. She sells mainly breakfast fare in the mornings, flavored drinks, barbeques and meats in the afternoon and night.

Luisa has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 14,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more quantities of raw and ready to sell products to be incorporated into her current product inventories.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a comfortable life for her family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying more quantities of raw and ready to sell products to be incorporated into her current product inventories.

loans.name: Jhon William

texts.es:
Jhon de 21 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con aminos de tierra y lomas en disolución), El tiene un centro de fotocopiado, desde que salio del colegio para ayudar con los gastos familiares. 

Desde pequeño su papa le enseño a trabajar en fotocopiado, pero cuando creció no tenia oportunidades de trabajar en otra parte, invirtió sus ahorros en una fotocopiadora y hojas poco a poco consiguió tener una computadora.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una fotocopiadora para incrementar su negocio, en el futuro quiere tenr mas clientes en su negocio y comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Jhon is 21 years old and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil. He has had a photocopy center since he let school, in order to help with the family’s expenses. His father taught him how to work with copiers at a young age. When he grew up, he didn’t have opportunities to work in other areas, so he invested his savings into a copy machine and paper. Little by little, he also managed to obtain a computer. He plans to use the loan to by another copier, in order to grow his business. His future plans include expanding his customer base and buying his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a copy machine.

loans.name: Darwin Alcivar

texts.es:
Darwin de 41 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), el vende frutas y jugos naturales en el local que tiene en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Antes de tener su negocio el trabajaba vendiendo colchones pero como necesitaba mas tiempo para pasar con sus hijos puso un puesto de venta de frutas y batidos y para mas seguridad el tuvo que poner rejas en su negocio de frutas (como en la foto), trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 12h30 todos los días.  

Para poder tener mas variedad en su negocio el quiere implementar productos nuevos por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar un congelador, panes y lácteos. En el futuro quiere un local de desayunos y que sus hijo puedan termina con éxito sus estudios.
texts.en:
Darwin, 41, lives in Guayaquil’s Las Orquídeas area (an urban zone so-called because when it was discovered the area had many orchids). He is a fruit and natural juice vendor. He has a sales stand in the front part of his house. Prior to having his own business he was a mattress salesman but he wanted to spend more time with his children so he set up a fruit and fruit juice stand in his home. For increased security he had to install metal grilles in his business (as shown in the photo). He is open for business from 7am until 12:30 every day. In order to have more variety he’d like to add new products so he needs a loan to buy a freezer, baked goods and dairy products. In the future, he’d like to have a breakfast café and and he’d like his children to complete their schooling successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For a freezer and dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: COMPLETING THE PURCHASE OF LAND ON WHICH TO BUILD HIS OWN HOUSE

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios P. is from the village of Cabisera 8. She is 40 years old. Remedios is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Remedios owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling  charcoal to community members. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Remedios joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture charcoal and additional products. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture charcoal and additional products. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Remedios from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture charcoal and additional products

loans.name: Rosemarie's Group

texts.en:
Rosemarie D. is from the village of San Andres. She is 33 years old. Rosemarie is the leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosemarie D..

Rosemarie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosemarie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. Her other 9 members also are requesting 5000 PHP each for their additional capital and their group loan has a total of 50000 PHP.  

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem P., 45, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. P. is a garment factory worker, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Two of her children are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day to help cover the family's expenses. 

The family has to spend USD 72 on food and USD 10 on children education every month. P. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Princesas X Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Princesas,les gustó el nombre porque se identifican con sus hijas y sus caricaturas favoritas,se sintieron contentas con la formación de su grupo el cual consta de 10 señoras.Todas y cada una de ellas tiene una historia diferente, el grupo es muy organizado y cumplido cuentan, son mujeres trabajadoras con negocios creados a base de sacrificios, todo con el afán de darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, casi todas son casadas y también comparten sus ideales con sus esposos. La señora Guadalupe C. por ejemplo tiene un negocio de manualidades para todo tipo de eventos y quiere el préstamo para invertir en fieltro y artículos varios para la elaboración de sus manualidades, las que realiza con mucho esmero y así logra tener mucho trabajo. 
La presidenta se llama Blanca Martínez, ella vende calzado deportivo y escolar desde hace tiempo.En términos generales este grupo al día de hoy está sumamente motivado, sienten un verdadero aprecio por la gente que hace posible este préstamo y existe el compromiso de tener una relación comercial solida.
texts.en:
This group is called "Princesses."  They like this name because they identify it with their daughters and with their favorite cartoons.  They are happy to have formed the group consisting of ten women.  Each and every one of the women has a different story.  The group is very organized and all the members have all met.  They are hard-working women with businesses created through sacrifice, all in an effort to create a better future for their children.  Almost all are married and share their ideals with their husbands.

Member Guadalupe C. has a craft business for all types of events and wants a loan to invest in felt and sundry materials for the development of her craft items, which she makes with great care and thereby manages to work a lot.  Blanca Martínez is the president.  She has sold athletic and school shoes for some time.

In general, this group is highly motivated and feels a real appreciation for the people who make this loan possible.  They are committed to having a solid business relationship.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and invest in the businesses.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean L. is from the village of Amoyong, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 30 years old. Jean is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Jean is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta forma parte del banco comunal “Un Desafío para Todos” de la comuna de Puente Alto.  Ella tiene un bazar y paquetería en su casa,  desde hace 7 años, en donde también vende alimentos para mascotas. 
Con este préstamo comprará una máquina congeladora de helados y mercadería. Su meta es tener más variedad de productos en su negocio. Su sueño es comprar un auto, para facilitar el proceso de las compras de la mercadería. 
Marta agradece el apoyo de Fondo Esperanza, a través de los préstamos y la educación, destacando entre los temas, cómo administrar su negocio. También valora las amistades que ha ganado dentro de su grupo. 
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
Marta is a member of the communal bank "A Challenge for All" in the town of Puente Alto. She has run a bazaar and a parcel service out of her home for the last 7 years. She also sells pet food. With this loan, she will buy an ice cream machine and other merchandise. Her goal is to have a wider variety of products for her business. Her dream is to buy a car in order to purchase the merchandise for her business more easily. 

Marta appreciates the support that Fondo Esperanza has given her through their loans and educational classes, especially their business administration class. She also values the friendships she has made through the group. 

Puente Alto is a town located to the north of Santiago, the capital of Chile. It was founded as a small rural town at the end of the nineteenth century but due to its large demographic growth, today it is one of the most populous towns in Chile with more than 600,000 inhabitants. It is the port of entry to the metropolitan section of the Andean foothills, known as the Cajón de Maipo. This sector is known for its hiking trails, horseback riding and rafting as well as its hospitality industry.

loans.use: Ice cream machine and merchandise

loans.name: Jowasi

texts.en:
Jowasi is 27 years old and married to a farmer. He has one child who is two-and-a-half years old. Jowasi has a boutique with a variety of commodities and he has requested this loan to add more merchandise in his boutique. His business is very important to him and has helped provide for his family's needs. He has been working in this business for the period of six years and he is very experienced. With the profits, he hopes to buy more items like rice, nails and cooking oil because they are in demand. 

In the future, he would like to have a large and full shop with in-demand commodities that are important to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sailauhan

texts.en:
Sailauhan H. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His three children attend a local secondary school and his wife works in the local cafe. 

Sailauhan operates a raw materiasl trading business in his town. He started his business in 2009 by purchasing and selling animal skins in his local area. He purchases raw materials such as sheepskin, goat skin and cow and horse hides from local people at wholesale prices and sells those skins and leathers to big suppliers adding 500-1000 MNT on each item price. His daily sales income is between 40,000 and 60,000 MNT with 10-15% of net profits. He continues to make progress with his business and uses his earnings to improve his family's quality of life. 

Sailauhan is a clever, modest and talented man. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more animal skins and hides due to upcoming preparation of meat for winter.

loans.use: To purchase more animal skins

loans.name: Delmis Marina

texts.es:
la señora Delmis Marina F. A. tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos, sus hijos estudian y uno de ellos se esta graduando de policia.
su esposo le ayuda en la panederia con la distrubucion, ya que ellos cuentan con un vehiculo para transportar el producto a diferentes lugares.
doña delmis se dedica al negocio de pan desde hace 10 años, con esta actividad a logrado hacer su casa.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de los panes.
se a quedado un poco descapitalizada y desea inyectarle capital al negocio.
 
sus mayores deseos en esta navidad es que la paz y el amor del señor nos visite a todos en nuestros hogares y pide salud y fortaleza para enfrentar las adversidades.
texts.en:
Delmis Marina F. A. is 39 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Her children are studying and one of them is graduating as a policeman.

Delmis' husband supports her with deliveries in her bakery as they have a vehicle for transporting their products to different places.  Delmis has been in the bread-making business for 10 years and this activity has helped her to support her household.

She will use this loan to buy materials for making bread.  She doesn't have much capital right now and would like to inject capital into her business.

Delmis' greatest wish this Christmas is for the peace and love of the Lord to visit us all in our homes.  She requests health and strength to face life's adversities.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, butter, margarine, flavorings, vanilla, yeast, baking soda and firewood

loans.name: Wilbroad

texts.en: Wilbroad is fifty years old, married, and has eight children. He lives with his family in their own house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He desires to educate all his children. He has a retail shop and has also been a farmer for over fifteen years, and his business is still profitable. His constraint is lack of enough capital to fund his business, and his dream is to have a wholesale shop. Wilbroad needs the loan to buy sugar, soap and salt for selling in his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap and salt for resale

loans.name: Bilqis' Group

texts.en:
Bilqis lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area of Hussain Nagar with her family in a two-room brick house.  

Bilqis is married to A. B., who runs a motor workshop in the market. He started this business 30 years ago and now it is working well for him.  

She has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Her youngest son and daughter are studying while the others work with their father in his motor workshop business.  

Bilqis herself is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is a very active lady and always shows full support to her husband in difficult times.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her family business. With the loan, her husband will buy the latest repairing tools for his workshop to further improve his business.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.  

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called the Asasah passbook is Bilqis.

loans.use: To buy the latest repairing tools for a motor workshop

loans.name: Juana Regina

texts.es:
La señora Juana O. tiene 44 años y su pareja es el Sr. Silvino Alvarenga, quien  trabaja en las huertas cultivando y cosechando hortalizas como cebollita de verdeo, poroto manteca, choclo, locote, cebolla de cabeza y lechuga.
Ellos tienen su huerta en San Lorenzo, ella se encarga de las ventas de todos estos productos de Siembra, es quien por la mañana temprano trabaja hasta que venda todos sus productos.
En la casa viven dos de sus hijos, quienes trabajan en forma dependiente y colaboran con los gastos de la casa pagando sus estudios.
Con este crédito piensan comprar algunos elementos de trabajo como manguera para el riego, semillas, abono y pagos del personal que cobra por día.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana O. is 44 years old. Her husband is Sr. Silvino Alvarenga, who works in a garden growing and harvesting vegetables such as green onions, butter beans, corn, peppers, onions, and lettuce. Their garden is in San Lorenzo. Juana is responsible for selling all of the products they grow. She starts working early in the morning until all of her products are sold. Juana lives with two of her children who work independently, contribute toward the household expenses, and pay for their studies.

With this loan, Juana plans to buy a few supplies for her work such as tubing for irrigation, seeds, compost. She will also pay the daily wages of her workers.

loans.use: Purchase tubing for irrigation, seeds, compost; pay wages of her workers

loans.name: Neli Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila, tiene 57 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y nació en la ciudad de Lamay y actualmente Lucila  vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Lucila después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica al atender su tienda de abarrotes. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Lucila en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo gaseosas, cervezas, arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas para abastecer su tienda.   

Lucila pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lucila is 57 years old and the mother of two children. She was born in Lamay, but lives now in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. After having finished her household chores, Lucila works in her grocery store. She has been in this business for 15 years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Lucila currently needs a loan to buy merchandise, such as soft drinks, beer, rice, sugar, noodles and other products to stock up her store.

Lucila is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, such as soft drinks, beer, rice, sugar, noodles and other products to stock up her store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married woman living with her husband and 3 school-aged children. She is from Lebanon. She has been working as baker for 20 years. In 2009, she opened her own bakery and started to prepare delicious fresh goods and sell them to members from her community and neighboring villages.  She cooperates with her husband to handle heavy living expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to develop her shop. The loan will help her increase her store’s inventory and purchase aluminum stands where she can place panels. In the future, she is planning to extend her operation by opening a restaurant.

loans.use: increasing her store’s inventory and purchasing aluminum stands

loans.name: Ubertina

texts.es:
Ubertina tiene 32 años y nació en la comunidad de Yanahuara. La socia Ubertina es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, Ubertina vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y su actividad económica es la venta de Chicha de Jora. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.
    
Ubertina es una mujer emprendedora y trabadora que requiere  el préstamo para comprar maíz para hacer jora.
texts.en: Ubertina is 32 years old.  She was born in the community of Yanahuara.  Ubertina is married and has four children as the fruit of this union.  Currently, Ubertina lives in the same community where she was born.  Her business is selling chicha de jora (a traditional drink made from fermented corn).  She has been in this business for 4 years, and it is doing well, thanks to the effort she has put into her work.  Ubertina is an enterprising and hard working woman who needs the loan in order to purchase corn to make jora.

loans.use: to purchase corn for making jora (a traditional beverage).

loans.name: Green Machine Group

texts.en:
Rosemary M. (pictured in red) is a cross-border trader. She is 49, a widow, and has three children who are no longer going to school. She has one dependent whom she also takes care of.  Her additional income comes from her late husband’s pension that she receives from the Zimbabwe National Army. She faces difficulties in acquiring sufficient funds for bulky purchases. 

She plans to go to Zambia to purchase suits and jeans for resale in Zimbabwe with the loan she is applying for from MicroKing. She envisions herself operating a huge clothing shop in town.

loans.use: To purchase clothes from Zambia for resale in Zimbabwe

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena B., 41, a resident of Brgy. Bautista, Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Wilson B., a landscaping artist, and is the mother of six children. Three of them are studying at high school, two are in elementary grades and the other one is in college.  

At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Rowena, as she herself was an elementary graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Rowena has been managing her own landscaping business for quite some time now. She is partnering with her husband in operating this business. Rowena offers landscaping services to individuals who desire to beautify their home gardens. She also sells ornamental plants and other landscaping materials for hobbyists and even schools in her local community. Rowena earns an estimated net income of 12,000 PHP a month. 

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business to buy supplies and other materials for their landscaping needs.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and other materials for landscaping needs.

loans.name: Tey

texts.en: Tey V., 31, lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh, where the location is good for running a business. Before Tey V. was a businesswoman, she sold incense and candles in and around the markets. Now, she is employed in the garment industry as a seamstress. She has a salary to use for her family’s needs. Her husband helps provide income by working in the construction sector and, also, as a musician. This couple work hard to ensure their two single children have enough food and are educated. Because Math Sok's house is getting old, it has broken in many parts and needs repair. Tey V. has requested her second loan to repair the broken parts of her house.

loans.use: to repair the broken parts of her house.

loans.name: Jamil Francisco

texts.es: Jamil Francisco tiene 35 años, el es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Jamil se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de constructora y tiene 8 años de experiencia desempeñándose en esta labor. el es un cliente conocido por lo que su trabajo consiste en realizar obras verticales, inicio por su Papa quien le enseño todo el negocio y Jamil más tarde decide establecer su propio negocio. Esta solicitando un préstamo que lo utilizará para invertir en piedrín, canteras, arena, bloques, ladrillos y maquinara para el buen desarrollo de su actividad y así optimizar la calidad de producción. Jamil desea seguir contando con nuestro apoyo solicitando préstamos para invertir en su actividad, así seguir creciendo poco apoco y lograr adquirir más clientes.
texts.en: Jamil Francisco is 35 years old.  He is married and has three minor children.  Jamil provides construction services and has done this work for 8 years.  He is well known and he works on tall buildings. He learned his trade from his father who taught him the business. He later decided to open his own business.  He is requesting a loan that he will use to purchase gravel, quarried stone, sand, cement blocks, bricks, and machinery to do his work and optimize his production quality.  Jamil would like to continue to rely on our support by requesting future loans for his business, so that he can continue growing bit by bit and gaining more customers.

loans.use: to purchase gravel, quarried stone, sand, cement blocks, bricks and machinery.

loans.name: Fanny Yaneth

texts.es:
Fanny, vive con su esposo, una hija y sus suegros, su hija tiene dos años de edad, tiene un negocio donde vende pupusas y refrescos, este surgió por el apoyo de su esposo y su suegra, trabaja por las tardes, en las mañanas le ayuda a la suegra en el negocio de venta de tortillas y por el momento necesita un crédito para fortalecer el negocio de las pupusas.
Su inversión será en bebidas, refrescos, maíz, chicharrón, quesillo y condimentos, esta compra le permitirá contar con todos los materiales necesarios para la preparación de su venta, y continuar así ofreciendo un buen servicio a los clientes.
El sueño de ella es ser una microempresaria con un negocio rentable, de esta manera generar ingresos que cubran las necesidades de su familia y les permita tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Fanny lives with her husband, a daughter and her in-laws.  Her daughter is two years old.  She has a business selling “pupusas” (typical Salvadoran fast food) and beverages.  The business started with help from her husband and mother-in-law.  She works afternoons.  In the morning she helps her mother-in-law in her business selling tortillas.  She needs a loan to strengthen the pupusa business.

Her investment will be for beverages, soft drinks, corn, fried pork skin, cheese and condiments.  This purchase will help her have on hand all the necessary ingredients to prepare her items for sale and to continue offering good service to her customers.

Her dream is to become a micro businesswoman with a profitable business to generate income that will cover her family’s needs and allow them to have a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy beverages, soft drinks, corn, fried pork skin, cheese and condiments.

loans.name: Salamat's Group

texts.en:
Salamat is 45 years old, married, and has five children. Her eldest son left education after the eighth year and started working in a factory. The other three are getting their education while her youngest daughter is only three years old and hasn't started her education. 

Salamat herself is a housewife, who performs her household duties very actively and takes care of her children very well. 

Her husband owns a small piece of land and grows different crops on it. He works very hard to get better crops. He also has cows at home which he keeps to sell their milk to his community clients. 

Salamat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband's milk selling business. With the loan, he will purchase another cow to increase the productivity of milk and make more profits by selling to his clients. 

He has been operating this business for past 15 years and Salamat is very hopeful that an expansion of his business will bring more happiness to her family and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase another cow

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda lives in Uganda, is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. For the last five years, she has supported her family by roasting and selling maize. She works seven days a week and sells her products in a shop in a local retail market. She is applying for a loan for 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of fresh maize to roast. The main business challenges she faces are seasonality and transportation, and in the future she would like to go to farmers directly to buy maize and eventually grow her own. She lives in a home that she owns and has electricity but no piped-in water. Her major monthly expenses are electricity and food.

loans.use: to buy fresh maize to roast.

loans.name: Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité se inicio gracias a la Señora Rosalina, ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su comunidad. Nombraron al comité Mujeres en Acción. Se encuentran actualmente en el Segundo Ciclo cuentan con 21 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy activas y responsable entre ellas y en su comunidad.
LA Sra Rosalina se dedica a la venta de frutas. Ella comenta que es un trabajo un poco pesado, ya que todos los días debe levantarse a tempranas horas para compras las frutas que va a vender. Ella manifiesta que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia y por procurar llevar mas ingresos a la casa.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de frutas, con lo cual podrá aumentar el stock que tiene, para que no quede desabastecida cuando los clientes le demanden.
texts.en:
The present committee was formed thanks to the initiative of Señora Rosalina.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to form this group in her community.  They named the committee Mujeres en Acción [Women in Action].  They are currently in their second cycle and have 21 members.  They are a group that stands out in their neighborhood for being very active and responsible among themselves and within their community.  

Señora Rosalina sells fruit for a living.  She says that her job is a bit burdensome as she has to get up early everyday to buy the fruit that she is going to sell.  She says that everything she does is for the well-being of her family and to bring in more income.  

She is requesting a loan to buy fruit.  This will allow her to increase her stock so that she can have a supply to meet her customer's demands.

loans.use: purchase fruit to sell.

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children. 

Silvestra has a shop that sells snacks, detergents, & noodles. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Silvestra joined HSPFI this year. In the future, Silvestra hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Nenita has a retail shop that sells vegetables like tomatoes. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tomatoes & other vegetables to sell.

Nenita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes & other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is 52 years old, married and has two sons. Her husband has a carpet weaving business. He is very skillful and weaves beautifully-designed carpets, which sell for a very good price. Bashiraan couldn’t educate her sons due to financial constraints. They are involved with their father in his business of weaving and selling carpets. 
 
Bashiraan has a clothes-selling business. She purchases them from a wholesale market and sells to her local area clients at a profit. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy thread and tools, which will enable him to weave better quality carpets and earn extra income. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for past 10 years. Bashiraan hopes that an investment will help him improve his business and income.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Bashiraan.

loans.use: To buy thread and tools for carpet weaving

loans.name: Javier De Jesús

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Javier de Jesús  se dedica   a laborar como agente de seguridad en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace Diez años. Es casado y con unas personas a su cargo que le proporciona las condiciones necesarias a su familia. 

El señor Javier De Jesús ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tale como bloque, cemento, arena, y pago de mano de obra, para levantar  muro  y en ladrillar porche de su vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Javier de Jesús works as a security guard in a state-run institution in the city of Managua.  He has been in this job for ten years.  He is married and has some people in his care.  He provides for his family.

Javier De Jesús came to Ceprodel to request a loan so that he could improve his home by purchasing building supplies such as blocks, cement and sand, and pay labor costs, in order to build a wall and pave his house porch with bricks.  Through this building work, he hopes to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Zita

texts.en: Zita, who works hard to support her family, is married and has been operating a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines for five years. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items including slippers, blouses, and pants to sell. In the future, Zita would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like slippers, blouses, and pants to sell.

loans.name: 03.12.90 Thiệu Dương Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiệp works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and then sell in the future.

Hiệp is 27 years old and married with one child.
Hiệp is the group leader of the 90 Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of five members. 
She lives and works in Thiệu Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2010, Hiệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiệp has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hiệp has been involved in this business for four years.
The main hardship that Hiệp

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and then sell in the future.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 30 years old. He a hardworking man who has two children. Godfrey owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. For the past four years, he has been selling beans, cassava flour, and ground nuts. Originally, he was only selling maize, but after saving capital he expanded into his current business. Godfrey’s financial hardships are rent and high license fees.

Godfrey is requesting a loan to buy cassava flour, a posho mill, and beans to sell. His vision is to expand his business and provide for the education of his family.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, a posho mill, and beans

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Edith lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.   

Edith has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works six days out of every week. She also generates additional income through roasting maize and sweet potatoes.

Edith has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. The main business challenges for Edith include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to buy a plot of land so that she can build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Lolakhon

texts.ru: Лолахон любящий муж и ответственный отец 5 детей. Более трех лет он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур и откормом скота. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и усердно работает ради счастья своих детей. Лолахон хочет увеличить количество скота, для того чтобы расширить свой бизнес. Он также хочет приобрести минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов на обработки земли. С этой целью Лолахон запрашивает займ и надеется на вашу поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Lolakhon is a loving husband and a responsible father of five children.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up livestock for over three years.  He is a very hardworking person, who works persistently to provide happiness for his children.  Lolakhon wants to increase his livestock quantity in order to expand his business.  He also wants to purchase mineral fertilizers and pesticides for treating land.  For this purpose, Lolakhon is requesting this loan and hopes to get your support and help.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 24 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in the Philippines. Gina is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver, which she has been doing for three years. 

Gina is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy gasoline and tools for maintenance. Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and tools for maintenance.

loans.name: Mabel Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Mabel tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos.

Ella tiene 9 años de administrar su propia tienda, situada en su hogar. Ella decidió abrir la tienda debido a que existen muchas familias en ese lugar que demandan productos de primera necesidad. Mabel se traslada a una ciudad del oriente del país, todos los fines de semana a comprar los productos al por mayor. 

Mabel solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar: aceite de cocina, arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche, entre otros. Así incrementar su inventario y ofrecer más productos de primera necesidad  y con ello aumentar sus ingresos, ya que por falta de dinero ella no ha podido ofrecer más productos a sus clientes. Ella espera seguir administrando su tienda para financiar el estudio de sus hijos y brindarles todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Mabel is 52 years old and the single mother of three children.

She has managed her own store in her home for nine years.  She decided to open the store because there are many families in that area that require basic necessities.  Mabel travels to a city in the east of the country every weekend to buy her products wholesale.

Mabel is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy cooking oil, rice, sugar, eggs, and milk, among other products, to increase her inventory and offer more basic necessities.

With this she will increase her earnings, since for lack of money she has not been able to offer her customers more products.  She hopes to continue managing her store, to finance her children's studies and offer them all they need.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, sugar, eggs, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Wakasa A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wakasa A Group in Western Kenya! Felister is the facilitator of the Wakasa A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Felister takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Felister had a good maize yield, harvesting 32 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Felister was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Felister  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Felister will educate her children,repay her loan, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wakasa A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Percelinda

texts.en:
Percelinda is married with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Percelinda is 54 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy supplies, tools and other accessories for her sewing machine. Percelinda has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, tools and accessories for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía nació en la provincia de Urubamba pero vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja. Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Sofía tiene 25 años edad y es madre y padre para su único hijo, ella hace un año vivía en la ciudad de Lima y trabajaba como moza en un club de rencuentro pero le fue muy mal y tuvo regresar a la ciudad de Urubamba. Actualmente, ella trabaja como administradora de un condominio en la ciudad de Rumichaca Baja, ella también trabaja en el uno de los hoteles más lujosos de la ciudad del Cusco como bartender. Ya son cuatro meses que trabaja en el hotel y le va muy bien. Sofía en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para preparar chocolate y para comprar regalos para repartir el día 23 de diciembre en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja a los niños pobres por motivo de la natividad.  Su sueño de Sofía es abrir una discoteca y abrir una empresa de transporte urbano.  

Sofía es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Sofia was born in the province of Urubamba, but she lives in the town of Rumichaca Baja.  This town is located in the district of Urubamba, the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, Perú. 

Sofia is 25 years old and is a mother and father to her only child.  One year ago she lived in the city of Lima and worked as a waitress in a nightclub but it did not go well and she had to return to the city of Urubamba.  Currently she works as as administrator of a condominium in the city of Rumichaca Baja.  She also works in one of the most luxurious hotels in the city of Cusco as a bartender.  She has been working in the hotel for four months and it is going well.  Sofia is asking for the current loan in order to prepare chocolate and to buy gifts to give out on Dec. 23rd in the town of Rumichaca Baja to the poor children in celebration of the nativity.  Sofia's dream is to open a Dance Club and open a business for urban transit.  

Sofia is a member of the group "Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja" or "The Sunflowers of Rumichaca Baja" which is made up of 19 members who live in the town of Rumichaca Baja where they work on their economic activities.

loans.use: To prepare chocolate and to buy presents

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Mr. Lanh, age 39, is a firewood seller who travels from place to place with a trailer going through the commune to generate income for the family. His wife is in the business of raising pigs in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. This couple has been blessed with two single children, one of whom is still a student. 

Mr. Lanh is seeking a loan from HKL, a Kiva partner, to purchase four piglets to support his wife’s business. He hopes to pursue a better standard of living as he strives to work and improve his family-owned businesses. In the future, he wants to build a store outside his house for his wife to sell mixed products to the people in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets to support his wife’s business.

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Josefa es comerciante de una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, gaseosas, golosinas, comida rápidas entre otros productos. Gracias al apoyo que le a brindado Afodenic Atraves de los fondo Kiva su negocio a crecido y ahora se sustenta el propio negocio .Ella necesita un financiamiento para mejorar de su humilde vivienda ya que si ella invierte el dinero de la su negocio se quedaría sin capital de trabajo , lo cual solicita c$ 5,000.00 para comprar piedras , hierro y cemento para iniciar a construir y quitar esas laminas de zinc que le han servido durante muchos años como refugio .
texts.en: Señora Josefa is a businesswoman with a little store where she sells groceries, soft drinks, candies, and fast food, among other products. Thanks to the support that Afodenic offers her through Kiva funds, her business has grown, and now her own business sustains itself. She needs a loan to improve her humble residence, since if she invests the money from her business, she will be without working capital. She is applying for a loan of 5000 Córdobas to buy stones, iron, and cement to begin the construction and to do away with the zinc sheets that have served her for many years as a shelter.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en:
Arwa is 30 years old a mother of 2 children. she lives in Al Karak, Jordan.
Arwa is looking to have a loan of 500JDs thus she can contiue her university studies and pay all costs.

loans.use: to continue her high university studies

loans.name: Maryle Jean

texts.en:
Maryle Jean is widowed with one child. Maryle Jean is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Maryle Jean is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to (Additional Capital). 

Maryle Jean has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Maryle Jean hopes to expand her rice field some day.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal business.

Perlita has been in this business for three years. Perlita earns additional income from buying and selling young coconuts.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is married with three children and all go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She plaits hair. She has been in this business for 7 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy African braids and weaves.  She works from home on retail basis seven days a week.  She is aspiring of buying a dryer,rollers, seats to make her salon attract more customers . She resides in the family house with no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, and feeding the family .

loans.use: To buy African braids and weaves.

loans.name: Emerlyn

texts.en:
Emerlyn is 35 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Emerlyn requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emerlyn has been pig fattening for 11 years now, and has borrowed 48 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan that has been requested will assist Jennifer to buy malaria drugs because it affects a number of people in the area. She also wants to develop her plot at Gathiga.

loans.name: Akouvi Amen

texts.en:
Ms. Amen Akouvi K. is a very devoted and intelligent woman and is married to a motorcycle taxi driver. Her husband's income is not enough to fulfill the family's needs. A mother of three children, Ms. K. also takes care of her mother, who is not fit to work. Her business is making statuettes that she sells in order to help pay the family's expenses. She learned this trade from her mother. She has proven many times her abilities as a good business manager and her dedication to hard work.
