In light of the success of her business and increasing demand, she needs additional financial means in order to meet the demand of the market. The granting of a loan of $850 will allow her to modernize fabrication techniques of her statuettes and to sell them at other markets in the country. This loan will allow her to increase her income and to better help her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée à un conducteur de taxi moto, Madame K. Akouvi Amen est une femme très dévouée et intelligente. Le revenu de l’activité de son mari ne permet pas l’épanouissement de la famille. Mère de trois (3) enfants, Madame K. compte aussi à sa charge sa mère devenue inapte. Comme activité, elle fabrique des statuettes qu’elle vend afin de contribuer aux dépenses familiales. C’est un métier qu’elle a hérité de sa mère. Elle a démontré à plusieurs reprises sa capacité de bonne gestionnaire et sa rigueur au travail. Vu le succès qu’elle réalise dans ses activités et les demandes de plus en plus importantes, elle a besoin de plus de moyens financiers afin de pouvoir répondre aux exigences du marché. L’octroi de ce crédit des $850 lui permettra de moderniser ses techniques de fabrication des statuettes et de les écouler sur les autres marchés du pays. Comme impact, ce crédit lui permettra de d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de mieux venir en aide à sa famille.

loans.use: To buy the raw materials to make statuettes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria T. has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She makes beads for local and foreign markets. She is seeking a loan of US$900.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kostya

texts.en:
Kostya decided to leave his previous job as a paid driver in order to be self-employed. Like many other entrepreneurs, he recognized the benefits of working for himself and wanted to have his own business. He has been driving his own taxi now for three years. Through a taxi dispatching company, he offers transportation services around the city of Ivano-Frankivsk or further distances if required. Kostya makes about 120-130 Ukrainian Hrivna per day which is around $26 dollars. His business is the main source of income for himself and his wife, Victoria.

Kostya has requested a loan for $1000 to help with some car repairs. This is his third loan from Nadiya Ukraine. He appreciates the availability of financial services which helps with large expenses and adds stability to his business. We look forward to many more opportunities to assist Kostya in developing and running his business.

loans.use: Kostya would like to make repairs on his car so he can continue to drive his taxi.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en: Oksana has developed a successful clothing business selling higher quality women’s blouses. She is an experienced entrepreneur having started her venture about ten years ago. Her business has been very stable and she has built up about $6000 worth of inventory. Oksana chose to sell women’s clothing because she knew there would be good demand from women desiring to renew their wardrobes. She tries to maximize her sales by frequently updating her product selection and has requested a loan to help her purchase new supply of clothing inventory. Oksana has proven to be a hard-working entrepreneur with integrity and we are happy to further assist with her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for clothing business

loans.name: Ivodia

texts.en:
Ivodia is a widow and a mother of one child, and also cares for her late brother's three children.  She has faced challenges in her life which include the death of her husband, her mother and her brother.  

With the heavy responsibility of having to take care of these children single handedly, she decided to seek a loan from GHAPE and start a business.

With a loan of $100, she plans to cultivate and sell crops as she already owns a piece of farmland.  The profit will be used to pay school fees for her children, provide other basic needs for her children and invest back in her business.

She plans to repay the loan in 15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of manure, transport and seeds to start farming

loans.name: Mohammad Dawood

texts.en: Mohammad Dawood lives in District 8 of Kabul Afghanistan with his extended family, is married, educated, and owns a copy shop. During the war in Afghanistan, he lived in Pakistan for about six years.  When he returned, he opened his photocopy shop and has been operating it ever since. He wants to enlarge his shop, therefore is requesting an individual loan which will help him increase his stock and make a better income to support his family. Helping his family would make him happy and he would also wants to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria H. is 31 years old and has two children, 14 and 12 years old. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, considered one of the poorest of Managua. She has worked as a elementary school teacher for three years. During that time, she has been able to improve her house, thanks to counting on the help of her husband in taking care of their children. She wants to provide better living conditions for her children, and amongst these conditions is her house. She needs to install a bathroom with a toilet, but she can't do everything at once. The money from this loan will be used to build a toilet (drain) and also to finish building a bedroom. Right now she and her two children sleep in the same room. She hopes to be able to keep her job and that way, be able to fix up her entire house.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Victoria H. tiene 31 años, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, de 14 y 12 años respectivamente. Habita en el barrio Villa reconciliación, considerado uno de los barrios más pobres de Managua. Ella se desempeña como maestra de primaria, lleva tres años dedicándose a este trabajo, y desde ese tiempo para acá ha podido ir mejorando su casa, gracias a que cuenta con el apoyo de su marido en la manutención de sus hijos. Ella quiere darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, y entre esas condiciones está su casa, necesita instalar un servicio higiénico, pero no puede hacerlo todo de una sola vez, por lo que el dinero de este crédito lo usará para construir el desagüe y también para terminar de construir un cuarto de habitación, ya que ella y sus dos hijos duermen en un mismo cuarto. Espera poder conservar su trabajo y así poder condicionar la vivienda en su totalidad.

loans.use: Build a toilet (drain) and buy cement and iron to finish building a room.

loans.name: Juana Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is from the community of Chiara, which is over an hour outside of Ayacucho. She belongs to the community bank “Iris Lanao,” where she serves as the president. Gabriela is 32 years old. She is married and has two children who are 13 and 14. Gabriela got married when she was only 17 years and initially lived with her in-laws. Now, she and her husband live in their own home where Gabriela operates a store selling food staples such as rice, flour, and sugar. She also sells fruits and vegetables and is thinking about expanding her business to sell meat. Gabriela mentioned that in the beginning she sold very few products, and now, with the help of her community bank, she is able to sell many more items. Gabriela and her husband also have fields where they grow corn, barley, and potatoes for their family’s consumption.

Gabriela needs a loan of 1500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying a refrigerator so that she can begin to sell meat. The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Right now Gabriela is saving to buy more fields and for her children’s education. Her dream is to have a big business and that her children will receive a good education.

loans.use: Gabriela will invest in buying a refrigerator so that she can begin to sell meat.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha has been members of the “Tulipanes” community bank for three years. She mentioned that, in the community bank, she has learned to be punctual, responsible, learned how to manage her businesses, how to improve her relationship with her husband and, above all, to save.

Martha is 37 years old. She is married and has three children. Martha owns a tailor shop located in her house. She has been running this business for three years. She originally learned to sew from her aunt. Later, she perfected has ability by studying at a trade school and working in a tailor shop owned by someone else. Martha started out with only one machine, but now has four.

Martha needs a loan of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1) to invest in fabric, thread, and buttons, and to pay laborers.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Maria plans to use her savings to make more capital available to her business. Her dream is to have a successful business, and that her children will be professionals.

Click here to see Martha's latest loan.

loans.use: Martha needs a loan of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy fabric, thread, and buttons, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto is a master builder of good taste and quality. He is 32 years old and lives in the Laurels North neighborhood of Managua. He is married; his wife is a housewife and cares for their 3 young children, all of whom are in primary school. Roberto works in a construction firm. With his limited resources he has improved his humble house, without luxury but in good taste. He is applying for a loan with which to buy bricks to add to the family home that he works on and invests in with work and love, so that he can see his wife and children happy.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Roberto es un Maestro Obra de buen gusto y calidad, tiene 32 años habita en Laureles Norte, Barrio de Managua , casado, la esposa es ama de casa y cuida a los 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian la primaria. Don Roberto trabaja en una constructora y con sus recursos ha mejorado su casita humilde pero con buen gusto. Solicita un crédito para comprar ladrillos y enladrillar su casita, la que con trabajo y amor siempre trabaja e invierte en ella para ver feliz a su esposa e hijos.

loans.use: Buy bricks to use in the construction of his home.

loans.name: Ntuli

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Ntuli M.. She is married and has two children, ages 15 and 20.

In 2005, Ntuli established her cocoa business. Ntuli requires a loan in order to purchase cocoa in bulk for resale. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional cocoa in bulk.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en: Chun Y., a farmer who grows watermelon crops, earns an average income of $1.33 per day. Her husband, Mr. Thoeurn Nheb, 47, sells forest wood in their home village of Boeung Ngort in Siem Reap Province. They have five children, none of whom attend school due to the family’s economic circumstances.  They are seeking $500 to purchase a cow and buy fertilizers for their watermelon crops. The loan will help to sustain and expand their business, and improve family income. (The photo is Y.'s husband.)

loans.use: To purchase a cow and to buy fertilizers for their watermelon crops.

loans.name: Theodora

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Theodora M..  She is married and has no children.   She has one dependent, a nephew, who lives with her. In 2007, Theodora established a taxi business. Theodora requires a loan in order to make repairs to her taxi. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To make repairs to her taxi.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a fifty-seven year old separated mother with one child. She is an unemployed teacher, but owns a convenience store at her house where she sells vegetables, meat, groceries, liquor, telephone cards, and gasoline. Additionally, Margarita travels to the city of Tambo every two weeks where she sells telephone cards and gasoline, products that she buys in the city of Lima. Margarita plans to open a small gas station at her house.

Margarita is a member of the Violeta Village Bank.

Margarita needs a loan of 1600 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($575 US Dollars) to invest in more telephone cards and gasoline.

Margarita´s dream is to buy a motor line to distribute gasoline, and to have a vacation and visit countries outside of Peru.

loans.use: to invest in more telephone cards and gasoline.

loans.name: Chinigul

texts.ru: Шапоатова Чинигуль бизнесмен. Занимается торговлей . Работает на рынке «Хайр» города Вахдат. Торгует детской одеждой. Товар привозит и з города Душанбе. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 27 лет. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Хочет привезти к осенне-зимнему сезону теплую одежду. Это поможет ей не останавливать дело из-за перемены сезона. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев. Чинигуль 46 лет  и она имеет двоих детей. Муж умер десять лет назад.
texts.en:
Chinigul S. is a businesswoman. She sells children's clothes at the Hair market of Vakhdat town and has twenty-seven years of experience in this business. Chinigul buys clothes in Dushanbe. Chinigul would like to obtain a loan for increasing her cash flow. She wants to bring warm clothes in time for the fall and winter season. This would keep her business going without interruption. Chinigul plans to pay off the loan within 10 months. Chinigul is 46 years old and has two children. Her husband died ten years ago.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Den

texts.en: Mr. Den D. lives in Srah Pring Village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a fisherman who now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy more fishing equipments so he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. His wife, Mrs. Oun Lay, is a farmer and a cow breeder. Mr. Den D. is 51 years old and the father of seven children two of whom are employed in different businesses while the remaining five are attending school. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fishing equipment

loans.name: Absa

texts.fr: La dame Absa D. est mariée, mère de 05 enfants avec 06 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle tient une petite boutique de vente de divers articles et souhaiterait augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. Cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer ses condition de vie et de subvenir aux nombreuses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Absa D. is married, the mother of five children, and has six more under her care. She has a small shop where she sells various items and she would like to increase her sales. This business would enable her to raise their standard of living and to meet their many daily expenses.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and retail sale of various products in a small shop

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en:
Azamjon K. is 33 years old. He is married with 2 children. He became a father for the first time 10 years ago. This helped him to better understand the sacrifice and hard labor of the women of the house.

Azamjon works in agriculture. He has always been a very efficient worker. He grows potatoes and onions; he has been farming these crops for 11 years. 

For many years Azamjon has dreamt of building his own house. This is why he works from early morning until late at night. He hopes that someday his dream will come true. 

Today he wants to borrow 500 Somoni ($150 USD) for the term of 7 months. He will use the loan to buy bags to keep his onions and potatoes. He will also use part of the loan to hire workers. 

His goal is to sell the potatoes and onions pre-packaged in the bags at a higher price. 

This request is to help make a dream come true. Azamjon is asking for help from your generous heart.

loans.use: To purcahse bags to kepp potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita Omordion is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She sells household items like pots, plates, spoons, etc. she has many customers who patronize her business. She hopes to expand her business by increasing her stock. Rita is requesting  the loan amount of $700 to purchase more household items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more house hold items to sell

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Khy S. is 35 years old and lives in Kompong Tom Province where she runs a little store selling Khmer Noodles. With the business, she can earn about US$ 2 a day. She stared this business in 2006. She is the mother of three children, all of whom are teenagers. Her husband, Mr. Kroch Chin, is 33. He is a domestic ox trader, buying cows from far away  to raise and re-sell at a profit. He faces difficulty with his transportation and often hires a motorcycle from a neighbor to ride to work. He hopes to own a motorcycle, hence he talked with his wife and they decided to request a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Orlando Cornelio

texts.es: Don Orlando desde hace diesiciete años, ofrece sus servicios de sastre en su casa de habitación, adquirió conocimiento en trajes Gomes y trajes Guido en donde laboro por mucho años, lo cual permitió confeccionarse en su trabajo. Tiene 53 años de edad, reside en el barrio Omar Trajillos de enitel jardines de Veracruz ½ c abajo, su esposa le tiene dos hijos que estudian. Con este crédito es el segundo el cual va invertir, en materia prima como: telas, hilos, encajes y otros para realizar sus trabajo, que espera sea de mucho beneficios ya que va hacer para esta temporada de regreso a clase muchos uniformes que es lo que mas se vende, también a corto plazo es comprar otra maquina de coser industrial con mas puntadas para dar cada día mejor servicio y mejores modelos de vestir a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Orlando has been offering his services as a tailor from his home for the past 17 years. He learned this skill in Gomes Suits and Guido Suits, where he worked for many years and which allowed him to perfect his work. He is 53 years old, and lives in the Omar Trajillos neighborhood, ½ a block from Enitel in Jardines de Veracruz. His wife has two children who are studying. This is his second loan, which he will invest in raw materials, such as: fabrics, threads, laces, and other notions that he needs for his work. He hopes that he will be able to make good sales, as he is going to make a many school uniforms for the upcoming back-to-school season, since uniforms are what sell best. Also, in the short-term, he is going to buy an industrial sewing machine with more stitch styles so that he can provide better service and better models of clothing to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, threads, and lace in order to increase his clothing production

loans.name: Success

texts.en: Success is 35 years old and married with three children. Success sells foodstuffs retail to her customers. Success needs a loan to purchase more foodstuffs in large quantities to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She is a LAPO client. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Zaratu

texts.en:
Zaratu I. is a 57 year old mother of four children. She is very hard working and resourceful for her family. She lives with her husband and the children at Bekwai, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Her husband is a "Mallan" which means someone who looks into the future, can also heal you when you are sick, and can also protect you spiritually etc.

She trades in charcoal in her neighborhood, something she has done for four years. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. Zaratu obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Obuasi, where she purchase them from specific villages like Eduporsu and Awhiam in the Ashanti region, where she lives, and then retails the charcoal to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy charcoal in bulk to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings and pay for her children's educational fees. She would be grateful for your assistance. Zaratu belongs to a village bank called ‘Shei Allah’. She also hope to receive GHS900 to develop her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Jecinter Atieno

texts.en: Jecinter Atieno A. is 37 (ish) years old and has six children; they are 20, 18, 15, 14, 10 and 8 and all in school. Her husband is a bicycle mechanic. Jecinter, on the other hand, is a farmer and she plants kale, spinach, black nightshade, onion, and cabbage. She wants a loan of 10,000 to buy more seeds and land so she can expand her farming area. She said she would be grateful for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and land

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante A. is married with 4 children and received an education through junior high school. Dante works in Siwdo as an electrician and also sells electrical parts, which he has done for 10 years. His wife works in the same area as a trader selling banku (also known as kenkey, dumplings served with soup or stew). Dante uses his income to pay for his family’s expenses, such as food, school fees, and bills.

Dante will use the loan to purchase additional electrical parts for sale and also enhance his repair works. With the new profits from his expanded business, Dante plans to reinvest in his enterprise for continued success.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
La Sra. GUMERCINDA, es natural del distrito de Ollantaytambo ubicado en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, esta a 1 hora y 40 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de (25, 22, 20, 18, 16) años La socia alterna sus actividades hogareñas con el comercio minorista, ella compra y vende aves de corral, también está dedicada a la venta de semillas secas para su plantación, como son la cebada, trigo, maíz, frijoles, entre otros; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para así poder comprar mayor número de aves y poder tener mejor producción, ella también vende pasto en la esquina del mercado.

La socia agradece el apoyo prestado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
Gumercinda is native to the district of Ollantaytambo, in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, less than two hours from the city of Cusco. Gumercinda is 45 years old, married, and has five children, age 25, 22, 20, 18 and 16. She divides her time between household work and her small business; she buys and sells chickens and dried seeds (barley, wheat, corn, beans, etc.). Gumercinda has requested a loan so that she can buy more birds, increase production and sell feed at market. She appreciates your support and agrees to comply with the terms of her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chickens and seeds

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Johanna O. manages a small parcel of land where she and her husband, Jonathan, have been growing corn for three years. They both work very hard to provide for their needs and to take good care of their three children. Johanna is thirty-four years old. She hopes to enlarge her farm in the future.

She would like to be given a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase complete fertilizer, certified corn seeds and herbicides. The loan will help her achieve a better harvest and more income for her family.

CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners, reaches out to people so they can start and run their own businesses in order to improve their livelihood. CEVI provides their clients with loans as well as training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, certified corn seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra 1 Group

texts.fr: LE groupe sope mame diarra 1 est composé de cinq femmes qui habitent ensemble au quartier randoulène de thies ,elles font du petit commerce de produits pour femmes notamment des pagnes,des perles et de l'encens;elles ont ouvert un compte au sein de la mutuelle et veulent contracter un pret pour augmenter leur fonds de roulement
texts.en:
The Sope Mame Diarra 1 group is composed of 5 women who lived together in the Randoulène neighborhood of Thies. They are engaged in petty commerce, selling products of interest to women, notably "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), necklaces, and incense. They have opened an account with the credit union and want to request a loan to increase their working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing their working capital

loans.name: Falanisela

texts.en: Falanisela A., 38, is married and has two children. She has 3 years of experience in the ice cake and popcorn business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala . SPBD loans are Falanisela’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase popcorn, cooking oil, sugar, plastic bags, cordial, and butter

loans.name: Frozen Fish Monger Group

texts.en:
This is Marie I., Fatmata J., Rugiatu K., and Hawa S.. They named their group Frozen Fish Mongers. They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,300,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Marie I. (right) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-seven years of age. She was born in Makeni City. Her husband is a teacher and the the couple has six children. One of their children is in college, one is not yet of school age, and the rest are in primary and secondary schools. Marie has been a businesswoman for over twenty years now.

Marie sells frozen fish. She will use this new loan to expand her business by buying more cartons of frozen fish. A carton of fish usually cost her in Freetown something like Le 65,000.00, 75,000, or 95,000.00, depending on the type and quality.

loans.use: To buy additional frozen fish to sell

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny N. is a villager in Trapaing Ta Auy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. She faces the problem of having infertile soil on her land, and she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer, nor to hire a laborer with oxen to plow her field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, for plowing, and to hire laborers to work in the field. Her husband, Ek Chhoeun, is a construction worker. Aside from this work, he is also a motorbike taxi driver. Ny is forty years old and the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown with her in this picture.

loans.use: For fertilizer, for plowing, and for laborers.

loans.name: Laure

texts.en:
Laure A. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Laure is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Laure sells books and magazines in the local community. Laure has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Laure joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laure has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional books to sell. Laure is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Laure from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her book and magazine selling business

loans.name: Elea

texts.en: Elea is 58 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters who are all in school. She is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Elea is a trader. She prepares and sells palm oil in her community. She procures her raw materials from nearby communities. Elea has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Enriquieta

texts.en:
Enriquieta C. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Enriquieta is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Enriquieta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail shop. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and fruits in the local community. Enriquieta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Enriquieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enriquieta is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Enriquieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou W. lives in the village of Barangay Ayungon, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental. She is 67 years old and single. Even as she is getting on in years, Marilou is still working and doing business to earn a living to support herself and her nephew who is her dependent. She also works hard so that she will have enough savings to support herself and stay independent in her old age. To prepare for her future and to have a stable source of income, Marilou put up a general store adjacent to her house. She sells different kinds of household products for the mothers, and goodies such as candies for the children of the neighborhood. In 2000 Marilou joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to help her business expand. From that loan she was able to buy additional products for her general store and was able to put up a new food-vending business. Her good performance and dedication to improve her business was rewarded by her increasing income capacity which, in turn, allows her to borrow bigger loans to sustain her business expansion. When she was able to borrow a bigger amount, Marilou started raising pigs in her backyard to supplement her income and to have more savings for her future. Her combined business income is PHP 4,000 per month and it helps her support her household and send her nephew to school. For her 13th loan she was able to obtain PHP 16,000 and it was used as working capital. Her loan was repaid on time and in full without any delays in any of the weekly installments. For her next, 14th, loan she is borrowing the same amount of PHP 16,000, again as additional capital for her businesses. The income from this her increased business will be used for her household needs and for the renovation of her store. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Bahar Group

texts.en:
Najeba is the group leader of Bahart group. There are five members in this group. All of them would like to receive a loan for their own businesses.

Najeba and Shokarya want to take a loan for their carpentry business. Faryda and Shafeqa want to take a loan for their embroidery business. Bekam Saheb wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. They all want to buy necessary materials for their businesses.

They want to say this loan is very use full because it can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses and become stronger in their businesses and their lives. This group wants to thank this process of providing loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy materials for a carpentry business

loans.name: Sao Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Sao Ly T. is from Tuol Kandal Village, Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a 2 hectare field on which she cultivates rice. Unfortunately, her field is infertile and has a lot of insects that harm her crops. In order to deal these problems, she's decided to ask for a loan in order to be able to buy fertilizer and pesticides. Any leftover money will be used to hire laborers to plow the field. Her husband, Mr. Chin Theourn, helps her farm. Mrs. Sao Ly T. is the mother of two children, both of whom are attending the local school.

loans.use: purchasing fertilizer and pesticides
